loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 37 years old. She is married with three children and she takes care of four relatives. She sells food and drinks like: buns, cakes, biscuits, fanta, milk etc. She has two years of experience in this work and the hours of her business are from 6 a.m to 9 p.m daily every week. 

Antoinette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy a large quantities of food and drinks like: buns, cakes, biscuits, fanta, milk etc for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future, and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy a large quantities of food and drinks like buns, cakes, biscuits, fanta and milk to sell.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19500 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Jean has been in this business for 21 years. She earns more income from frozen foods.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Fatima works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation. Fatima is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat.

Fatima has been sustaining her business activities through her past fifteen loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 39 years old and married with 2 children.

Jesusa is in the agricultural business raising ducks in the Philippines. Jesusa requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy feed for her ducks.

Jesusa has been raising ducks for 6 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 43 years old. She is married with three children aged between 11 and 18 and all of them go to school. She has been selling various products in her boutique. 

With the loan, she wants to buy more cooking oil, rice, and matchboxes. The profits from the business will be used for paying school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, rice and matchboxes.

loans.name: Sheyla Alexandra

texts.es:
Sheyla es una joven muy trabajadora y entusiasta con muchos ánimos de salir adelante y sobre todo ser un orgullo para su madre con la cual vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, sus playas hermosas su agricultura en especial el cultivo algodón, maíz, y también por la pesca, podemos encontrar  también uno de los atractivos turísticos más visitados de la ciudad como lo es las Islas Ballestas y el Candelabro  de Paracas. Sheyla es muy alegre cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta mucho hacer deporte en especial jugar vóley con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le encanta comer junto a  su madre uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”. 

Con mucho entusiasmo y sobre todo mucho esfuerzo Sheyla trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 25 clientes en el día, con su trabajo apoya mucho a su madre a quien ama y quiere muchísimo y el motivo por el cual ella lucha cada día para que su madre se sienta muy orgullosa de ella, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajadora y sobre todo porque es muy amable con los clientes y por ello siempre compran sus productos.

Sheyla está muy agradecida y feliz con los  prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mostradores para poder exhibir sus productos de mejor manera y los clientes puedan apreciarlo mejor, asimismo comprara mercadería para su negocio como blusas, pantalones, poleras, entre otros para poder tener mayor variedad de productos y poder mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir luchando para salir adelante y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:  “ Poder terminar la carrera de Administración de empresas y ser el orgullo de su madre”.
texts.en: Sheyla is a very hard-working, keen young woman who has a great desire to do well in life and, above all, be a source of pride for her mother with whom she lives in the city of Pisco. Pisco is noted for its hot climate, its beautiful beaches and its agriculture. In particular, it is known for its cotton growing, corn growing and fishing. It is home to one of the most visited tourist spots in the area, the Ballestas Islands and the Candelabra of the Andes. Sheyla is very happy whenever she has any free time. She really enjoys taking part in sports. In particular, she enjoys playing volleyball with her friends and neighbors. She and her mother also enjoy eating one of their favorite dishes, the delicious 'Ají de Gallina”. With a lot of enthusiasm and effort, Sheyla works in her small business selling men's, women's and children's clothing. She works around 10 hours a day and can serve up to 25 customers each day. Through her work she supports her mother a lot. She loves her mother dearly and her motivation for working hard every day is for her mother to feel very proud of her. She believes that her business is doing well because she is very hard working and, above all, because she is very friendly to her customers. For this reason, they always buy her products. Sheyla is very grateful to Kiva lenders and very happy because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy display cases so that she can better display her products and so that her customers can see them better. She will also buy merchandise for her business such as blouses, pants and tops. This will enable her to have a wider range of products available and she will be able to improve her income, continue working hard in order to do well in life and continue working to fulfill her biggest dream: to finish a degree in business administration and for her mother to be proud of her.

loans.use: to buy blouses, tops, pants, etc.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur s’appelle Mamadou ; il est marié et père de famille. Mamadou s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires  divers  depuis 5 ans maintenant il gère une boutique. Mamadou est très assidu voir qu’il démarre sa journée à 6h du matin pour la terminer à 00h.
Il a besoin  de 250000F CFA  pour acheter des denrées alimentaires telles : de l’huile, du riz, du lait, du sucre etc. Avec ce crédit, il va augmenter son stock.
Il a comme projet futur de construire sa maison et d’y loger sa famille.
texts.en:
This borrower’s name is Mamadou. He is married with children. 

Mamadou has been selling foodstuffs for five years, and he currently runs a boutique (general store). He is very devoted, starting his day at 6:00 AM to finish at midnight. 

Mamadou is seeking a loan of 250,000CFAF to buy foosdstuffs such as oil, rice, milk, sugar, etc. He will use this loan to replenish his stock. 

His goal is to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale in his store.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is married and has three children. She is 42 and lives in Digu-an, Ozamis City, Philippines. Nelly has a retail store that sells a variety of products, and has been in business for eight years. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 3,200 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. In 2011, Nelly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Nelly wants to build a house and to have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a 33-year old resident of Tabid, Ozamis City. She provides for her four children's needs from the little amount of PHP 3,000 she gains monthly from her own banana and coconut business. She has been running this for eight years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. 

She joined GDMPC in 2011. Now she's applied for a micro loan of PHP 4,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Jennifer wants to make expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 19-year-old single man, who has worked in agriculture for four years. Hassan was only fifteen years old when he started working. Today he owns a tractor which he uses to plow his land and others, in addition to irrigating most of the land in his village. Hassan also distributes water to the houses of people who live in his village, because most of the time they lack water. 

Hassan applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to do the necessary the maintenence on his tractor. This is Hassan's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan helped a lot in improving his business and social situation, and he also started building his future house with the additional income he got.

Today his loan will be invested in doing the necessary maintenance to his tractor, and he will surely continue building his house as much as he can.
Hassan hopes to keep on expanding both businesses as much as he can in the future.

loans.use: To do the necessary maintenence on his tractor.

loans.name: Lazarus

texts.en:
Lazarus is 36 years old. He supports five people of his family. He is married to Lucy who is a business lady, and who contributes to the income of the family.

He has been in business for four years and has a monthly income of sixteen thousand two hundred Kenyan shillings. The loan will be used to buy foodstuff for the hotel such as rice and cooking fat. The anticipated profits will be used to purchase additional stock.

This is his fifth loan with KADET Ltd. and he has paid them back successfully. His hopes and dreams are to open an wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff for the hotel and purchase additional stock for the shop.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her dried fish business.

Elvie has been in this business for seven years.

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ready-to-wear clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. 

Carmelita has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from food vending. 

Carmelita has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 41 years old and married with six children.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Emma has borrowed and paid for eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Emma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from selling herbal medicines and jewellery.

In the future, Gina would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is from Dela Paz, Clarin. She is 50 years old. Maria Fe is widowed and has three children. To make a living, Maria Fe has owned and operated a transportation service for seven years. She earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2005, Maria Fe joined GDMPC. Maria Fe is requesting a loan of 19,800 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle so it gives better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle so it gives better service.

loans.name: La Benediction Group

texts.fr: Le groupement BÉNÉDICTION est composé de 13 personnes qui sont spécialisés dans de différents domaines. Certains exercent comme activité la vente des assiettes, des cuvettes, du sucre et d'autres du maïs, des beignets, de la boisson locale, des produits de premières nécessités, de l’igname. La responsable est une dame âgée de 55ans qui est spécialisée dans la vente des assiettes et cuvettes. Elle est mariée à un enseignant et a 01 enfant âgé de 30ans qui ne fréquente plus.  Elle a démarré son activité en 2005 et s’approvisionne généralement à Lomé chez les grossistes et revend dans un quartier au centre du pays. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients. Elle veut construire une boutique pour installer ses marchandises, réaliser un bon chiffre d’affaire et aider ses petits frères dans le domaine scolaire.
texts.en:
The group BÉNÉDICTION consists of 13 people who specialize in various sectors. Some sell plates, bowls, or sugar while others sell maize, beignets, local beverages, staples, or yams. 

The head of the group is a 55-year-old lady who sells plates and bowls. She is married to a teacher and the couple have one child, age 30, who no longer attends school. She started her activity in 2005, and she usually gets her merchandise from wholesalers in Lomé for resale in a district at the center of the country. 

This is her second loan from WAGES, and she is seeking this credit to stock up on merchandise to meet customer demand. 

She wants to build a boutique to display her merchandise, bolster her sales, and help to support her younger brothers’ education.

loans.use: to buy plates and bowls for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 30 years old and is married with two children between the age of two and five, and he also takes care of three relatives. He owns a motorcycle business. Agustin has four years of experience in this work. The hours of his business are from 5 a.m to 10 p.m every day each week. 

Augustin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy a new motorcycle to help him to transport people. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to help him to transport people.

loans.name: Esther Wanjiku

texts.en:
Esther used her previous loan to buy heifer cows for rearing and selling. It turned out to be profitable and she was able to pay all the loan amount.

This will be her ninth loan and she plans to use the amount to buy a heifer cow as well as fertilizer and seeds for planting on her farm. With the anticipated profits she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Esther hopes to become one of the top horticulture farmers in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a heifer, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Rio is 31 years old and lives in Lao Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Rio has a mango production business and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase labor and pesticides for mango production. 

Rio has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to repair their house.

loans.use: to purchase labor and pesticides for mango production.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is from Malaubang, Ozamis City. She is 63 years old. Pedrita is married and has two children. To make a living, Pedrita owns and operates a specialized retail store. Pedrita has engaged in her business for 12 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Pedrita joined GDMPC. 

Pedrita is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to buy products such as shampoo, toothpaste, powder for laundry, soap, sugar, salt, biscuits etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: to buy products such as shampoo, toothpaste, powder for laundry, soap, sugar, salt and biscuits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to buy gasoline for the machine that is used to plow the farm

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum is at the age of 53. He is married and has six children, three of whom are settled for marriage and are starting their new families. Chhum is involved in two businesses at the same time: a rice farming business and a granite mortar-and-pestle-making business. From the two business activities, he is able to raise his family and provide his children with basic necessities. His wife usually assists him in the businesses. 

At the present time, Chhum would like to ask for a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase raw granite from his suppliers, so that he can continuously improve his business and make it make more profitable for the family. He hopes that our lenders will help in him in strengthening and developing his current businesses.

loans.use: to purchase raw granite to make mortars and pestles.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is from Mialen, Clarin. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children. 

To make a living, she manages a fish selling business while her husband does fishing. She has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns PHP 6,832 a month for these activities. 

In 2006, Marilou joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with nine children, four of whom attend school. She is not looking after additional family members. She has been practicing poultry farming for the last twenty years, working seven days a week. She generates additional income through selling animal feeds. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her buy more animal feeds and chicks. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transport costs. Her dream is to expand her business up to 3000 laying birds and also improve on her standard of life. She joined MCDT because the terms of joining are easier. She lives in husband`s house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feeds and chicks.

loans.name: Emerazon

texts.en:
Emerazon is 33 years old and lives in Unidos. She is married with three children. Emerazon has a coconut buying business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase coconuts. 

Emerazon has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Emerazon hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase coconuts.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 33-year-old married woman with five children. She has been working in agriculture since 1996. Zeinab specializes in growing medical and cooking herbs. She is very talented in this field.

Zeinab applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to improve and increase her business production, through buying special seeds and seedlings.
 
This is Zeinab's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. With her previous loan, Zeinab was able to start a new business to increase her family's income. She opened a grocery store, which she will also support through this loan. She hopes to expand both businesses as much as she can. 

Zeinab will invest part of the loan in necessary home maintenance before the winter season.

loans.use: To improve and increase her business production, through buying special seeds and seedlings.

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en: Claudette is 33 years old. She has three children. She owns a small store and has been selling a few items in that retail store for nine years. With the loan, she wants to add more new items such as rice, soaps and cooking oil for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business. She dreams of having a prospering business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more new items such as rice, soaps and cooking oil.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 34 years old. She is married and her spouse contributes additional income to the family. She has one child who is ten years old.

She has been in this business for eight years and currently has a monthly income of eight thousand Kenyan shillings. The loan will be used to buy more stock of clothes for sale. The anticipated profits will be used to open another branch of her business in Tala town.

This is her second loan with KADET LTD and she has successfully paid up the previous loan. Her hopes and dreams are to have branches in Tala town and outside Tala town.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy various goods such as phones and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 40-year-old married man, the father of six children. Since 2004, he has owned a bakery, specialized in making Manakish traditional Lebanese breakfast. Haidar is the only person who supports his family financially, he has one employee to help him reply to almost all of his cuctomers.

Haidar has to do major surgery on his eyes. He applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, so as not to use his business capital and so it can be kept available for any needs during his absence.

Haidar hopes to come back to his work as soon as possible to keep his customers satisfied. This is Haidar's fifth cycle as Al Majmoua borrower, all his previous loans helped a lot in improving both his social and financial situation.

loans.use: To pay for necessary surgery on his eyes.

loans.name: Ahoefa

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 25ans, Madame Ahoefa est mère d’un enfant âgé de 03ans. Depuis 2007, elle vend des produits de détails (pate dentifrice, brosse à dent, produits d’alimentation générale) de façon ambulante et elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle manque de fonds pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients et sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour renforcer son activité de vente de pate dentifrice, de brosses à dent et autres. Elle veut agrandir l’activité en ouvrant une boutique et assurer un avenir radieux à son enfant.
texts.en: At 25 years old, Madame is the mother of one child, aged 3 years.  Since 2007, she has sold products (toothpaste, toothbrushes, general grocery items) as a mobile vendor and she gets her supplies in Lomé.  She lacks funds to best meet the needs of her customers and is requesting her first loan through WAGES to build up her sales of toothpaste, toothbrushes and other items. She wants to grow her business by opening a shop in order to provide a bright future for her child.

loans.use: to buy brushes, toothpaste, and other items.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ready-to-wear clothes business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing 29,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. 

Elvie has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from buying and selling livestock, farming sugarcane and selling Avon products. 

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Flutur

texts.en:
Flutur is a forty-one-year-old Egyptian woman from one of the two most vulnerable ethnic minorities in Albania. Flutur and her husband, with their children and grandchildren, live on the outskirts of a major city in the southeastern part of the country. 

Social exclusion issues extremely challenged these minorities during the Communist era. The Albanian government and international organizations have done a lot to integrate them into society, yet there's still more to be done. In the streets of major cities you still see parents and children sleeping on the cold cement, living in tents and barracks with no toilets or running water. 

The VisionFund Albania is providing assistance to these communities through loans, and Flutur is one of its clients. She has applied for a second loan, with the first one being paid off. She has been selling new clothes in nearby villages for the past six to eight years. This business has proved profitable, despite the struggles in the beginning.

Flutur’s dream is to send her grandchildren to school. She realizes this can be difficult without the support of Kiva lenders. She thanks all potential lenders in advance.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs she raises and sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various goods such as pens and books for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, detergents, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 28 years old and lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 
Marisa works in the fishing industry and sells and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy fishing materials for the fishing industry. 
Marisa has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Marisa hopes to improve her living conditions using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the fishing industry

loans.name: C8095 Imbereheza Group

texts.en:
Patrick is 42 years old and is married with four children, and he takes care of three relatives. Patrick is a leader of the group called "C8095 IMBEREHEZA." He is the one holding the sign in the picture. He sells various foods such as maize, beans, sorghum and peanuts. He currently employs three people to help him, and the hours of his business are from 6 a.m to 6 p.m every day. 

Patrick has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy various foods such as maize, beans, sorghum and peanuts for resale. With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future, to reinvest in his business, to renovate his house and to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy various foods such as maize, beans, sorghum and peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Theopiste

texts.en: Theopiste is 28. She is married to a businessman with three children. Theopiste sells clothes and has been in the business for the past nine years. She wants the loan to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more kids' clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is married and the mother of four children. She 72 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Marcelina used her last loan to pay for the labor costs in charcoal making. Her business is successful, and she's taking out a new loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase more coconut shells. In the future, she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut shells.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 50 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children. One of them is currently in school. For the past 4 years, Aidah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, and will help Aidah to generate greater profits and expand her business into a wholesale shop. Aidah hopes that in the future she will be able to build more rental houses. 

Aidah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aidah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various clothes for women for resale.

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.en:
Maria Flor is 24 years old and lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 1 child. 
Maria Flor works in the fishing industry and sells and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fishing materials for the fishing industry. 
Maria Flor has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Ms. Marisa hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the fishing industry.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 32 years old. She is married to Dominic and together they have one child. She operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of KES 15,000 from the shop.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase sugar, rice, bar soaps, and flour to stock her business.

She hopes to own a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, bar soaps, and flour to stock her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 55 years old. She sells skirts and has been in the business for 12 years. She wants the loan so she can buy more skirts to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family.

loans.use: to buy more skirts to sell.

loans.name: Alaisha

texts.en:
Alaisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with four children, three of whom attend school. She is also looking after her sister.
She has been operating a retail shop for the last 3 months in the market and works seven days a week. She earns additional income from rental houses.
She has requested for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and small jerrycans of cooking oil. Her challenges include high transport costs and the ever-increasing prices of commodities. Her dream is to make her business wholesale. She joined MCDT in order to get more capital for her business. Her house has access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and small jerrycans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Jennifer is selling snacks like cassava chips with sweet syrup traditionally known as "kipping." She has had this business for 13 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients in making snacks like sugar and cassava.
Jennifer has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jennifer hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making snacks.

loans.name: Okello

texts.en:
Okello is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children, 3 of whom are currently in school. For the past 20 years, Okello has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells plumbing equipment and bath tubs. 

To help expand his business, Okello has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to to increase his stock, and will help Okello to generate greater profits and to expand the business. Okello hopes that in the future he will be able to earn more profits. 

Okello is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Okello who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is a 48-year-old business man. He is married to Jane, who is a business lady. They are blessed with three children. He has been running a spare parts shop for the past eight years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Onesmus will use the loan to purchase spare parts. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children.  His hopes and dreams are to open another shop and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Nadin

texts.en:
Nadin is a young mother with one child from Nazareth.  After finishing high school, she studied hair styling and cosmetology with plans to open her own salon.  However, after she discovered a severe allergy to hair coloring, Nadin had to change her plans.  After gaining experience in the retail industry and beginning a business activity of selling linens and undergarments, Nadin was ready to open her own store.  She sells ladies undergarments, linens, bags and purses.  She opened her store in a central location at the Nazareth market, or souk.  Nadin has kept her original customer base and expanded to others from the area and who frequent the souk.

Nadin has requested this loan in order to purchase a shop window, stock, shelving and hanging supplies. 

Nadin wants to see her business grow as her family grows, providing a stable future and enabling her child and future children to be educated.

loans.use: to purchase a shop window, stock, shelving and hanging supplies.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 32 years old and lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. 
Juvy works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish for her business buying and selling fish.
Juvy has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Ms. Juvy hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits from her fish sales.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business buying and selling fish.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are currently in school. For the past 2 years, Henry has been working hard to manage his poultry farm, which sells chicken. 

To help expand his business, Henry has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy  more chicken feed for resale and will help Henry to generate greater profits and expand the business into a big chicken farm. Henry hopes that in the future he will be able to be a leading person in business in the whole town. 

Henry is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Henry who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed for resale.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 41 years old, married, and has three children. He does welding to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years and has two employees. Besides that, he is a farmer. Previously, he operated a retail shop.

He hopes to expand his business in five years and grow it beyond the regional level. He needs a loan of 35,000 KES to buy welding materials and a service machine.

loans.use: to buy welding materials and service machines.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline is 26 years old. She sells cattle and goats. She has been in the business for two years. She has requested the loan to buy more cattle and goats to sell. With the profits, she plans to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and goats to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make viands.

loans.name: Evgenia

texts.en:
Evgenia is 29 years old. She is married and comes from Kareli District. Evgenia lives with her family, husband, parents-in-law, and two children (6 and 7 years old). The younger child goes to kindergarten and the elder studies in the village school. The other family members earn their living through the agricultural business. They run a small dairy farm with 3 milk cows. They produce dairy food, cheese, and curds and sell them in the village. They family owns 2 hectares of land as well. Part of the land is used for vegetables; they grow tomatoes and cabbage there. On the rest of the land they have an orchard, where appletrees and plum trees are grown. Evgenia and her husband sell their harvested product in nearby villages from their own truck. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Lari.

Evgenia borrowed her first loan in 2011. She bought fertilizers and cultivated the agricultural land. She repaid the loan according the schedule.

Evgenia requests a loan for her agricultural land again. Evgenia and her husband will work hard during the spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. They will purchase fertilizers and hire workers. They will cultivate and fertilize the land. After the seasonal work is properly done they hope to get a good harvest, which will be sold for a good price. This will increase the sales. With increased income they will be able to repair the house, because the existing one is an old and uncomfortable. As a result of the above mentioned activities the family will be able to spend their evenings after hardworking days in a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay agricultural workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, soap, snacks and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 48 years old and married with eight children. With five children in school, Grace works very hard to provide for her family.

Grace runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Grace has been in this business for eight years. She sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, soap, canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the west region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Robert has been working hard to manage his poultry farm where he sells chicken. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken for resale and will help Robert to generate greater profits. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children at the university level. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken for resale.

loans.name: Ernestina Guadalupe

texts.es:
Ernestina, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo ya que considera que el credito anterior le ha brindado una gran oportunidad de mejorar sus cultivos, con este préstamo comprará materiales de construcción para hacer un corral para los cerdos, ya que actualmente tiene una cerda en proceso de gestación y quiere tenerla en un lugar adecuado, con el préstamo anterior logró comprarse también cerdos ya que ella se dedica a la comercialización de estos animales, ha logrado mantenerse en el negocio y espera seguir superándose a través de los préstamos.
Considera que ha generado una buena ganancia para su familia ya que le ha brindado lo necesario en alimentación y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ernestina is requesting a new loan since she believes that the previous loan provided her with a great opportunity to improve her farm. With this loan, she will buy construction materials to build a pen for her pigs, since she currently has a sow who will soon give birth, and she wants to give her a suitable space. With the previous loan, she was also able to buy pigs, since she works selling these animals. She has been able to continue her business, and she hopes to continue getting ahead through the loans. 

She thinks she has generated good earnings for her family, since she has provided them with the food they need and education for her children.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a pen.

loans.name: Dariimaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dariimaa is 53 years old and lives with her husband on their small plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both of them are retired and receive pensioner benefits. 

Dariimaa plants vegetables in her backyard. This year, she is planning to sell the vegetables to customers. However, first she needs some money to build a greenhouse beside her home so she can plant vegetables there. 

The loan she is requesting will be dedicated to building a new greenhouse beside her home and buying seeds for vegetable planting.

loans.use: To build a new greenhouse and buy seeds for vegetable planting.

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
Lonah is a 35-year-old married woman with two children; she sells wooden carvings to earn a living. She has been in this business for eleven years and has one employee. Lonah earns additional income working as a poultry farmer. She previously received a loan from Faulu Kenya that has helped her grow her business.

Lonah has been able to increase her savings because she has been trained on financial management. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy wooden carvings.

loans.use: to buy wooden carvings.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Matute isidro, casado de 43 años de edad, tiene por actividad economica la compra y venta de cerdo en su comunidad, actividad que tiene varios años de experiencia la cual adquirio de su familia que se dedicaba a los mismo, el esta solicitando financiamiento para la compra engorde y venta de cerdos, con el prestamo comprara: concentrado, cerdos, vacunas, vitaminas para cerdos entre otros.
texts.en: Isidro, 43, is married.  He makes his living raising and selling pigs.  He has been a pig farmer for many years.  He learned the business from parents who were also pig farmers.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy, fatten and sell pigs.  The investment will pay for: pigs, animal feed, vaccines, vitamins, etc.

loans.use: to buy pigs and supplies for his animal sales business.

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es:
Ulises es  un agricultor  de 54 años de edad , padre de familia , vive en la zona sur del país, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas en la provincia de Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Ulises está solicitando un préstamo de un millón de colones  (¢1.000.000), para la compra de semilla de maíz y de frijol , abono granular, plaguicidas y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos durante el desarrollo y evitar también que aparezcan hongos en sus plantaciones, El vende la cosecha en una asociación de la localidad y con esto mantiene a su familia y hace frente a otras obligaciones económicas, desea crecer más productivamente ya que este es su segundo préstamo, con el anterior se benefició mucho porque pudo abrirse mercado en el sector agrícola y ahora seguirá avanzando en este proyecto de la siembra y la cosecha. 
Ulises es  socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Ulises is a 54-year-old farmer and father who lives in the southern part of the country, in Concepción de Pilas, in Puntarenas province.  The local economy here is based around farming and livestock raising.  In particular, people grow tubers, coffee, corn and beans, and raise livestock.

Ulises is requesting a loan for one million colones to buy corn and bean seeds, granular fertilizer, pesticides and fungicides to protect his crops while they are growing and to avoid fungus growing in his plantations.  Ulises sells his harvests to an association in his town and thereby manages to support his family and meet his financial needs.  He would like to grow his crops more productively as this is his second loan.  His previous loan was of great benefit to him as he was able to open up a market in the farming sector.  He will now continue making progress in this project sowing and harvesting his crops.

Ulises is a member of Danta Community Loan Company Ltd., one of 150 community loan companies in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and fungicides, and to sow corn and beans

loans.name: Essokpazida Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ESSOKPAZIDA est constitué de femmes et d’hommes qui sont spécialisés dans de différents domaines. Certains exercent comme activité la vente  de graine de Néré, de céréales, de produits génériques. D’autres sont dans la vente des habits pour enfants, dans la couture, dans la vente de légumes …. La responsable se nomme Safiétou. Son conjoint est retraité et ils ont 07 enfants ,02 sont toujours sur les bancs de l’école. Le premier a 40ans et le dernier 21ans. Elle s’approvisionne à SOKODE (localité située  à environ 350km de Lomé) et  exerce au même lieu la vente de graines de néré, des pagnes et de la bouillie. Elle a démarré en 1972 et sollicite ce premier crédit de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle veut pouvoir aux besoins de la famille, assurer les besoins élémentaires des enfants et agrandir le chiffre d'affaire de son activité.
texts.en:
The group ESSOKPAZIDA consists of men and women who specialize in various sectors of activity. Some sell Néré seeds, cereals, or generic products. Others sell children’s clothing or vegetables, or they work in the sewing trade.  

The head of the group is Safiétou. Her husband is retired, and the couple have seven children aged 21 to 40, two of them still in school. 

She buys her stock in Sokode (a district located 350 km from Lomé) where she sells Néré seeds, pagnes and porridge. She started her activity in 1972, and she is seeking this first loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. 

She wants to provide for her family, meet her children’s basic needs, and bolster her sales.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise such as Nere seeds, pagnes, etc.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is a 50-year-old businessman who is married to Mary, a businesswoman. They are blessed with three children, two of whom are adults. He has been employed as a tutor at a college for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 7,500, which he uses to support his family. 

Alphonce is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Alphonce will use the loan to build rental houses on his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, Alphonce will educate his children. His hope is to build as many rental houses as he can so he can improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to build rental houses on his farm.

loans.name: Glenda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Glenda, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la granja de pollos de engorte, pues considera haber recibido un buen servicio que le ha generado hasta el momento un negocio más estable, se comprará pollos pequeños y también pulimento para alimentarlos, esto le ayudará a darle continuidad a su negocio y seguir trabajando honradamente.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue fortalecer la granja dándole unos resultados positivos pues ha generado mayores ventas que le han servido para el negocio y para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Glenda is requesting a new loan to invest in her chicken [meat] farming business.  She believes that she has received a good service which has helped her maintain a more stable business up to now.  She will buy young chickens and feed for them.  This will help her to ensure continuity in her business and she will be able to continue making an honest living.  

Glenda's previous loan had the effect of strengthening her farm, providing her with positive results.  She made more sales which helped her business and allowed her to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Simona Dominga

texts.es: Simona Dominga de 42 años de edad, con un hijo menor de edad tiene por actividad economica el destace de cerdo, actividad que inicio hace 21 años, la actividad la inicio por la necesidad de tener una fuente de empleo para ayudar con los gastos de su casa, el fiananciamiento lo quiere para compra animales en pie, leña verduras, para la elaboracion de nacatameles, carne, chicharron, charrasca, frito adobado, chingaste de cerdo.
texts.en: Simona Dominga is 42 years old. She has one minor child, and her work is butchering pigs, an activity she began 21 years ago. She started this work because of the need to have a source of employment to help with her household expenses. She wants the loan to buy live animals, as well as firewood and vegetables to prepare nacatamales, meat, fried pork, fried pork skins, seasoned fried meat, and pork bits.

loans.use: to buy live animals, firewood, and vegetables to prepare nacatamales, meat, fried pork, fried pork skins, seasoned fried meat, and pork bits.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 52-year-old married woman and has 9 children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Helen buys and sells fermented fish and salt in the Philippines, she has been in this business for 5 years. Helen requested a loan for PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mega

texts.en:
Mega is 35 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Mega has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells all essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Mega has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her inventory to wholesale, and will help Mega to generate greater profits through increased sales. Mega hopes that in the future she will be able to have a wholesale shop. 

Mega is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mega who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase her inventory to wholesale.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 54 años, es felizmente casado, vive con su amada esposa en la ciudad de Pisco, él siempre ha sido una persona muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos, quienes ahora ya son mayores y tienen sus propias familias; en sus ratos libres le gusta visitar a sus hijos y nietos ya que los adora y extraña mucho.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, desde hace más de 14 años, Juan trabaja como chofer de monta carga, ya que cuenta con gran experiencia en el manejo de maquinaria pesada; él labora un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y se encuentra muy a gusto con la labor que realiza, ya que es considerado uno de los mejores choferes de monta carga de su ciudad.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea poder terminar de construir su dormitorio y darle los acabados que necesita con materiales adecuados y resistentes; de esta manera Juan desea poder terminar la construcción total de su vivienda, así como brindar mayor seguridad y comodidad para su querida esposa.
texts.en:
Juan, 54, is happily married.  He lives with his wife in the city of Pisco.  He is an enthusiastic, hard-working man, long committed to building a better life for his 3 children.  His children are grown now, with families of their own.  In his spare time, Juan sees his children and grandchildren, all of whom are very dear to him.  
Juan has worked as a crane operator for 14 years.  He has a lot of experience operating heavy machinery now.  He works about 8 hours a day.  He likes his job and is considered one of the best crane operators in the city.  
Juan is very grateful to you and other Kiva lenders because you make it possible for him to carry out improvements to his house.  The investment will allow him to buy the materials that he needs to finish building a bedroom.  For the future, he wants to finish the rest of the construction that he's planned for the house so that it is a safe and comfortable home for him and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to his house.

loans.name: Ligia Mercedes

texts.es: Ligia Mercedes, de 39 años de edad con un hijo menor de edad tiene por actividad economica la venta de mercaderia en general como : pantalones, faldas, shorte, ropa de ñiños, vestidos, calcetines, zapatos, ropa interior, juegos de sabanas, juego de baños, pillamas, negocio que inico  hace cuatro años para poder tener una herramienta de trabajo propio y obtener ingresos para  la mantencion de su hijo.
texts.en: Ligia Mercedes, 39, makes a living buying and selling clothing and other merchandise: pants, skirts, shorts, children's clothing, dresses, sock, shoes, underwear, bathing suits, pajamas, bedding, etc.  She started the business four years ago because she needed an income of her own and a way to support her child.

loans.use: COMPRAR:  pantalones, faldas, shorte, ropa de ñiños, vestidos, calcetines, zapatos, ropa interior, juegos de sabanas, juego de baños, pillamas

loans.name: Runnel Miguel

texts.es: Runnel Miguel, casada con hijos mayores  tiene por actividad economica la venta de mercaderia en general , actividad que inicio desde muy joven  por la necesidad que tenian de tener un medio de vida ya que sus padres eran muy probres y no le podian ayudar con sus estudio , decidio inciar un negocio propio, en la actualidad ha sido su medio de vida muy rentable el cual le ha permito sacar adelante a su familia e hijos,  Runnel Miguel esta solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en mercaderia ya que tiene varios encargos de sus cliente por la celebracion del dia del padre como: camisas, calcetines, pañuelos,pantalones de vestir, camisetas cuello en v, ropa interior de hombre, entre otros.
texts.en: Runnel Miguel is married and has grown-up children.  His business is selling general merchandise.  He started out in this line of work when he was very young as he needed a way to make a living because his parents were very poor and couldn't help him with his education.  He therefore decided to set up his own business.  Runnel Miguel's business has been very profitable and has allowed him to provide for his family and children.  He is requesting this loan to invest in merchandise as he has a number of orders from his customers for Fathers' Day and so needs to buy shirts, socks, scarves, dress pants, v-necked t shirts, men's underwear, etc.

loans.use: to buy shirts, socks, scarves, dress pants, v-necked t shirts, men's underwear, etc.

loans.name: Mirian Margarita

texts.es:
Mirian es una mujer de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus 4 hijos, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias desde hace varios años se separó de su pareja, ahora ella dedica todos sus esfuerzos para sacar adelante a su familia; ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora, empeñosa y entusiasta; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Educación; en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear en compañía de sus hijos por las acogedoras calles de la ciudad.
Gracias al apoyo de su familia y a su gran deseo por superarse, desde hace varios años, Mirian puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana ella  llega a sus corrales para limpiar, alimentar y cuidar a sus cerdos, ella se encuentra a gusto con la labor que realiza ya que siempre le ha gustado criar animalitos.
Mirian se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra del alimento para sus cerdos, así también utilizará la ayuda para vacunar a los cerdos que se encuentran pequeños; de esta manera Mirian podrá alimentar y mantener en buenas condiciones a sus animalitos y con ello espera poder incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos para así poder aumentar la cantidad de cerdos para su venta, asegurando de esta manera el futuro y bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirian is a 45-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica, in Parcona district, with her four children.  Sadly, for a number of reasons, Mirian separated from her partner some years ago.  She now puts all her efforts into providing for her family.  She has always been a very hard-working, determined and enthusiastic woman.  Unfortunately, owing to her need to work and cover her expenses, she was not able to study for a college degree.  However, she would have liked to have studied for a degree in Education.  In her free time, Mirian enjoys going for walks through the welcoming streets of her city together with her children.

Thanks to her family's support and her great desire to do well in life, Mirian set up her own business some years ago raising and selling pigs.  She works approximately eight hours a day, every day, in her business.  Early every morning, she goes out to her pens to clean, feed and care for her pigs.  She is happy with the work that she does because she has always enjoyed raising animals.

Mirian is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy feed for her pigs.  She will also vaccinate her young pigs.  This means she will be able to feed her animals and keep them in good condition.  She hopes to be able to increase her sales and income so that she can increase the number of pigs she sells.  In this way, she will be able to guarantee her children's future and well-being.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vaccines

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en: Mrs. Mendbayar, 31, is a hairdresser. She started her business two years ago in some rental rooms. She lives with her husband and her son in a ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family owns a house, which she inherited from her parents, but it is old and uncomfortable to live in. Also, it emits heat through the walls and corners. It has become the main reason why she spends too much for coal and other fuels. So, that is why she wants to repair her house walls by installing insulation. She needs some building materials such as bricks, cement, rock, wool and other insulation materials. Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C, even in the cities.  Also, in the summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  In addition, the extremely toxic smoke from cars is one of the main reasons Mongolia has so much air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems, and buy cars that run on natural gas.  We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan she is taking out will be used to buy materials for her house's wall insulation.

loans.use: To buy materials for her house's wall insulation

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque iniciara un nuevo cultivo, para ello deberá como cada inicio comprarse los insumos necesarios como el abono, herbicidas, insecticidas para aplicarlos con el objetivo de prevenir las plagas y aumentar la producción de los cultivos. 
El considera que a través de los prestamos está logrando crecer en sus cultivos, obteniendo mejores cosechas; del préstamo anterior al igual que este logro comprarse los insumos necesarios para aplicarlos a la milpa.
texts.en: Jose is applying for a loan that he will use for his next crop.  He needs supplies--fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, etc.--that will increase his yield and protect his crop from disease and pests.  He says that your loans are helping him to increase his production and improve his business.  Like this loan, he used your last one to buy the supplies he needed for the crop before.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Rebeca Florinda

texts.es:
La señora Rebeca Florinda esta casada, tiene 38 años de edad, cursó los 2 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la tejeduria, inicio este trabajo como operaria y hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para completar el costo de un terreno que va ha adquirir, espera  en el futuro tener su propio terreno y mejorar su negocio actual, para que pueda dar una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rebeca Florinda is married, 38 years old, and completed 2 years of primary education. She has 4 children, 1 of whom is still studying. Rebeca dedicates herself to the art of weaving. She began this work as an operator and at present, she has 20 years experience. Rebeca can count on the help of her husband.

She is requesting a loan which she will use to finish paying off the cost of a piece of land she is acquiring. In the future, Rebeca hopes to have her own land and improve her present business, so that she can offer her family better conditions of life.

loans.use: purchase a piece of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a backup power generator for his business.

loans.name: Gilberto German

texts.es:
Gilberto es un joven de 21 años de edad, el cual vive en la linda ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, sus playas hermosas su agricultura en especial el cultivo algodón, maíz, y también por la pesca, podemos encontrar  también uno de los atractivos turísticos más visitados de la ciudad como lo es las Islas Ballestas y el Candelabro  de Paracas. Gilberto vive junto a su madre a la cual apoya mucho ya que su madre lo crio sola porque su padre lo abandono y ella fue madre y padre para él y por ello con el fruto de su trabajo la apoya ya que le agradece mucho todo el esfuerzo que ella hizo por sacarlo adelante. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear para poder despejarse de las preocupaciones.  Gilberto trabaja desde hace mas 7 mese como recepcionista en una empresa de turismo como recepcionista, trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y amable con los clientes que van a la empresa y por ello sus jefes le tienen mucha consideración.

Gilberto está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el  podrá realizar un mejora miento en su vivienda como la construcción de un cuarto con material noble ya que actualmente vive en un modulo, mas aun que es época de invierno y el frio es muy fuerte, de esta manera el podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y poder seguir luchando cada día para poder darle lo mejor a su madre y vivir de manera digna y seguir trabajando en busca de hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ayudar a su madre  a construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en:
Gilberto is a young man of 21 who lives in the beautiful town of Pisco, known for its warm climate, lovely beaches, agriculture (particularly cotton and maize), and fishing. Tourists to the town often visit the Islas Ballestas and the Candelabra at Paracas.

Gilberto lives with his mother whom he helps a great deal. She brought him up as his father abandoned the family so she was both mother and father to him. Gilberto now gives her a lot of assistance as he is very grateful for all the effort she put in on his behalf. 

When he has free time, he likes to out walking as it clears his mind of all worries. He has worked as a receptionist for over seven months in a tourist business. He works about nine hours a day and believes that his job is going well as he is very responsible and friendly to the customers who use his services. His bosses are very pleased with him.

Gilberto is very grateful to Kiva donors as the loan will help him to improve his house. He wishes to build a room out of quality materials as at the moment it is very rudimentary. Winter is approaching when it gets very cold. He would like to have better standard of living for both himself and his mother, live a decent life, and realize his greatest dream: help his mother build a solid, durable home.

loans.use: build a room out of quality materials

loans.name: Patricia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Patricia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, con el objetivo de continuar brindando un buen servicio a los clientes, manteniendo su negocio surtido de la mercadería más necesaria, además necesita comprarse un estante donde pueda colocar más ordenadamente los productos para que sean vistos por los clientes.
Con este préstamo logrará mejorar la apariencia del negocio y tener la oportunidad de crecer en su inventario, manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior realizó una buena inversión que hasta el momento ha mejorado su situación en el negocio y su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Patricia is requesting a new loan with the aim of continuing to provide a good service to her customers, keeping her business stocked with the most essential merchandise.  She also needs to buy shelves so that she can display her products more neatly and they can be seen by her customers.  

With this loan, Patricia will manage to improve the appearance of her business and have the opportunity to increase her stock.  She says that her previous loan was a good investment.  It improved both her business situation and her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy shelves and merchandise

loans.name: Rudit Veronica

texts.es:
Rudit, tiene 32 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos, es madre soltera y vive con sus hijos y hermano en una colonia suburbana de la ciudad de San Pedro Sula.
Ella ha buscado como generar ingresos y hace tres años estableció su propio taller de zapatería, donde confecciona zapatos para damas en general. Adquirió experiencia en el taller de su ex esposo donde trabajaba como empleada, ahora trabaja lo propio. El pequeño taller lo tiene en su casa, y ya tiene su clientela establecida. El préstamo que solicita es por 6,000.00 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como suela, cuero,  pegamentos, hebillas y otros para confeccionar los zapatos. Ella espera mejorar sus ingresos y cumplir con los pedidos pendientes que tiene que entregar en septiembre. Su meta es llegar a tener su propia casa y establecer el negocio en un local más grande y aumentar la producción para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y mejorar su estabilidad económica. Agradece a ODEF ya KIVA por la oportunidad crediticia.
texts.en:
Rudit is 32 years old and has four children. She is a single mother and lives with her children and her brother in a suburban neighborhood in the city of San Pedro Sula.

Rudit was looking for way to generate income, so three years ago she established her own shoemaking shop where she produces women’s shoes. She acquired experience at her ex-husband’s workshop where she worked as an employee, but now she has her own establishment. Her small workshop is located in her house and she has an established customer base.

The loan she is requesting is for 6,000 HNL and will be invested in materials such as soles, leather, adhesives, buckles, and other supplies for making shoes. She hopes to improve her income and fulfill the pending orders that she has to deliver in September. Her goal is to have a house of her own and establish her business in a larger space so that she can increase production, offer more variety to her customers, and improve her financial stability. Rudit is grateful to ODEF and Kiva for this credit opportunity.

loans.use: to buy soles, leather, adhesives, buckles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 30 años, soltero. Vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su madre y hermanos, él es una persona muy trabajadora y entusiasta, con un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos, no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Educación; en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de la ciudad y en algunas de estas oportunidades aprovecha para comer un riquísimo Pescado Frito.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Luis trabaja como chofer de una mototaxi, él no cuenta con una movilidad propia, motivo por el cual tiene que arrendar una mototaxi para realizar su labor, él trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, en las cuales puede atender un promedio de 40 cliente; Luis cuenta con buena afluencia de clientes debido a su buen servicio y al trato amable y respetuoso que ofrece a sus clientes.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de sus vivienda, él desea poder construir el segundo baño de su casa, así como levantar una pared para terminar de cercar su patio; de esta manera Luis espera poder brindar mayor seguridad y comodidad a su familia y en poco tiempo espera poder adquirir una mototaxi propia para seguir trabajando y luchando por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Luis, 30, is single.  He lives with his mother, brothers and sisters in the Parcona district of Ica.  He is a hard-working, enthusiastic man with a strong drive to get ahead.  He would have liked to go to college but, sadly, he didn't have the resources for it.  He had to pay the bills, so he went to work instead.  If he hadn't had to work, he would have studied for a degree in Education.  In his spare time, he likes walking the comfortable, familiar streets of his city and searching out the best pescado frito, a traditional dish.
Luis operates a mototaxi business.  He started the business with help from his mother, but he didn't have enough money to buy a mototaxi so he's had to rent one.  He works 10 hours a day, more or less, and, on average, carries 40 passengers.  He has a reliable base of customers because he provides a good service and treats everyone with respect and good cheer.  Luis is grateful to you and other Kiva lenders because your loans will make it possible for him to improve his house.  He wants to add a second bathroom and build a wall to enclose his patio.  The investment will make the house safer and more comfortable for him and his family.  For the future, he wants to buy a mototaxi of his own so that he can grow his business and, in turn, his income.

loans.use: to carry out improvements to his house.

loans.name: Ana Dinora

texts.es:
Ana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para realizar compras de mercadería para el negocio, su objetivo es obtener prendas de vestir con nuevos estilos en blusas, camisas, faldas, pantalones y ropa interior, pues esto le ayudará para poder atender a la clientela con mayor variedad en ropa.
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, manteniendo un inventario surtido lo que le ha permitido aumentar su clientela y poder mejorar sus ganancias en el negocio, con su familia se encuentra estable apoyándose en sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Ana is asking for a new loan to buy new merchandise for her business.  Her objective is to obtain new types of clothes and new styles of blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, and underwear, since this will help her to be better able to serve her customers with a better variety of clothing options.

She had a positive result with her former loan, maintaining a well-stocked inventory has allowed her to increase her customer base and be able to gain more profits from her business.  Her family finds themselves more economically stable, as she is better able to help with their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, and underwear.

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, debido a la necesidad que presenta en el negocio, pues su inventario está disminuyendo para ello cree necesaria la compra de queso, crema, cuajada, ropa para niños y niñas, esto le ayudará a solventar la necesidad de mercadería en el negocio y continuar atendiendo su clientela.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo dándole una mejor disponibilidad de productos, lo que hasta el momento le ha ayudado a mantenerse y a poder cubrir las necesidades económicas de su familia, ya que considera que la inversión fue muy favorable.
texts.en:
Veronica has decided to request a new loan, due to the present needs of her business. Veronica's inventory is diminishing and she wishes to buy cheese, cream, cottage cheese, and clothing for boys and girls. This will help her satisfy the need for new merchandise in her business and enable her to continue fulfilling her clientele's requirements.

The result of her earlier loan was positive, offering her greater availability of products. This has allowed her to maintain her business up to the present and to cover the economic necessities of her family. So much so that she believes the investment was very beneficial.

loans.use: purchase cheese, cream, cottage cheese, and clothing for boys and girls to sell.

loans.name: Robert Alejandro

texts.es:
Robert  tiene 43 años de edad y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas llamada La Danta.  La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Su ingreso es único en su hogar, anteriormente había solicitado un primer crédito, el cual le fue de gran ayuda en  el desarrollo de sus proyectos productivos, Robert está solicitando un nuevo préstamo de  quinientos mil colones (¢500.000), para  la siembra de ñampí  (producto de gran consumo nacional) y darle mantenimiento a su cosecha por medio de abono y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos de plagas y hongos que puedan afectar la producción mientras se desarrolla, también necesita comprar herramienta agrícola y pagar mano de obra durante el proceso tanto de siembra como de cosecha,  gracias a este préstamo podrá seguir desarrollando esta actividad y sembrando estos productos pues esta labor es precisamente la que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia. 
El pertenece como muchos otros agricultores de la zona a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Robert is 43 years old and lives with his family in a community called La Danta, in the south of Costa Rica, in Concepción de Pilas, in Puntarenas province.  The local economy is based on agriculture.  In particular, people grow tubers, coffee, corn and beans, and raise livestock.

Robert's income is the only one his household has.  He previously requested his first loan which was a great help to him in developing his projects.  He is requesting a new loan for 500,000 colones for sowing taro (a crop which is very popular in his country) so that he can maintain his crops, using fertilizer and fungicides to protect them from pests and fungi that can affect production while they are growing.  He also needs to buy some agricultural tools and pay laborers to help with his sowing and harvesting.  Thanks to this loan, he will be able to continue making progress in his business and sowing these products.  It is through this work that he is able to provide for his family.

Robert, in common with many other local farmers, is a member of La Danta Community Credit Company Ltd, one of the 150 community credit companies in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy taro seeds, fertilizer and fungicides

loans.name: Maria Ursula

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque quiere invertir nuevamente en el negocio, reforzándolo con más productos para elaborar la venta, se comprará plátanos verdes para ser tostadas, el aceite que es muy necesario y la leña que le sirve para el cocimiento de los productos; esto le ayudará para que María continúe trabajando su familia.
Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior se ha logrado mantener realizando las ventas, ha tenido una buena respuesta de sus clientes pues hasta el momento ha logrado mantener un nivel de ganancia para su familia, todo esto lo considera que fue a través del préstamo que se le brindó y la buena inversión que realizó.
texts.en:
