María is asking for a new loan because she wants to invest, once again, in her business, reinforcing it with a greater variety of products to fill her sales space.  She will buy green plantains to be fried, the oil that is necessary for this, and the firewood that will serve to let her cook her products.  This will help Maria to continue working for her family.

She declares that with the previous loan, she has been able to continue her sales business, she has had a good response from her customers, and up to this moment, she has been able to maintain an income for her family.  All of this, she considers to be a result of the loan that she was given and the good investments that she made.

loans.use: to buy plantains, oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Esther Maria

texts.es: Esther María tiene 47 años con un 1 hijo menor de edad al cual tiene que mantener junto con su esposo. Tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa usada esta emprendedora inicio desde  hace 15 años. Que vende de forma ambulante ella se siente muy agradecida porque gracias a fundación 2000 ha podido seguir adelante el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar ropa como pantalones, camisas entre otros.
texts.en: Esther María is 47 years old with one minor child who she takes care of along with her spouse.  As her means of economic support, she sells used clothing, a business which she began about 15 years ago.  She sells her clothing on foot.  She feels very thankful because thanks to the Fundación 2000 she has been able to continue moving forward with the financing she needs to buy clothing like pants and shirts, among others.

loans.use: to buy clothing like pants and shirts, among others.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en el negocio, pues crea necesario mantener un buen nivel de inventario en los medicamentos que son demandados por los clientes, se comprará vitaminas, antibióticos, curativas para algunas enfermedades crónicas, y otros productos que sean para limpieza corporal, esto le ayudará a mejorar el negocio y a poder brindar un mejor servicio a la clientela.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, dándole la mercadería necesaria para continuar brindando a los clientes un buen servicio con medicamentos de calidad, ha contado con trabajo permanente para poder obtener las ganancias y cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor is requesting a new loan to invest in his business as he believes it is necessary to keep a good quantity of the medicines that his customers demand in stock. He will buy vitamins, antibiotics, healing medicines for some chronic illnesses and other products that are used for body cleansing.  This will help him to improve his business and provide a better service to his customers.

Víctor's previous loan had a positive effect as it gave him the merchandise he needed to continue providing a good service to his customers, offering them good-quality medicines.  He has had permanent work which has enabled him to make profits and cover his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, antibiotics and other medicines

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es:
Con 21,000 pesos Máximo podrá comprar mercancía para reabastecer su negocio. Máximo ha estado vendiendo frutas desde hace 11 años. Con los ingresos generados por este negocio cada día sustenta a su familia. Sin embargo su negocio se ha visto afecado en los los últimos meses, ya que hace varios meses su esposa enfermó severamente y tuvo que tomar su capital de trabajo para pagar los medicamentos de su esposa e incluso tuvo que recurrir a los loan sharks. Con este préstamo Máximo desea estabilizarse y recapitalizar su negocio, ya que los intereses semanales pagados a los loan sharks le estaban impidiendo incluso llevar el sustento a su casa.
Máximo es casado y tiene tres hijos de 13, 12 y ocho años que están en la escuela. Su mayor deseo es instalar su propia tienda de venta de alimentos, frutas y vegetales.
texts.en:
With 21,000 pesos Máximo will be able to buy merchandise to restock his business.  Máximo has been selling fruit for 11 years.  He supports his family with the income generated every day from this business.

Nevertheless, he has noticed that his business has been affected in the past months.  This is because his wife became severely ill a few months ago.  He had to take his work capital to pay for his wife’s medications.  He even had to turn to loan sharks.

With this loan Máximo wishes to stabilize and recapitalize his business.  The weekly interest payments to the loan sharks have been an impediment, even to supporting his household.

Máximo is married and has three children, ages 13, 12, and 8.  The children go to school.

His greatest wish is to establish his own food, fruit, and vegetable store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria forma parte del Banco Comunal “Fénix” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro de ventas de comidas, desde hace 1 mes. Comenta que trabaja en conjunto con su marido, ya que ella realiza los almuerzos y su marido es quien los distribuye en donde él trabaja, su negocio lo ubica en su propia casa, trabaja de lunes a viernes y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en diferentes supermercados y distribuidoras de alimentos, algunas veces compra ha  pedido su mercadería en distribuidoras  y se la entregan  directamente en su casa.
Una de las metas de Maria en su negocio es ampliar su casa para tener un gran almacén y así atender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad.
Con el crédito comprará un refrigerador más grande, además verduras, legumbres, masas, para abastecer su negocio.
Maria vive junto a su esposo y su hijo pequeño de 7 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel familiar son llevar de paseo a su hijo a conocer la nieve e integrarlo a talleres de baile folklórico.
Maria está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de entretención. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Maria is part of the "Fénix" communal bank, which belongs to the town of Talca.
She has been in the food sales business for a month. She comments that she works alongside her husband, since she prepares the lunches and her husband is the one who distributes them in his workplace. Her business is located in her own home. She works Monday through Friday and organizes her hours according to her availability.
She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs in various supermarkets and food distributors. Sometimes she orders her merchandise from distributors and they deliver it directly to her home.
One of Maria's goals for her business is to enlarge her house in order to have a big store and therefore serve her customers more comfortably.
With the loan she will purchase a larger refrigerator, as well as vegetables, legumes and pasta, in order to stock up her business.
Maria lives with her husband and her little 7-year-old son, who goes to school. Her dreams, as far as her family goes, are to take her son on a trip so he can see snow for the first time and also to sign him up for folkloric dance lessons.
Maria is very glad and thankful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her, since it has allowed her to invest in her business. Furthermore, she feels very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs from the communal bank, because they share various interests and activities which have also served as leisure moments for her. As for the training given in the meetings, she has learned to manage her business in a better way.
Talca belongs to the region of Maule, located in the country's central area. It's the administrative, economic and cultural center of the region, and it's the most important town in the Chilean Central Valley. In Chile, Talca is curiosly referred to using the phrase "Talca, París, Londres" ("Talca, Paris, London"). Among the legends told about that, some say that it derives from the original saying by an Englishman, "Talca parece Londres" ("Talca is like London"), because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the town in wintertime, reminiscent of the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to purchase a larger refregerator, as well as vegetables, legumes and pasta in order to stock up her business.

loans.name: Yeiner

texts.es:
Yeiner  es un joven  20 años de edad , toda su vida la ha pasado al lado de sus padres ayudando en la siembra y cosecha de diferentes productos , por eso conoce bien este oficio, ahora vive con su pareja con la cual pretende formar su propia familia y para ello se ha propuesto alcanzar metas y salir adelante, él vive en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Yeiner  está solicitando un préstamo de quinientos mil colones (¢500.000.00) para comprar almácigo de café (plantas de café pequeñas) para lograr hacer más almácigo y luego venderlo a otros  productores, este producto es muy cotizado en el ámbito de los cafetaleros de la zona.
Yeiner es muy joven, y se ha propuesto muchas metas ,  es además una persona esforzada, positiva y llena de esperanzas, este será su primer préstamo. El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal en la Danta, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica
texts.en:
Yeiner is a young man of 20 who has spent his whole life alongside his parents, helping them to sow and harvest their different crops.  For this reason, he knows his work well.  Yeiner now lives with his partner with whom he intends to form his own family.  With this in mind, he has plans to achieve goals and get ahead in life.  He lives in a community in the south of Costa Rica, in Concepción de Pilas, in Puntarenas province.  The local economy is agriculture based.  In particular, people sow tubers, coffee, corn and beans, and raise livestock.

Yeiner is requesting a loan for 500,000 colones to buy coffee seedlings so that he can prepare more seedbeds and then sell to other producers.  This product is very much sought-after among local coffee farmers.

Yeiner is very young and he has set himself many goals.  He is a hard-working, positive person who is full of hope.  This will be his first loan.

Yeiner is a member of La Danta Community Credit Company, one of EDESA's 150 member organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura forma parte del Banco Comunal “Jesus Obrero” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó.
Ella se dedica al rubro de contador, desde hace 20 años. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a viernes en su casa y otras veces en una oficina ubicada en el centro de su ciudad, para movilizarse al centro ocupa su vehículo así acorta un poco las distancias y le ayuda en las compras para sus insumos en sus dos negocios. 
Comenta que sus insumos los compra en la ciudad de Santiago y en distribuidoras a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito Una de sus metas es tener un local en el centro para mayor comodidad tanto para ella como para  su clientela, ya que algunos se dirigen a su casa y otros a la oficina del centro.
Laura vive junto a su hijo de 21 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando en la Universidad. Sus sueños son comprar un terreno para instalarse con un local establecido y atender a todo su clientela en un mismo lugar, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Laura está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras el grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the Communal Bank “Jesus Obrero” which is located in the city of Curicó. She has worked as an accountant for 20 years. Laura says that she works from her home Monday through Friday, but on other occasions she works at an office located in the central part of the city. In order to get downtown, she drives a vehicle that is also used for traveling short distances to buy supplies for her two business locations. Laura mentions that her supplies are purchased in the city of Santiago and from distributors at low cost, which is financially convenient. With this loan, one of her goals is to have a location downtown that is more comfortable for her as well as her clients, some of whom come to her house while the others go to her office.

Laura lives with her 21-year-old son who is studying at the university. Her dreams include buying a piece of property where she can relocate her practice and attend to all of her clients at the same place. This will help her generate more income and lead to a better quality of life. Laura is very pleased and appreciative of the opportunity provided by Fondo Experanza to invest in her business. In addition, she feels very comfortable being in the presence of other entrepreneurs in her Communal Bank group with whom she shares different activities and interests. Their meetings also provide her with a moment of distraction.

Curicó is located in the region of Maule, an area in the central part of the country. The climate in Curicó is similar to that of the Mediterranean and is considered to be one of the most pleasant in the country. Curicó is also known for its wine culture and the natural beauty of its surrounding areas. Even though the job market has gotten stronger, this area continues to be one of the poorest in the country according to the last census.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her accounting practice and to pay for repairs to her vehicle.

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Estrellas” está conformado por 21 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, almacén, repostería, peluquería, tejidos, confección de buzos, servicio de fotocopiado y anillado, servicios entre otros. Todos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Rosa, tesorera del grupo Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de izquierda a derecha, vistiendo un chaleco de color rojo, su cabello es claro y lo usa corto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de bazar y recargas celulares, desde hace 3 meses. Comenta que trabaja sola de lunes a domingo, y el horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ya que su negocio lo ubica en su propia casa y su clientela llega hasta muy tarde por recargas de celulares, lo que la tiene contenta por generar ingresos para su casa.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando para abastecer su negocio,  los compra en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará artículos escolares, específicamente temperas, lápices de colores, corrector entre otros.
Las metas en su negocio son abarcar mucho más con mercadería y tener la posibilidad de agrandar su negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Rosa vive junto a su esposo, un hijo, su nuera y su nieta pequeña de 3 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral son ampliar su negocio y abastecerlo de muchos productos para su clientela, para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Rosa está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Estrellas' (Stars).  It is made up of 21 entrepreneurs who work in commerce selling clothing, running a grocery store, making confectionery, hair dressing, making knitted goods, making sports clothing, providing a photocopying and binding service, etc.  They are all from the city of Talca.

Rosa is the treasurer of this community bank.  In the photo, she can be seen standing in the second row, third from the left.  She is wearing a red sweater and has short hair.

Rosa has been selling a variety of merchandise and offering cell phone top ups for three months.  She says that she works alone, from Monday to Sunday.  Her work hours depend upon her availability as her business is located in her home and her customers come to visit her until very late in the evening looking for cell phone top ups.  This makes her happy because she is making income for her household.

Rosa buys the merchandise and supplies that she needs for her business in the city of Santiago at low cost.  This is financially convenient for her.

Rosa will use her loan to buy school supplies, specifically paints, colored pencils, notebooks, correction fluid, etc.

Rosa's business goals are to stock up with a lot more merchandise and to grow her business so that she can make more income.  This will enable her to enjoy a better quality of life.

Rosa lives together with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and 3-year-old granddaughter.  Her dreams for her work are to expand her business and to stock it with a lot of products for her customers.  This will enable her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

Rosa is very happy and grateful for the loan and other services provided by Fondo Esperanza.  She also says that she feels very comfortable with her community bank and the meetings they attend because there is a lot of generosity and unity.

Talca is located in Maule region, in the central area of the country.  It is the administrative, financial and cultural center of the region, being the most important city in the Chilean Central Valley.  There is a strange reference to Talca in Chile in a phrase which goes 'Talca, Paris and London'.  There are a number of myths surrounding this phrase. Some say that it comes from something an Englishman once said ("Talca parece Londres" - "Talca is like London") owing to the fog that frequently covers the city during the winter season, just as it does in the UK capital.

loans.use: to buy school supplies (paints, colored pencils, correction fluid, etc.)

loans.name: Josefina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Josefina, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en mercadería para surtir la tienda, se comprará una variedad de boquitas, gaseosas, jugos, dulces, y otros que son demandados por los clientes y de los cuales en este momento está careciendo en el negocio.
Manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logró comprarse una buena cantidad de mercadería que surtió su negocio y que tuvo la aceptación de los clientes aumentando el de sus ventas, esto le está ayudando para poder ofrecerles su familia una mejor solvencia económica y tener la oportunidad de crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Josefina is asking for a new loan to invest in merchandise to fill her store.  She will buy a variety of snacks, sodas, juices, sweets, and other items which her customers ask for, and which are at this time absent from her store.

It happens that with the previous loan, she was able to buy a great quantity of merchandise to fully stock her store, and she had a good response from her customers, increasing her business.  This loan is helping her to offer her family a better economic solvency and to have the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, sodas, juices, and sweets.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre de 59 años, se encuentra felizmente casado, vive con su esposa en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago, él tiene 5 hijos mayores los cuales algunos de ellos ya son casados y viven con sus respectivas familias; Pablo siempre ha sido una persona muy trabajadora y entusiasta, que ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Educación, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver programas educativos y noticieros en televisión y en algunas ocasiones gusta de comer un rico Lomo Saltado en compañía de toda su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, desde hace muchos años se dedica a trabajar en su pequeña parcela, él cuenta con un terreno de una hectárea donde cultiva algodón y vid, desde tempranas horas de la mañana Pablo se dedica a realizar labores de campo en su cultivo, adicionalmente trabaja como peón en un fundo cercano a su hogar; Pablo se siente a gusto realizando su labor ya que siempre le ha gustado mucho las labores de campo.
Pablo se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de maderas, palos y alambres para cambiar los soportes de su cultivo de vid; de esta manera Pablo tendrá su cultivo en mejores condiciones y podrá lograr que su sembrío se desarrolle satisfactoriamente, para así poder lograr su venta e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales poco a poco espera poder utilizar para terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en: Pablo is a 59-year-old, happily married man who lives with his wife in the city of Ica, in Santiago district. Pablo has 5 grown-up children. Some of his children are already married and live with their respective families. Pablo has always been a very hard-working, enthusiastic person who has put all his efforts into providing for his family. Unfortunately, as he needed to work and cover his expenses, he was unable to study for a college degree. However, he would have liked to have studied for a degree in Education. In his free time, Pablo enjoys watching educational programs and news programs on the television. He also enjoys eating delicious 'lomo saltado' together with his whole family. As a result of his own initiative, and thanks to the support of his family, Pablo has been working on his small plot of land for many years. He has a one hectare lot where he grows cotton and vines. He gets up early every morning to work on his land. In addition, he also works as a day laborer on a large farm near his home. Pablo feels happy doing the work he does because he has always really enjoyed farming. Pablo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, he will be able to buy wood, poles and wire to replace his vine supports. This will create better conditions for his crops and they will develop satisfactorily. This will enable him to sell his crops and increase his income which he hopes to gradually use to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy wood, poles and wire to replace his vine supports

loans.name: Cañadita Group

texts.es:
El comite de Cañadita es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, son mujeres muy unidas, que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Angela es la presidenta del grupo, y cuenta que todas ellas siempre se reúnen para poder ayudarse y resolver cualquier problema que puedan llegar a tener. Angela tiene una despensa bien surtida, donde provee a todas las personas de su barrio, es muy activa y cuenta que tiene un sueño de querer agrandar su despensa y así seguir ayudando, por medio de ella, a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, azúcar, leche, yerba y demás productos de primera necesidad, con lo cual podrá seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad de productos a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
To committee of "Cañadita" is from the city of San Lorenzo, and they are very like-minded women, who find the strength to move forward in life together and help each other.

Angela is the president of the group, and she says that everyone always gets together to be able to help each other and solve whatever problem they may come to have.  Angela has a well-stocked grocery, where she provides all the people in her neighborhood with necessities.  She is very active, and says that she has a dream of wanting to expand her store and in this way continue helping, by way of herself, all of her family.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy drinks, sugar, milk, yerba, and other necessities with which she will be able to continue offering a variety of products to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, milk, yerba, and other products.

loans.name: Silviya

texts.ru:
Сильвия просит предоставить ей кредит для закупки сезонного товара - летних блузок и юбок. Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Сильвия получила дополнительную прибыль - около 1,600 гривен.

У Сильвии есть сын, который перешел учиться в новую школу. Маме нужно больше следить за сыном, чтобы он хорошо учился и не пропускал уроки. 

Сильвия надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и закончить начатый дома ремонт.
texts.en:
Silviya is requesting a loan to purchase seasonal merchandise - summer blouses and skirts. Thanks to her previous loan, she was able to make around 1,600 hryvnia in additional profits.

Silviya has a son who recently transferred to a new school. As a mom, she needs keep and eye on him and make sure that he studies hard and does not skip classes.

Silviya hopes to once again make additional profits and use them to finish repairs in her home.

loans.use: to buy summer merchandise - blouses and skirts

loans.name: Keilyn

texts.es:
Keylin es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su bebe de 8 meses en la una  comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas llamada La Danta. Aquí la economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.
Ella siembra la tierra  para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ,   produce frijol y maíz , conoce bien el oficio ya que pertenece a una familia de agricultores .
Esta actividad es  muy común en la zona tanto  para hombres como para mujeres.  Keylin está solicitando un préstamo de seiscientos mil colones (¢ 600.000.00) para comprar abono  de desarrollo y abono nutritivo,  esenciales para el buen desarrollo del producto   y fungicidas para  proteger sus cultivos durante todo el proceso   hasta la cosecha , de esta manera ofrecerá al consumidor un excelente producto  de muy  buena calidad.
Su objetivo es salir adelante económicamente , mejorar su casa y colaborar con los gastos económicos de su hogar.
Keylin  es una socia más  que se ha  integrado a  la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, una de las 150 empresas de crédito comunal de Costa Rica y este es su segundo préstamo.
texts.en:
Keylin is a youth of 20 years who lives with her husband and her baby of eight months in a community in the South of  Costa Rica, located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas also called La Danta.  Here, the local economy is based in agricultural activities, focusing on the planting of  tubers, coffee, corn, beans, and livestock breeding.

She plants her lands to help her husband with the household expenses, and she produces beans and corn.  She is well acquainted with this work, as she comes from a family of farmers.

This type of work is very common in this area, as much for men as for women.  Keylin is asking for a loan of 600,000 Colons (¢ 600.000.00) to buy soil developing fertilizers and nutritive fertilizers, essential for the development of the crops, and fungicides to protect her crops during the growth process until the harvest.  In this way, she will be able to offer the consumers an excellent product of very good quality.

Her goal is to move forward economically, improving her house and helping with the household expenses.  Keylin is one of the members involved with the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de la Danta S.A, one of the 150 communal credit institutions in Costa Rica, and this is her second loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for soil development and nutritive additives.

loans.name: Alvaro Gerardo

texts.es:
Alvaro  es un señor de  48 años de edad, quien vive con su familia en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada San Gabriel, localizada en Yolillal, Upala en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi-montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica. Sus actividades principales son la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería.
 Desde hace unos meses que Alvaro tiene la necesidad de adquirir  recursos para reparar su vivienda ya que en Costa Rica comenzó la época lluviosa y necesita cambiar techos y reparar su cocina , hacer aceras y para esto  debe comprar materiales y pagar mano de obra . En su caso  particular, depende de este proyecto para lograr mejorar su vivienda. Alvaro considera que gracias a este financiamiento  él y su familia mejoraran sus condiciones de vida . Actualmente Alvaro necesita un microcrédito por un millón  colones (¢1.000.000.00).  El forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabriel, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Alvaro, age 48, lives with his family in a rural community called San Gabriel in Yolillal, Upala canton, in the Alajuela province in Costa Rica.  It is a relatively large rural community with semi-mountainous topography located in Costa Rica, Central America.  Its main business activities are growing basic grains, and, on a minor scale, livestock. 

For some months now Alvara has needed to get the resources to repair his house.  In Costa Rica the rainy season has started, and he needs to change the roofs, repair the kitchen, and lay sidewalks.  In order to do so he needs to buy materials and pay for labor.

In his particular case, managing to improve his house depends upon this project.  Alvaro believes that thanks to this loan he and his family will improve their living conditions.  Alvaro currently needs a small loan for 1,000,000 colones.

He is part of the  San Gabriel communal bank, one of EDESA’s 150 associated organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to repair his house.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both of them go to school. She is not taking care of any other family members.

She has been selling drinks from a shop which she has rented for two years at retail, working seven days a week. She has no other source of income.

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more beer, whiskey, soda and wine for sale. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She joined MCDT because members advised her that she could make profits from the loans.  

She aspires to expand her business for more profits. She rents a house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to buy more beer, whiskey, soda and wine for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 49-year-old business lady; she is a single mother of two children. She has been running a retail shop and she has also been employed as town clerk in Embu for the past ten years, with a monthly income of 16,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Esther will use the loan to buy consumer goods like sugar, rice and maize meal for her retail shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy consumer goods like sugar, rice and maize meal for her retail shop.

loans.name: Nelson Javier

texts.es: Nelson, tiene 27 años de edad, casado, vive en una colonia Suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a su esposa. Hace 2 años que Nelson quedo sin empleo y en busca de obtener ingresos decidió establecer un negocio en su casa, compra y vende ropa de todo tipo como ser: camisas, pantalones, blusas, jeans, ropa interior y también carteras, zapatos y sandalias para damas. su negocio es conocido en la comunidad donde vive y tiene sus clientes fijos. El solicita un préstamo  por 10,000.00 Lempiras para comprar fardos de ropa que trae variedad de blusas, camisas, jeans, ropa de niño, faldas y pantalones. Con esta inversión se va ayudar a mantener surtido de productos y aumentar las ventas. Su idea es tener su negocio en crecimiento para que le genere los ingresos necesarios del hogar.
texts.en:
Nelson, 27, is married and lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula with his wife.  Two years ago Nelson lost his job and looking for a way to earn income decided to set up a home-based clothing sales business; he sells shirts, pants, blouses, jeans, underwear and also purses, shoes and sandals for women.  His business is well-known in the community where he lives and he has regular customers.

He’s asking for a 10,000 lempira loan to buy bundles of clothes that contain an assortment of shirts, blouses, jeans, children’s clothes, skirts and pants.  With this investment he will help keep his business well-stocked with merchandise and increase his sales.  His idea is to have a growing business so that it will generate income needed for his home.

loans.use: to buy bundles of assorted clothing to resell.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Наталья закупила дополнительный товар и смогла увеличить свою прибыль.
В этот раз Наталье также нужен кредит для закупки тапочек и резиновой осенней обуви. В не сезон Наталья может сделать закупку по более низкой цене и таким образом увеличить прибыль. Наталья - активный и деятельный человек, стремиться развивать свой бизнес дальше.
texts.en:
Thanks to her previous loan, Natalya was able to stock additional merchandise and increase her profits. This time, she is requesting a loan to purchase slippers and rubber boots for the fall season. Natalya can buy merchandise outside of its season at lower prices, thereby increasing her profits. 

Natalya is an active and energetic person, and strives to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase slippers and rubber boots for the fall season

loans.name: Nelson Isidro

texts.es:
El señor Nelson tiene 40 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá, el mismo presta servicios como taxista en una parada que se encuentra en un lugar estratégicamente bien ubicado en la ciudad de Itá, tiene clientes formados desde hace más de 6 años, el mismo, además de eso tiene una huerta  mediante el cual vende todo lo que cultiva como lechuga, tomates, etc.
El señor Nelson trabaja con la Fundación Paraguaya hace varios años, y ha mostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora, seria y responsable, eso se ve reflejado en el fruto de su esfuerzo.
El solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su vehículo, ya que es su medio de trabajo y quiere dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nelson is forty years old, lives in the city of Itá, and offers his services as a taxi driver from a stop that is strategically located in the city of Itá.  He has been building a client base for the past 6 years, and additionally he has a garden in which he grows and sells products like lettuce, tomatoes, etc.

Nelson has worked with Fundación Paraguaya for several years, and has demonstrated himself to be a very hardworking person, serious, and responsible, and this is seen in the fruits of his efforts.  He is asking for this loan in order to maintain his vehicle, since this is his means of work and he wants to be able to give good service to his customers.

loans.use: to perform maintenance work on his taxi.

loans.name: Milton Jacinto

texts.es:
MILTON JACINTO tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil unión libre tiene 5 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

 MILTON JACINTO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, insecticidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar los cultivos para venderlo en un buen precio.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas. El sueño es poder tener un futuro mejor. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas.

En el tiempo libre le gusta compartir momentos con la familia.
texts.en:
Milton Jacinto, 32, is in a common law relationship and has five children; he lives with his wife and children in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

He is a member of the “El Recreo” communal bank located in San Vicente Las Lomas belonging to Ventanas Canton; this communal bank is involved in agriculture and livestock activities.

Milton Jacinto farms corn. He’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, manure and insecticide.  With help from the loan he will be able to improve his crops to sell them at a better price.

He makes his purchases and his sales in Ventanas.  His dream is to be able to have a better future.  The challenge he faces is pest infestations.  He likes to spend his free time enjoying his family.

loans.use: to buy seed and farm supplies.

loans.name: Dunia Rosibel

texts.es: Dunia de 23 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 4 años, vive en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Azacualpa Santa Bárbara. Dunia tiene tres años de dedicarse al comercio, tenia establecida una pulpería anteriormente con su clientela establecida, para la cual solicito un préstamo a ODEF y a KIVA, y logro buenas ventas y asi pudo pagar sin problemas, pero sus ingresos no son suficientes ya que en la comunidad en que vive es pequeña y ya existen viarios negocios de pulperías. Ella decidió cambiar de actividad de negocio, ahora vende mercadería la mayor parte es ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y ropa interior, y le está yendo muy bien ya que de este tipo de negocio no hay en su aldea. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo de 7,000.00 Lempiras para surtir de mercadería para la venta, esperando obtener mejores ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Su meta sigue siendo la de obtener buenos ingresos para un futuro darle la educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Dunia is 23 years old and a single mother of a four-year-old son. She lives in a neighborhood in the town of Azacualpa Santa Bárbara.

Dunia has three years of experience in the retail trade. She previously established a grocery store with its own customer base, which is why she requested her previous loan with ODEF and Kiva. Dunia was able to generate good sales and repay the loan without any problems, but her income was still not enough since her community is small and there are other grocery stores that exist. She decided to change businesses and now she sells merchandise, mostly clothing (for women, men, and children) and undergarments. Dunia is doing very well with this type of business since there are none that exist in her neighborhood.

She is requesting her second loan in the amount of 7,000 HNL so that she restock with merchandise to sell. Dunia hopes to generate more income so that she can sustain her family. Her goal is to continue earning a good income so that she can provide for her son's education in the future.

loans.use: to buy all types of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jumakan

texts.ru:
Жумакан 54 года, замужем. Жумакан уже в течении 36 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 6,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жумакан,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 1 дойная корова с приплодом и 1 лошадь, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 5,000 сом в месяц. Также Жумакан обрабатывает 3,05 га земли, где выращивает картофель и зерновые культуры. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жумакан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 2 дополнительных голов скота, для откорма их на пастбищах, что позволит уменьшить расходы на корм.  Доходы от кредита Жумакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Jumakan is 54 years old and married. For the past 36 years, she has been raising livestock, having started her business with a sum of 6,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Jumakan's farm currently has 1 dairy cow with offspring and 1 horse, while sales of milk and dairy products bring roughly 5,000 som per month. Jumakan also works 3.05 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and grains.

In order to continue developing her business, Jumakan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase 2 more cows. She will raise them on pastures, which will allow her to spend less on fodder. Jumakan plans to invest her profits from this loan into further increasing the size of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comite Mujeres Luchadoras es del chaco, está en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que desean poder salir adelante y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias.
Valeriana es una de estas miembros, quien se dedica a la venta de carbón. Comenta que le está yendo muy bien debido a que últimamente este es mas preferido por los clientes por el buen precio. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y tener algún día una despensa bien surtida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carbón, con lo cual podrá surtirse y tener su producto en stock para poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee "Comite Mujeres Luchadoras" is from Chaco, and they are in their third cycle in the program for working women in the Fundación Paraguaya.  They are all hardworking and entrepreneurial women who want to be able to get ahead financially and in this way to be able to help their families.

Valeriana is one of these members, and she is involved in the sales of charcoal.  She says that this is going quite well for her thanks to the fact that it has been preferred by her customers due to the recent good prices.  Her goal is to be able to continue growing her business and to one day have a fully stocked local store.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy charcoal so that she will be fully stocked and have her product available in response to the demand from her customers.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Cristo Rey, han asumido el compromiso de mantener unido el grupo y trabajar bajo un marco de respeto  mutuo, actualmente se encuentran en el décimo ciclo, integrada por 13 mujeres quienes invierten sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades y poder así sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Carolina es la presidenta del grupo y cuenta que por medio de su negocio, que es la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia con los gastos que día a día surgen. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con un gran espíritu de superación y entusiasmo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas en general, como ser gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, energizantes y demás tipos de bebidas, que siempre son las que más salida tienen.
texts.en:
The committee is called “Cristo Rey” (Christ the King).  They have taken on the responsibility of keeping the group together and to work within a framework of mutual respect.  They are currently in their 10th cycle and there are 13 women members who invest their loans in their respective activities in order to support their children.

Carolina is group president and she relates that through her business, which is the sale of all types of beverages, she’s been able to get ahead and help her family with daily expenses that arise.  She is a very hardworking woman with a great spirit of self-improvement and enthusiasm.

She is asking for the loan to buy beverages in general like soft-drinks, beer, wine, energy drinks and other types of beverages which are the ones that sell the most.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nuevas Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
21 mujeres de la ciudad de Caaguazú se han unido con el propósito de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ella son mujeres jefas de familia que desean ayudar a sus hijos a salir adelante.
Maria Antonia es la Presidenta del grupo, trabaja en la venta de comestibles (empanadas, sopa paraguaya, croquetas), trabaja día a día desde muy tempranas horas cuando prepara sus comidas. Cuenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia y así salen adelante. Su sueño es poder tener un local, propio y así ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, harina, huevo, aceite, carne y demás insumos para seguir preparando los alimentos que vende. Agradece que ella y sus amigas estén recibiendo una oportunidad como esta.
texts.en:
Twenty-one women from the city of Caaguazú have united in order to work together, help each other, and manage to get ahead by doing so. They are head-of-household women who want to help their children get ahead. 
Maria Antonia is the President of the group and works in food sales (empanadas, Paraguayan soup, croquettes). She works day after day, starting very early in the morning, which is when she prepares her food. She says that she helps her family through her work, and that is how they get ahead. Her dream is to be able to have her own business location, so that she may offer her customers more comfort.
She is requesting the loan to purchase sugar, flour, eggs, oil, meat, and other ingredients, so that she can continue to prepare the food she sells. She is grateful that she and her friends are being given this kind of opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, eggs, oil, meat, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Meth's Group

texts.en:
Meth, 39, is single and lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district. To make a living, she has been working as a rice farmer on leased rice field and a paid worker in the village for almost ten years. 

Meth’s group consists of two female members. She is in her third loan cycle while her group member, Chansoda, is in her second loan cycle with VisionFund. The past two loans have enabled her to increase her income. Now she can earn around 25,000 KHR per day from her current business.

She is leading her group to apply for a loan of 600,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for the fee of her current leased farmland and use a portion of it to buy rice seeds for rice farming. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income so as to set aside some money to own a plot of land for her own business to make a living.

loans.use: To spend for land rental

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en:
Colletta lives in Changamwe, Kenya. She is married and has two children, one who is in school.  She owns a cereals shop, which has been in operation for two years. This is the only source of income to her family.  Colletta is applying for a loan of KSH 41,850 to purchase beans, maize, maize, oil, etc.  Her main challenge is price fluctuation and high transportation costs.

The income from this business loan will pay for her child’s school fees.  Her ambition is to purchase a motorcycle; many people prefer them since they can access the interior parts of the town, which lack a good road network.

loans.use: to purchase beans, maize, maize, oil, etc.

loans.name: Dieu Merci Group

texts.fr: Madame Safoura est âgée de 55ans. Elle est mariée à un cultivateur. Malgré son âge, elle ne baisse pas les bras et exerce comme activité  la vente de soja, du maïs et de sésame. Elle a commencé par vendre en 2005 et  exerce l’activité à SOKODE lieu ou elle s’approvisionne également. Elle sollicite son troisième crédit de WAGES pour acheter de la marchandise. Elle veut assurer ses besoins et faire prospérer son activité. C’est un groupement constitué que de femmes et les autres sont spécialisés dans la vente de charbon de bois, de beignets, des céréales et de la boisson locale. Elle veulent voir leur famille s'épanouir et  aider leurs maris dans les charges du ménage.
texts.en:
Safoura is 55 years of age, and is married to a farmer. Despite her age, she has not slowed things down and still works selling soybeans, corn and sesame. She began selling goods in 2005 and works in Sokodé, where she also gets her supplies. 

Safoura has requested her third loan from WAGES to buy merchandise. She also wants to make sure her needs are covered, as well as to make her business more prosperous. She is part of a women-only group, and the other members are specialized in the sale of charcoal, fritters, cereals and local drinks. They want to see their families get ahead, as well as to help their husbands with the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy soybeans, corn, cereals and charcoal.

loans.name: Massamba

texts.fr: Massamba est un homme marié et père de quatre enfants.Il cultive en saison des pluies des champs de mil et d'arachide, hérités de son père.En saison sèche, il pratique l'embouche bovine.Il achète des boeufs, les engraisse et les revend au bout de sept mois. Cess deux activités lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et à ses propres bespoins.Afin de faire une nouvelle opération d'embouche, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter un boeufs et de l'aliment bétail.
texts.en:
Massamba is a married man and father to four children. During the rainy season he works the millet and peanut fields he inherited from his father, and in the dry season he raises cattle. He buys cows, which he fattens and then sells once seven months have passed. 

Massamba’s two businesses allow him to provide for his family and meet his own needs. To buy new cattle to fatten, he has requested a loan of 500,000 francs to buy cows and livestock feed.

loans.use: To buy cattle and livestock feed.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de cinq enfants dont les trois fréquentent l'école.Chaque matin, elle part en ville vendre du lait frais et du lait caillé.Ses revenus journaliers lui permettent d'acheter du riz, des l'huile, du poisson et d'autres condiments pour préparer les repas de la famille.Elle parvient souvent à faire une petite épargne qu'elle dépose dans son compte ouvert à l'UIMCEC.Ainsi, chaque année, elle sollicite un pret pour faire de l'embouche ovine ou bovine.Les revenus tirés de cette activité assez rentable lui servent à acheter des habits, à prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de se enfants.Afin de faire une nouvelle opération d'embouche, elle demande un pret de 500000f pour acheter un boeuf et de l'aliment bétail.Son ambition est de construire un enclos pour mieux sécuriser son activité.
texts.en:
Aminata is a married woman and mother to five children, three of whom go to school. Every morning she goes to town to sell fresh milk and “lait caillé” (a thin, lemony yogurt sauce). Her daily income allows her to buy rice, oil, fish and other seasonings to prepare her family’s meals.

Aminata often manages to save a little bit of money, which she deposits in the account which she has with UIMCEC. In this way, each year she asks for a loan to buy cows or sheep for fattening. The income she gets from this fairly profitable business allows her to buy clothes and to provide for her children’s upbringing. To buy some more livestock for fattening, she has requested 500,000 francs to purchase a cow and livestock feed. Her ambition is to build an enclosure so that her business is more secure.

loans.use: To buy a cow and livestock feed.

loans.name: Sérigne

texts.fr: Sérigne est un commerçant qui pratique en même temps l'élevage.Il achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa région des moutons ou des bœufs qu'il engraisse puis revend.Sa diversité d'activités lui permet de générer des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de subvenir correctement aux besoins de sa famille. Afin de faire une nouvelle opération d'embouche, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter un bœuf et de l'aliment bétail.
texts.en:
Sérigne works as a retailer and also raises livestock. He goes to the weekly markets in his region to buy sheep or cattle, which he fattens and resells. The diversity of his businesses allows him to generate fairly consistent income, which enables him to correctly provide for his family.

To buy new livestock for fattening, Sérigne has requested a loan of 400,000 francs to buy a cow and livestock feed.

loans.use: To buy a cow and livestock feed.

loans.name: Scholar

texts.en: Scholar is 43 years old and married. She sells handbags and perfumes to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has one employee. Through the financial support from Faulu Kenya, she has managed to grow her business. She has also learnt how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She dreams of expanding her business and becoming prosperous in the future. She needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy handbags and perfumes.

loans.use: To buy handbags and perfumes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to her stock of canned goods, snacks, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Exequiel

texts.es:
Exequiel es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente estudia programación de sistemas en la facultad de Ingeniería es por eso que solicita el crédito ya que con lo poco que gana no le alcanza para pagar sus inscripciones, ya que debe contribuir los gastos de alimentación, servicios básicos y gastos médicos de su familia. Ya que la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia  es una tienda de barrio. 
El sueño de Exequiel es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Exequiel is single and has no children; he lives in his parents’ house occupying a single room.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.

He’s currently studying computer programming in the engineering department and this is why he’s asking for a loan because what he earns isn’t enough to pay for his tuition since he has to contribute to his family’s food, utility and medical costs since his family’s only source of income is a neighborhood store.

Exequiel’s dream is to improve his income to be able to become independent and improve his quality of life this way.  This is the second time he’s asked for a loan from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy urea, seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité Unidas, son 18 señoras de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, estas integrantes empezaron a formarse como grupo desde que se enteraron sobre el programa de comité de mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya,  lo cual les ayudará mucho.
Elvira es miembro de este grupo, y cuenta que gracias a la ayuda y capacitaciones que recibe le está yendo cada vez mejor en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, además dice que tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella los productos que vende.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca el frío y tendrá muchos pedidos con los cuales quiere poder cumplir.
texts.en:
The “Unidas” (United Ones) committee is 18 women from the city of Caaguazú who joined together into a group when they learned about Fundación Paraguaya’s women’s committee program which will help them very much.

Elvira is a member of this group and she relates that thanks to the support and training she gets she’s doing better in her business every time.  She sells all types of clothes and she says that she has a good clientele that always buys the products she sells.

She’s asking for the loan to buy winter clothes because the cold is approaching and she will have many orders she’ll want to fill.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Bineta est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de quatre enfants dont les trois fréquentent l'école.La dernière fille( qu'elle porte sur son dos sur la photo) est encore bébé.En dehors des taches ménagères qui lui prennent l'essentiel de son temps, Bineta pratique aussi l'élevage notamment l'embouche ovine.Elle achète en effet des moutons qu'elle engraisse puis revend au bout de quelques mois.Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins ainsi qu'à ceux de ses enfants.Elle sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter 25 moutons et de l'aliment bétail.Elle ambitionne de s'engager plus tard dans l'embouche bovine.
texts.en:
Bineta is a married woman who has four children, three of whom go to school. Her youngest daughter (who she is carrying on her back in the photo) is still a baby.

In addition to the household chores, which occupy most of her time, Bineta also works raising sheep. She buys sheep which she fattens, before reselling them after several months. The income she obtains from this business allows her to provide for herself and her children. She has requested a loan of 400,000 francs to buy 25 sheep and livestock feed. In the future, Bineta would like to work raising cattle.

loans.use: To buy 25 sheep and livestock feed.

loans.name: Fiorella Del Pilar

texts.es:
Fiorella es una mujer de 24 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Nazca, ella es una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta  de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de solventar sus gastos no ha podido cursar una carrera profesional, pero sueña con poder estudiar la carrera de Gastronomía, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Escabeche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Fiorella trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurant de su ciudad, ella labora un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se encuentra muy a gusto con el trabajo que realiza ya que la consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y trato amable hacia los demás.
Fiorella se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracia a la ayudada brindada podrá realizar la compra de un terreno, en el cual desea poder construir su propia vivienda; de esta manera en un futuro no muy lejano Fiorella espera poder contar con su casa en la cual desea poder tener su negocio de venta de comida, para así poder ayudar a sus padres y cumplir su gran de sueño de estudiar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Fiorella is a 24 year old woman, and she is single and lives with her parents in the city of Nazca.  She is a happy, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed.  Sadly, due to her lack of economic resources and her need to cover her expenses, she was not able to take a professional course of studies, but she dreams of being able to take coursework in Gastronomy.  In her free time, she likes to relax by listening to a little music and sometimes she likes to cook delicious Escabeche (a traditional quick pickle) to share with her family.

By her own initiative, and with the support of her mother, Fiorella works as a kitchen assistant in a restaurant in her city.  She works there about 10 hours each day, and she really enjoys the work that she does since they appreciate her good work and the kind way in which she treats others.

Fiorella is very thankful to the lenders at Kiva, because thanks to their help, she will be able to buy a piece of land on which she hopes to build her own home.  In this way, in the near future, Fiorella hopes to be able to have a home of her own in which she could start her own small restaurant business so that she can help her parents with their expenses and to achieve her dream of studying for a professional career.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Celia Jenny

texts.es:
CELIA JENNY tiene 42 años de edad es viuda tiene un hijo, vive en casa con el papá y el hijo de 14 años de edad en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

 CELIA JENNY se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas urea, líquido mata maleza. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. Las compras lo hace en Ventanas.  El sueño es poder seguir teniendo éxito en la vida.

En el tiempo libre le gusta dormir.
texts.en:
Celia Jenny, 42, is a widow and has a son.  She lives with her father and her 14-year-old son in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

She’s a member of the “El Recreo” communal bank located in San Vicente Las Lomas belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is involved in activities related to agriculture and livestock.

Celia Jenny farms corn and is asking for the loan to buy insecticide, urea and weed killer.

With help from the loan she will be able to buy what’s necessary for the farming.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas.  Her dream is to be able to continue being successful in life.  In her free time she likes to sleep.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Gladys Birmania

texts.es:
GLADYS BIRMANIA tiene 40 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijos, vive con el esposo y con el hijo en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

 GLADYS BIRMANIA se dedica  a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, ranger. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura.

El sueño es poder  darle los estudios al hijo para que culmine la educación. En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Gladys Birmania, 40, is married and has two children; she lives with her husband and son in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

She’s a member of the “El Recreo” communal bank located in San Vicente Las Lomas belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is involved in activities related to agriculture and livestock.

Gladys Birmania grows corn.  She’s asking for the loan to buy urea, insecticide and Ranger brand herbicide.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy what’s needed for farming.

Her dream is to provide schooling for her son so that he will complete his education.  In her free time she likes to work.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Alonso Edison

texts.es:
Alonso Edison tiene 35 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de unos familiares en Ventanas provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Alonso Edison se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz suave. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para los cultivos. El sueño es poder mejorar el estilo de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
35-year old Alonso Edison is single and doesn’t have any children. He lives in the home of some relatives in Ventanas, in the province of Bolívar. He’s a member of VRC El Recreo located in San Vicente las Lomas in Ventanas canton. The members earn their living through cattle raising and agriculture.

Alonso grows sweetcorn. He is seeking a loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer, and insecticide for his fields. His dream is to improve his standard of living. In his free time Alonso likes to play sports.

loans.use: buy seeds, urea, fertilizer, and insecticide

loans.name: Narcita

texts.en:
Narcita is 38 years old and lives in Mantic, Tangub City. She is married with three children.
 
Narcita has a sari-sari store. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan to buy additional groceries her sari-sari store.

Narcita has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Narcita hopes to improve her family's living conditions by using her profit.

loans.use: To buy additional groceries for her business

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a hard-working businesswoman with two children. She operates a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has three employees. She also sells eggs to make extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in business management. She hopes to expand her business and start supplying cosmetics in the future. She needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy a blow drier and a hair drier.

loans.use: to buy a blow drier and a hair drier.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling corn and coconuts in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. Jesusa has been in this business for seven years. Jesusa has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for four years. Jocelyn earns more income from pig fattening.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business

loans.name: Danny Alfredo

texts.es:
Danny Alfredo tiene 32 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con el papá en ventanas provincia de los Ríos. 

Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Danny Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, ranger.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes necesarios.  Las compras lo hace en Ventanas.

El sueño es poder comprar una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y practicar el  indor.
texts.en:
Danny Alfredo, 32, is single and has no children.  He lives with his father in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  He’s a member of the “El Recreo” communal bank in San Vicente Las Lomas, belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is involved in activities related to agriculture and livestock.

Danny Alfredo is a corn farmer.  He’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea and Ranger [brand of herbicide].  With help from the loan he will be able to buy the necessary fertilizers.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas.  

His dream is to be able to buy a house.  In his free time he likes playing sports and indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Freddy Gilbert

texts.es:
FREDDY GILBERT tiene 41 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo en Ventanas provincia de Bolivar.

Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

 FREDDY GILBERT se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz suave. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, líquidos para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y la semilla. Las compras lo hará en Ventanas.

El sueño es poder comprar un terreno. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boly.
texts.en:
FREDDY GILBERT, 41, is in a common law relationship and has a son.  He lives with his wife and son in Ventanas, Bolívar Province.  He’s a member of the “El Recreo” communal bank in San Vicente Las Lomas, belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is involved in activities related to agriculture and livestock.

FREDDY GILBERT is a corn farmer.  He’s asking for the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea and weed killer.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy fertilizer and seeds.  He will make his purchases in Ventanas.  His dream is to be able to buy a parcel of land.  In his free time he likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Girurukundo Group

texts.fr:
Thomas  fait partie du groupe Girurukundo. Il a 30 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 3 ans à 6 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 2  ans de secondaire.

Thomas est agriculteur des pommes de terre. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 250kgs des pommes de terre pour la semence, 250kgs des fertilisants pour son agriculture des pommes de terre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est agrandir son activité en achetant un champ et solliciter d’autres crédits.  Dans les prochaines années, il Voudrait être un grand cultivateur des pommes de terre dans sa région. Avec les profits, Thomas prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Thomas is part of the Girurukundo group. He is 30 years of age and married with two children aged 3 and 6, one of whom is at school. He himself has two years of secondary education.


Thomas works growing potatoes. This is his first loan with ACB, and he plans to use it to buy 250 kilos of potatoes for planting and 250 kilos of fertilizers for his potato-growing business. To expand his business he plans to increase his activity by purchasing a field, as well as by requesting other loans. Over the coming years, Thomas would like to become a successful potato grower in his region. He plans to use his profits to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: To buy 250 kilos of potatoes for planting and 250 kilos of fertilizers for his potato-growing business.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 39 years old and a business man. He is divorced from his wife and is taking care of two children, age five and three years respectively. He has been operating a motorcycle transportation business for the past one year with the monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to cater to his children’s basic needs.

Geoffrey will use the loan to buy a heifer and animal feed. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 


His hopes and dreams are to build a cow shed, service the motorbike and own a dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and animal feed.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 48-year-old man from Nyahururu. He is married and has four children, who are all in school. Peter has a butcher's shop and also works as a farmer. Peter has applied for his second loan from KADET Ltd, to buy a bull to slaughter for his shop. He hopes that his business will do better after the loan. He hopes to have more customers at his shop and see his business expand.

loans.use: to buy a bull to slaughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah, age 67, sells clothes to earn her living. She has requested a loan in order to buy trousers, dresses, and suits to offer for sale. She has been in this business for a period of 20 years. 

She hopes to use the profits to build a house. In the future, she plans to set up a store where she can sell a variety of clothes.

loans.use: to buy more trousers, dresses, and suits to offer for sale

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She cultivates some land with her husband. They grow rice crops for consumption and selling. Feliciana does her best to manage her time between farming and her children. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor. She hopes to have sufficient income to buy more farmland in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, age 42, has been raising pigs for the past 10 years. She earns additional income from farming sugarcane. She and her husband have two children.

Juliet is requesting a loan of PHP 29000 through NWTF in order to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 46 years old and is married, with two children. She operates a retail shop where she sells simsim. She has one employee. She has been in this business for three years. She also earns income from sugarcane farming. Previously, she sold used clothes. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to start a bakery in the future. She needs a loan of KES 100,000 to pay for her business premises and add to her stock of simsim.

loans.use: to pay for her business premises and add stock of simsim.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a hardworking businessman who runs a taxi business to earn a living. He operates his service in a conducive environment and has attracted and retained reliable customers. Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved on his saving skills due to the training in financial management that he has received. He and his wife have two children.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 KES in order to service his vehicle. He hopes to expand his business and to buy a piece of land in the future.

loans.use: to perform needed repairs to his vehicle

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar es un cliente de 27 años de edad, vive con su esposa y 2 hijos en una comunidad rural en vías de desarrollo perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. La comunidad donde Cesar vive es una comunidad rural de condición humilde que no cuenta aún con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe.

Cesar se dedica a la  crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal comercializa en el mercado local,  cuenta  con una experiencia de cuatro años en esta labor y su buen desempeño hace que tenga clientes constantes. Adicionalmente, Cesar es peón estable en una parcela en la cual es cuidador y jornalero, su esposa lo apoya en sus labores y cuenta con herencia de terreno agrícola, la cual todavía no está desarrollada físicamente.

Cesar solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de una motocicleta que le permitirá responder mejor a sus necesidades de transporte. El ya ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva y se encuentra bastante agradecido con las personas que le apoyaron en aquella oportunidad.

Cesar tiene muchos deseos de superación y espera que le concedan el crédito para poder lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Cesar is a client who is 27 years of age. He lives with his wife and two children in a rural community in the District of Tambogrande-Piura which is in the transition of development. The rural community where Cesar lives has modest conditions and does not receive basic services such as electricity, potable running water, or wastewater drainage.

Cesar raises sheep and poultry. When the animals reach the ideal size and weight, they are sold at the local market. Cesar has four years of experience in this line of work and has developed well to the point that he now has regular customers. In addition, Cesar also has a stable job working for another landowner in which he serves as a caretaker and laborer. His wife helps with the chores and has farmland that she inherited, but it has yet to be developed.

Cesar is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3,000 PEN that will be invested in the purchase of a motorcycle. This will fulfill his transportation needs. He already received a loan through Kiva and is appreciative of the people who supported him on that occasion. Cesar is eager to improve and hopes to receive this loan so that he can accomplish his goals.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ndiène

texts.fr: Ndiène est un jeune célibataire sans enfant.Il est né dans une famille d'agriculteurs et d'éleveurs.Il pratique ainsi ces deux activités depuis son jeune âge.Il s'adonne à l'élevage notamment l'embouche bovine dés la fin de la saison des pluies.Il achète des bœufs qu'il engraisse puis revend une fois arrivés à maturité.Ces activités lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et de prendre en charge certaines dépenses d'entretien de sa famille. Afin de faire une nouvelle opération d'embouche, il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter un boeuf et des aliments de bétail.
texts.en:
Ndiène is a young, single man with no children. He was born into a family of farmers and livestock breeders, and has worked in these two activities from a young age. From the end of the rainy season he works raising livestock, namely cattle. He buys his cattle and fattens them, before reselling them once they have reached the correct age.
