Tania  va a usar este préstamo para compra de insumos por mayor como papa, arroz, fideo y aceite para la elaboración de sus comidas y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Tania va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un restaurante y así brindar mayor comodidad a su clientela. La Sra. tania es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “73-Las Orquideas.P” consists of nine members, seven women and two men. The president of the Communal Bank is Sra. Tania, who lives in the District of Los Chacos. In the photograph, Tania is wearing a sweater with black and white stripes, black pants, and black sandals. She is the second person standing, starting on the right side.

Sra. Tania is 31 years old and has two children, ages 5 and 7, both of whom are of in school. She sells food from a vending stall located in the same district where she lives. This loan is her second cycle with Emprender. Sra. Tania will use the money to buy supplies in bulk such as potatoes, rice, noodles, and oil for preparing her dishes. The loan will also increase her operating capital. Her reason for requesting this loan is so that she can continue improving her business. By utilizing the benefits of this loan, Sra. Tania will be able to continue buying supplies and improving her income. Her wish for her business is to open a restaurant where her customers can be more comfortable. Sra. Tania is a hardworking person who is happy with the opportunity that has been provided to her and her fellow group members. Some of them have sole responsibility for supporting their families.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: José Leonel

texts.es: El Señor José tiene 29 años de edad, está casado tiene 1 hijo de 7 meses, reside en la comunidad de Cofradía en el Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortés. Don José trabajaba en un taller de enderezado y pintura de Vehículos, con esa experiencia decidió  hace más de 2 años por iniciativa propia y con sus propios ingresos instalar su propio taller brindando buen servicio y atención a sus clientes. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF y a KIVA por 15,000.00 Lempiras, está  muy agradecido por el préstamo anterior el cual le ayudo a la estabilidad económica y desarrollo del negocio y de su familia.  Con este préstamo va comprar materia prima como ser: flex gliden, pintura Robin, maskin tape, tiner etc. Para realizar mejor el trabajo de enderezado y pintura de los vehículos. El continúa con su sueño de hacer crecer el negocio brindando un buen servicio para llegar a ser una empresa grande en servicio automotriz.
texts.en:
Sr. José is 29 years old, married, and has a seven-month-old child. He resides in the community of Cofradía in the town of San Pedro Sula, Cortés.

Don José worked at a paint and body shop. Using his experience, he decided more than two years ago to generate his own income and open a repair shop where he provides good service and attention to his customers.

He is requesting a second loan from ODEF and Kiva in the amount of 15,000 HNL. José is very grateful for his previous loan, which helped him achieve financial stability and develop this business on behalf of his family. With this loan, he will buy waterproof coating, paint, masking tape, thinners, and other supplies so that he can improve his paint and body jobs. He will continue his dream of growing his business and providing good service so that he can turn it into a large automotive service company.

loans.use: to buy waterproof coating, paint, masking tape, thinners, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various goods such as beans, rice, sugar, umbrellas, bags, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Luciano Eduardo

texts.es:
LUCIANO EDUARDO tiene 55 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 3 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LUCHA Y PROGRESO, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Progreso prácticamente se han criado en esa zona.

LUCIANO EDUARDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, abono orgánico y quiímico. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas. El sueño es poder comprar terreno para sembrar más. En el tiempo libre le gusta viajar.
texts.en:
Luciano Eduardo is 55 years old, he lives in a common-law marriage with his partner, he has 3 children and they all live together in Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the Communal Bank Lucha y Progreso (Fight to Progress) whose members are farmers and all live in the Progreso Community where most of them grew up.

Luciano Eduardo is a farmer and he grows corn. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, urea, manure and fertilizers. Thanks to the loan he will succeed in buying everything he needs for his crops.

He buys his supplies and sells in Ventanas. He dreams of succeeding in buying some land to grow more corn. He likes travelling in his free time.

loans.use: To buy seeds, urea, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Santa Julia

texts.es:
Con 62,100 pesos Santa podrá comprar equipos para la cocina de su puesto de venta de comida y así realizar un trabajo más eficiente con menos esfuerzo físico.  Todos los que conocen a Santa siempre le decian lo rico que cocina. Así que hace ocho años decidió probar suerte e iniciar su puesto de venta de comida. Desde entonces tiene clientes fijos que escogen desayunar o almorzar todos los dias en su comedor. 
Santa es casada y su esposo vende melones al por mayor en el mercado local. Tienen 6 hijos entre 26 y 9 años, todos trabajan, pues ya son mayores de edad, menos la de 9 años que asiste a la escuela.
Santa quiere ver crecer cada día su negocio para poder comprar su casa propia y dejar de pagar alquiler.
texts.en:
With this loan of 62,100 DOP, Santa will be able to buy cooking equipment for her food stall so that she can work more efficiently and with less physical effort. Everyone who knows Santa always rave about the flavor of the food she prepares. Eight years ago, she decided to try her luck at opening a food stall. Since then, she has acquired regular customers who come to her eatery every day to have breakfast or lunch.

Santa is married and her husband sells melons in bulk at the local market. They have six children between the ages of 9 and 26. All of the grown children work and the nine-year-old attends school. Santa wants to grow each day in her business so that she can buy a house of her own and stop paying rent.

loans.use: to buy cooking equipment for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Fidel Antonio

texts.es:
Fidel, está iniciando su cultivo de maíz, para lo cual deberá comprarse los insumos agrícolas que le permitan cultivar, el maíz y pipián de la temporada, como lo es el abono, herbicidas, semillas, que le permitirá a él poder iniciar el trabajo en agricultura.
Él préstamo anterior logró mejorar cosechas pues obtuvo una buena producción que le permitió comercializar y generar para su familia ingresos, estabilizando su condición como agricultor.
texts.en:
Fidel is beginning his cultivation of corn, for which he will need to buy himself agricultural inputs that allow him to grow corn and pipián (seasonal squash).  These will include fertilizers, herbicides, and seeds that will permit him to begin his agricultural work.

The loan before allowed him to improve his harvests and obtain a good yield that will permit him to sell his products and generate income for his family, while establishing himself as a farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and seeds.

texts.es: Nelson de 54 años de edad con su anterior credikiva compró artículos de ferretería y rotó rápidamente su mercancía, porque sus ventas se incrementaron con los productos comprados que fueron los de mayor consumo de sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará productos de ferretería, tales como cables, hierro y cemento, aprovechando que el sector de la construcción se ha reactivado y Nelson quiere aprovechar el potencial de clientes que este genera y con ello ganar un poco mas de dinero. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Les agradezco la colaboración por brindarme la oportunidad de seguir progresando en mi negocio y espero me sigan apoyando”
texts.en:
Nelson is 54 years old and with his previous Kiva loan, he bought hardware products and quickly ran through his merchandise because his sales increased with the products he bought, which were those most often consumed by his customers.  Currently, he is looking for a new loan with which to buy new hardware  products, such as cables, iron, and cement, taking advantage of the fact that the construction business has been reinvigorated and Nelson wishes to take advantage of the potential for new customers that this will generate and thereby gain a little more income.  

His message to the financiers of Kiva is the following, "I thank you for the assistance and the opportunity to continue making progress with my business and I hope you will continue to help me."

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es:
Rosa, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo con la intención de mejorar su negocio, dándole el fortalecimiento necesario, se comprará pollos de engorde y pequeños para la granja y también concentrado para alimentarlos, esto le ayudará a mejorar su condición en el negocio y a aumentar el número de pollos para la comercialización.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ha ayudado para mantenerse en el negocio,con una granja mas adecuada, con un número adecuado de pollos en su granja, que le ha permitido poder generar ventas a los clientes y mantener lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is asking for a new loan with the intention of improving her business, giving her the necessary strengthening of her business.  She will buy chickens to fatten and little ones for her farm, and also feed to nourish them.  This will help her to improve her business conditions and to increase the number of chickens she can sell.

She reports that the previous loan has helped her to stay in business, with a more suitable farm, and with enough chickens on her farm that she has been able to generate sales to her customers and maintain an income for her family's necessities.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ana Julieta

texts.es:
Ana, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en la sorbetería, se comprará helados de diferentes sabores sorbetes, paletas, conos, que le ayudarán para ofrecerle a los clientes un surtido de calidad en sorbetería. 
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudó para mejorar el negocio, superándose con mayor crecimiento en mercadería y en ventas, el número de clientes también han aumentado y así son oportunidades para ir desarrollándose en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is asking for a new loan in order to invest in her sorbet shop.  She will buy ice creams of different flavors, as well as sorbets, popsicles, and cones, which will help her to offer her customers a full, quality experience in her sorbet shop.

She says that her previous loan helped her to improve her business, acheiving a better growth in her market share and in her sales, the number of clients has also increased and thus she has more opportunity to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy popsicles, cones, and different flavors of sorbets.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque necesita invertir en el negocio comprándose más mercadería para la tienda, cereales, pastas, arroz, frutas como bananos, fresas, entre otros que son necesarios para la clientela, este préstamo ayudará a mantener un buen nivel y mantenerse estable con sus clientes.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior ha sido favorable, pues le ha permitido aumentar su clientela, su negocio se ha encontrado más surtido de productos, considerándose una superación en el negocio de María, también ha aportado una mayor ganancia a su familia y de estos ingresos también se logró comprar una refrigeradora.
texts.en:
María is asking for a new loan because she needs to invest in her business by buying new merchandise for her store, like grains, pasta, rice, and fruits like bananas and strawberries, among others, which are necessary for her customers.  This loan will help her to maintain a good level of supplies and keep her business in a stable state for her customers.

The effect that was had with her previous loan was favorable, since it allowed her to increase her customer base, her store has been better supplied with products, and this has been considered by María to be a success for her business.  She has also had a greater profit for her family's income, and with this income she was able to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy grains, pasta, rice, and fruits like bananas and strawberries.

loans.name: Koeju Group

texts.es:
Koeju está integrado por 20 mujeres de la ciudad de luque, quienes se esfuerzan siempre lo mas para poder ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de comestibles,  esta casada con el señor Roberto con quien tiene 3 hijos. Ella solicita el credito  para la compra de una cocina electrica para ganar mas tiempo y comodiad en la elaboracion de sus comestibles. Maria tiene como meta ir creciendo y tener su propio copetin  brindando asi una mejor atencion a su familia. Tanto ella como su grupo esta contento por la ayuda que estan recibiendo.
texts.en:
Koeju is comprised of 20 women from the town of Luque. They always work very hard so that they can support their families.
Maria sells foodstuffs. She's married to Roberto, with whom she has three children. She requests the loan in order to purchase an electric cooker so she can save time and prepare her foodstuffs more conveniently. Maria's goal is to keep on growing and own her own eatery, so that she can take better care of her family. She and her group are both glad to get the help they're receiving.

loans.use: to purchase an electric cooker.

loans.name: Sandra Yamileth

texts.es: Sandra, tiene 22 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en la zona suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ella vende todo tipo de mercadería desde hace 3 años, vende ropa, calzado, carteras, cosméticos, cortinas, etc.  Ha establecido un pequeño local enfrente a su casa, es un punto estratégico ya por allí transitan muchas personas y así logra vender sus productos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para mantener surtido el negocio y poder incrementar sus ingresos. Ella tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio para ayudar a sus hijos con la educación y mejorar su calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 22, is married and has three children.  She lives in a suburban area of San Pedro, Sula.

She has been selling all types of merchandise for three years.  She sells clothes, shoes, wallets, cosmetics, and curtains, etc.  She has established a small place in front of her house.  It is a strategic place because a lot of people pass by.  This is how she manages to sell her products.

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy merchandise.  She will do this to keep her business stocked and to be able to increase her income.  Her goal is to make her business grow in order to help her children with their education and to improve the family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Leticia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Leticia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues considera que a través de ellos está mejorando su negocio, pues le permite a través del recurso económico comprarse a mejor precio y cantidad los materiales, en esta ocasion invertira en harina, aceite, leña, azúcar, manteca, levadura, y otros materiales que son necesarios para la elaboración de pan, esta nueva inversión le dará mayor fortaleza para hacerle frente a la venta.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo con él uso del préstamo anterior, considera que está prosperando en el negocio, hasta el momento ha mantenido un nivel de producción bastante estable, sus ventas han sido buenas y esto le ha permitido tener una mejor solvencia en su familia.
texts.en:
Leticia is requesting a new loan.  She feels that her business is improving through the loans.  It allows her, through this financial resource, to buy at a better price and to buy the materials in bulk.

This time she will buy flour, cooking oil, firewood, sugar, lard, yeast, and other materials she needs to make bread.  This new investment will give her a greater advantage to get ahead of sales.

The use of the previous loan has had a positive impact.  She feels that she is prospering in the business.  So far she has kept the level of production quite stable.  Her sales have been good, and this has allowed her to have an improved financial solvency in her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, firewood, sugar, lard, yeast.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 32 años de edad, vive en la calurosa ciudad de Ica la cual se caracteriza por la amabilidad de sus pobladores, por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón Tanguis, esparrago, uva, paprika, entre otros; asimismo podemos encontrar la “Laguna de Huacachina”, la cual es visitada por muchos turistas en cualquier época del año. El vive al lado de su esposa la cual es su mano derecha y quien lo apoya mucho y junto a ella tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad a quien quiere mucho y sobre todo es por quien trabaja muy duro para darle una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho amor. A Pedro le gusta  mucho leer cuando dispone de un tiempo libre y sobre todo le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Pedro solo estudios hasta el quinto grado de secundaria debido a que sus padres no tenían muchos recursos económicos, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar para ser ingeniero de Sistemas.

Cada día Pedro trabaja como vigilante en una urbanización de su ciudad, Pedro cuida alrededor de 15 casas y  trabaja 10 horas al día, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo que sus clientes han logrado tenerle mucha confianza.

Pedro está muy agradeció con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar una mejoras en su vivienda como refacción de puertas ya que esta es de calamina, asimismo, mejoramiento de tuberías de agua, mejoramiento de paredes, entre otros, asi de esta manera el podrá ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y sobre todo brindarle más seguridad, con ello Pedro seguir trabajando para  seguir en busca de realizar su más  grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa propia y darle un buena calidad de vida a su familia”.
texts.en:
Pedro is 32 years old. He lives in the warm town of Ica, which is known for the friendliness of its inhabitants and for the agriculture, especially the Tanguis cotton, asparagus, grape and paprika crops, among others. The Huacachina Lagoon can also be found there, and it's visited by many tourists year-round. He lives by his wife's side; she's his right-hand person and gives him a lot of support. With her he has a 7-year-old son, whom he loves very much. His son is the main reason why he works very hard, so he can give him a life that is dignified and, above all, full of love. Pedro very much enjoys reading when he gets some free time, and most of all he loves to eat one of his favorite dishes, the delicious "arroz con pollo" (rice with chicken). Pedro only studied up to the fifth grade of middle school, because his parents didn't have much in the way of financial resources, but he would have liked to have studied to become a systems engineer.
Pedro works everyday as a security guard in an urban development of his town. Pedro looks after about 15 houses and works 10 hours a day. He believes that he does well in his job because he's very responsible and mainly because his clients have been able to put a lot of trust in him.
Pedro is very thankful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to make some home improvements, such as remodeling the doors which are made of corrugated iron. Also, he will improve the water pipes and the walls, among other things. That way he will be able to gradually improve his family's living conditions and above all provide them with more safety. Pedro will continue to work so he can keep on pursuing the realization of his biggest dream: "To finish building his own home and provide good living conditions for his family".

loans.use: to make home improvements (remodeling the doors as well as improving the water pipes and the walls, among other things).

loans.name: Philis

texts.en: Philis is 37 years old and hardworking. To earn a living, she has operated a hardware business for seven years and has one employee. Besides that, she also does pig farming. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has become a disciplined saver because she has been trained on financial management. She hopes to grow her business in five years. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy paint.

loans.use: to buy paint for her hardware business.

loans.name: Janice Ann

texts.en:
Janice Ann is 31 years old and lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children. 
Janice Ann sells seafood/crustaceans for a living and has been doing this for nine years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy seafood/crustaceans for her business. 
Janice Ann has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's living conditions by using the profits from buying and selling seafood/crustaceans.

loans.use: to buy seafood to sell in her business.

loans.name: Berthilde

texts.en: Berthilde is 45 years old. She is a widow with six children ages 10 to 25. She has been selling foodstuffs for the past five years. She has requested a loan to buy more peanuts, tomatoes and onions to resell.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Edith has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hairdressing. 

To help expand her business, Edith has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair styles, and will help Edith to generate greater profits and manage to build her residential house. Edith hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a training school for hairdressing. 

Edith is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edith who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hair styles for her salon.

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación, trabajan juntas desde el año 2010, y actualmente  se encuentran  en el 6º ciclo, donde todas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de respeto y ayuda mutua.
Cuenta la Sra. María  que solicita crédito para la compra de comestibles en general para surtir su negocio, como ser bebidas, enlatados, lácteos, panificados y demás, ya que ella tiene una despensa, donde atiende y surte a la mayoría de sus vecinos y personas de zonas aledañas. Ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a esta ayuda que recibe puede mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
This group emerged after one of its members contacted Fundación Paraguaya. They have worked together since 2010 and are currently in their sixth loan cycle. The members are able to proceed with their work in an atmosphere of respect and mutual support.

Sra. María is requesting a loan in order to buy general food products to restock her business such as beverages, canned goods, dairy products, baked goods, and other products. She manages a food pantry where most of the customers she serves are neighbors and people from the surrounding neighborhoods. María is very appreciative of the help she will receive so that she can improve her income and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods, dairy products, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, sweets and snacks.

loans.name: Rosa Vilma

texts.es:
Rosa, está solicitando un préstamo, por que considera necesario realizar el fortalecimiento en la obtención de mercadería como azúcar, huevos, aceite, arroz, frijol, que le servirán para surtir el negocio, dándole la oportunidad de generar buenas ventas.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior, fue positivo, que le permitió tener más surtido el negocio, su condición familiar manifiesta que está cambiando, debido al buen funcionamiento del negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is asking for this loan, as she feels it is necessary to increase the inventory of her business. She will purchase items such as sugar, oil, rice and beans that she will use to provide a greater variety of products for her customers. This will allow her to improve her sales.
With the last loan, she had a positive result. It allowed her to have a greater variety of goods for her business. She can see that the conditions for her family are changing because of the success of her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, eggs, oil, rice and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various goods such as shoes, clothes and bags for resale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 30 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two currently in school. For the past two years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells hardware items such as iron sheets. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more iron sheets for resale, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and improve her business. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to increase the success of her business. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mariam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more iron sheets for resale.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly de 62 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración de pasteles, plato típico colombiano, que consiste en un amasijo de masa o arroz, preparado con verduras, carnes y otros ingredientes envueltos en hojas de bijao, atado con un ico y sometido a la cocción. Este negocio es producto de la tradición de su madre quien trabajó en este oficio durante muchos años y cuando esta falleció, Nelly continuó con su negocio. En esta microempresa trabajan varios de sus familiares que se encargan de la preparación del alimento y distribución comercial del producto. Gracias a esta actividad Nelly ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y hoy tiene su casa propia y se siente realizada como mujer y persona importante en su familia. Su meta es continuar trabajando incansablemente para conseguir cada vez mas bienestar y felicidad para su  misma y para su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará al por mayor materias primas para elaborar pasteles como arroz, aceitunas, alcaparra, carne, pollo, cerdo y verduras y abordar un mercado potencial que espera conquistar con calidad de sus productos y buenos precios.
texts.en: 62-year-old Nelly makes "pasteles", a typical Colombian pastry consisting of a mixture of dough or rice with vegetables, meat and other ingredients, which are wrapped in bijao leaves (similar to banana leaves), tied and then cooked. This business is a result of the tradition started by her mother, who remained in this line of work for many years and, when she passed away, Nelly carried on with her business. Many of her family members work in this micro-enterprise; they're in charge of food preparation and commercial distribution of the products. Thanks to this business Nelly has succeeded in getting her family ahead. Today she owns a house of her own and feels like an accomplished woman and an important member of her family. Her goal is to keep on working tirelessly in order to achieve more and more happiness and well-being for herself and for her family. She's currently requesting a Kiva loan, her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to purchase wholesale supplies for making "pasteles", such as rice, olives, capers, meat, chicken, pork and vegetables. She will take on a potential market which she hopes to conquer with the quality of her products and her good prices.

loans.use: to purchase rice, olives, capers, meat, chicken, pork and vegetables.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase compost, insecticide and pesticide.

loans.name: Atyrkul

texts.ru:
Атыркул 61 год, вдова, воспитала 2 детей. Атыркул с 2005 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Атыркул,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 дойные коровы с приплодом и 7 овец, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 5,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Атыркул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец для откорма их на пастбищах, что позволит уменьшить расходы на корм.  Доходы от кредита Атыркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Atykul is 61 years old, she is a widow and has raised two children. Atykul has been involved in animal husbandry since 2005 and has started this business with an amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Atykul now has two milk cows with calves and seven sheep as well as the sale of milk and dairy products which brings around 5,000 som a month.

With the goal to further grow her business Atykul has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 20,000 KGS to buy sheep for grazing on the fields which will allow her to decrease the expenses on fodder. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further growth of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Jose Obdulio

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, vive con su esposa y un hijo, él trabaja desde hace dos años en la siembra de maíz y tambien trabaja como motorista de un microbús, con estas actividades ha logrado tener lo necesario como fuente de ingreso para su familia.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos para el cultivo de maíz, como lo son abono, herbicidas, y otros materiales que le ayudan en el proceso del cultivo, esto le ayudara a mejorar las posibilidades de tener una cosecha sana y abundante.
El objetivo de José es tener una buena experiencia con su préstamo, poder mejorar la producción del cultivo, además tiene a futuro la compra de un microbús.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and child and makes a living growing corn. He has worked growing corn for two years and also works as a minibus driver. With these businesses, he has succeeded in obtaining a sufficient source of income for his family. 

José is seeking a loan for the purchase of supplies for the growing of corn, which include fertilizer, herbicides and other supplies that help him in the cultivation process. This would help him to improve the likelihood of having a wholesome and abundant harvest. José's goal is to have a good experience with his loan, to be able to improve his agricultural production and hopes in the future to purchase a minibus.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr: Aliou est un homme marié.Il est père de quatre enfants qui fréquentent tous l'école.En plus de ses activités dans l'administration, il pratique l'élevage à domicile notamment l'embouche bovine.Il achète des bœufs qu'il engraisse puis revend au bout de sept mois.Cette activité lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et à ses propres besoins.Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter un bœuf.Son ambition est de développer ses capacités d'embouche.
texts.en:
Aliou is a married man and a father of four children who all attend school. In addition to his work in administration, he is a livestock farmer at home, particularly in the raising of cattle. He buys steers which he fattens and then resells after seven months. This business brings in revenues substantial enough to enable him to support his family and himself.

He is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy a steer. His ambition is to develop his capacity to raise livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past four years, Farida has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells garment clothes. 

To help expand her business, Farida has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more garment clothes for resale, and will help Farida to generate greater profits and send her children back to school. Farida hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her house and open up another shop in town. 

Farida is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Farida who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more garment clothes for resale.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Carolyn has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells electronic items like energy saver bulbs. 

To help expand her business, Carolyn has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more electrical items like bulbs for resale, and will help Carolyn to generate greater profits and manage to build her residential house. Carolyn hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a wholesale electrical shop. 

Carolyn is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Carolyn who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more electrical items like bulbs for resale.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio es un hombre de 47 años, se encuentra felizmente casado, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, cuyas edades son de 14 y 12 hijos, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones prepara uno de sus platos favoritos como es el delicioso “Seco con Frejoles”; Dionisio siempre ha sido un hombre muy emprendedor que ha trabajado desde muy joven, lamentablemente por la necesidad de solventar sus gastos y ayudar a sus padres, no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios, pero le gustaría poder concluirlos algún día.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias a su entusiasmo y al apoyo de su familia, Dionisio puso en marcha su negocio de cultivo de tuna donde trabaja un aproximado de 10 horas diariamente, él se siente muy a gusto con su negocio ya que siempre le ha gustado el campo y el trabajo que se realiza en él. 
Dionisio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos para la infesta de cochinilla a todo su cultivo de tuna, de esta manera podrá aprovechar la estación y obtendrá abundante cría de cochinilla, así cuando la cosecha de su cultivo termine, podrá obtener buenas ganancias de las ventas realizadas, favoreciendo de esta manera a que poco a poco Dionisio pueda cumplir su gran sueño de brindar una mejor calidad de vida para su querida familia.
texts.en:
Dionisio is a 47-year-old man who is happily married. He lives in the town of Nazca with his wife and two children aged 14 and 12. When he has free time, he enjoys to read for a bit and on some occasions he prepares one of his favorite dishes, such as the delicious "seco con frejoles" (marinated lamb with beans). Dionisio has always been a very enterprising man who has worked since he was very young. Unfortunately, due to the need to pay for his expenses and help his parents, he couldn't finish elementary school, but he would like to complete it someday.
On his own initiative, and thanks to his enthusiasm and the support from his family, Dionisio started his business growing prickly pears. He works approximately 10 hours a day. He feels very good in his business, since he has always enjoyed the country and the work that is done there.
Dionisio is very thankful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to cover the expenses of introducing cochineal insects throughout his prickly pear crop. That way he can take advantage of the season and get an abundant cochineal insect breed, so that when he finishes harvesting his produce, he will be able to get good profits from his sales. This will help Dionisio to achieve, little by little, his biggest dream of prodiving his beloved family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to cover the expenses of introducing cochineal insects throughout his prickly pear crop.

loans.name: Thamar

texts.fr:
Thamar  est née au Rwanda et a 50 ans. Elle est mariée avec 10 enfants de 9 à 28 ans, dont 9 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 5 ans de secondaire. 

Thamar est salariée. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 250 pièces des chevrons, 10 pièces des tôles et payer le transport pour la réhabilitation de sa propre maison d’habitation.   

Thamar voudrait bâtir une maison moderne et forte.
texts.en:
Thamar was born in Rwanda and is 50 years old. She is married and has ten children, from 9 to 28 years old. Nine of the children have had schooling. She has five years of secondary education.

Thamar is salaried. This is her first loan cycle with the microfinance institution ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy 250 each of rafters and 10 lengths of sheet metal and to pay for transport for renovating her own house. 

Thamar would like to build a strong, modern house.

loans.use: to buy 250 each of rafters and 10 lengths of sheet metal and to pay for transport for renovating her own house

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Зульфие 37 лет, одна воспитывает 3 детей. Зульфия с 1998 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 500 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Зульфии,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 1 дойная корова с приплодом и 4 бычка, продажа молока и молочных продуктов приносит около 10,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зульфия обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку коровы.  Доходы от кредита Зульфия планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Zulfiya is 37 years old, she is raising three children. Since 1998 Zulfiya has been involved in animal husbandry, she started this business with an amount of 500 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Zulfiya now has one milk cow with calves and four bulls as well as the sale of milk and dairy products which brings around 10,000 som a month.

With a goal to further grow her business Zulfiya has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS to buy a cow. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Rabiya

texts.ru:
Рабие 54 года, замужем, воспитала 4 детей – учитывая низкую занятость молодежи на местном рынке труда, сыновья Рабии находятся на заработках в России. Рабия с 2000 года занимается животноводством, ставшим основным источником дохода для ее семьи, начав этот бизнес с суммы 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Рабии,  в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 1 дойная корова, две телки  и один бык, продажа молока и молочных продуктов местному перерабатывающему заводу  приносит около 6,000 сом в месяц. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рабия обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 2 коров.  Доходы от кредита Рабия планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Rabiya is 54 years old, she has raised four children. Considering the low employment rate on the local labor market her sons are now working in Russia. Since 2000 Rabiya has been involved in animal husbandry, a business which became the main source of income for her family which she started with an amount of 30,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Rabiya now has one milk cow, two heifers and one bull as well as the sale of milk and dairy products to the local dairy factory which brings around 6,000 som a month.

With a goal to further grow her business Rabiya has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy two cows. She plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase two cows.

loans.name: Lilya

texts.ru:
Лилия замужем. У нее есть взрослый сын. Лилия имеет свой собственный бизнес.

Лилия занимается продажей летней обуви и одежды  на протяжении 15 лет. Она имеет собственную торговую точку на центральном рынке. Лилия ответственная и трудолюбивая. Она всегда старается выбирать товар, который будет интересен покупателям.

Лилия просит предоставить ей кредит на сумму 7,000 гривен на закупку сезонного товара - тапочек, вьетнамок, шлепанцев, футболок, пр. Кредит поможет ей получить дополнительную прибыль и тем самым улучшить быть семьи.
texts.en:
Lilya is married. She has a grown son. Lilya has her own business, she sells summer shoes and clothing for the past fifteen years.

She has her own vendor spot on the central market. Lilya is responsible and hardworking. She always tries to select merchandise which will interest her customers.

She is asking to provide her with a loan in the amount of 7,000 hryvnia to buy seasonal merchandise such as slippers, flip flops, scandals, t-shirts, etc. The loan with help her get additional profit which will improve livelihood of her family.

loans.use: to buy slippers, flip flops, t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Yeyssa

texts.fr: Yeyssa est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de cinq enfants.Deux de ses enfants fréquentent l'école primaire de son village alors que deux autres vont au collège située dans la plus proche ville, à cinq kilomètres.Yeyssa s'occupe des travaux domestiques de son ménage et pratique en même temps l'élevage de moutons et de chèvres.A l'approche de la fête de Tabaski, elle achète des moutons qu'elle engraisse puis revend à de bons prix.Cette activité lui permet de changer s garde robe, de renouveler l'habillement des enfants et de participer fortement aux dépenses d'alimentation de la famille.Afin de faire une nouvelle opération, elle sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter des moutons et de l'aliment bétail.
texts.en:
Yeyssa is a married woman and a mother of five children. Two of her children attend primary school in her village, while two others go to the middle school located in the nearest city, 5 km away. Yeyssa takes care of the housework in her home and simultaneously raises sheep and goats. 

As the Tabaski holiday approaches, she is buying sheep which she fattens and then resell at a good price. This business enables her to change her wardrobe, renew the children's clothing, and really help to cover her family's food costs. 

In order to restart, she is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy sheep and some animal feed.

loans.use: to buy sheep and animal feed

loans.name: Ilimane

texts.fr: Monsieur Ilimane est un résident du Sénégal. Il est célibataire et exerce une double activité : il est à la fois  pêcheur et aviculteur. Ça fait plus de 3 ans qu’il est aviculteur et s’active dans le secteur de la pêche depuis plus de  20 ans. Il est un sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où il sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 300.000 francs CFA. Ce prêt lui permettra  de s’approvisionner en poussins et aliments  pour rendre son activité avicole   plus bénéfique. Par conséquent il aura l’opportunité d’épargner d’avantage d’argent afin de pouvoir un jour réaliser son projet futur qui consiste a bâtir un toit pour son foyer.
texts.en:
Mr. Ilimane is a resident of Senegal. He is unmarried and has dual work: he is both a fisherman and a poultry farmer. For over three years, he has been a poultry farmer and has been active in the fishing sector for over twenty years. 

He is a partner of a U-IMCEC branch office, where he is requesting a loan in the amount of 300,000 francs CFA. This loan will enable him to stock up on chicks and feed to make his poultry business worthwhile. Consequently, he will have the chance to save more money, so as to realize his future plans, consisting of building a roof for his home one day.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for business purposes

loans.name: Gorgui

texts.fr: Gorgui est un homme marié et père de huit enfants. Depuis plus de 40 ans, il pratique l'agriculture et l'élevage.Il cultive des champs de mil et d'arachide.Il achète également des boeufs qu'il engraisse puis revend.Il entretient sa famille avec les revenus tirés de ces deux activités. Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter un bœuf et des aliments de bétail.Il ambitionne de réaliser un grand enclos pour mieux pratiquer l'embouche bovine.
texts.en:
Gorgui is a married man and a father of eight children. For over forty years, he has been a farmer and has raised livestock. He has fields of millet and peanuts. He also buys cattle and fattens them and then resells them. He takes care of his family with the revenues derived from these two businesses. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy a head of cattle and some animal feed. His ambition is to build a large pen to raise cattle better.

loans.use: to buy cattle and some animal feed

loans.name: Vincent

texts.fr:
Vincent est né au Rwanda et il a 28 ans, il est marie avec 1 enfant de 1an. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de secondaire.
Vincent est commerçant. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 20 sacs de ciment, 8 pièces de triplex, 2 camions de sable, 3 portes pour construire sa maison d’habitation.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  construire des maisons destine à louer.
texts.en:
Vincent was born in Rwanda and is 28 years old. He is married and has one child, who is 1 year old. Vincent has five years of secondary education. He is a merchant. 

This loan cycle is his first one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy 20 sacks of cement, 8 pieces of triplex, 2 truckloads of sand, and 3 doors to build his house. 

In the coming years, he would like to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of cement, 8 each of triplex, 2 truckloads of sand, and 3 doors to build house

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past three years, Milton has been working hard to manage his poultry farm which sells chicken. 

To help expand his business, Milton has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chickens for resale and will help Milton to generate greater profits and manage to set up more chicken houses. Milton hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his farm and to also start keeping cattle. 

Milton is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small business owners like Milton who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for resale

loans.name: Jammiyatou Takhwoun 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Jammiyatou Takhwoun 2" est un groupe de solidarité qui se  compose de 5 hommes originaires de la région centre du pays.Ils exercent dans le commerce de produits céréaliers.Ils achètent de grandes quantités à l'intérieur du pays, les stockent puis les revendent lorsque la demande baisse sur les marchés.Cette activité leur permet d'entretenir leurs familles et de subvenir à leurs propres besoins.Le chef de groupe(en pantalon et chemise , à gauche) est un ancien étudiant qui a quitté l'université après deux ans pour se lancer dans le commerce.Il tient ainsi un magasin de vente d'arachide, de mil, de haricot, et d'autres produits agricoles.Il vend aussi de la paille d'arachide qui sert de nourriture aux moutons et bœufs mis en stabulation.Afin de renforcer leurs fonds de commerce, le groupe sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des produits céréaliers.
texts.en:
The group "Jammiyatou Takhwoun 2" is a solidarity group composed of five men from the same central region of the country. They have commercial businesses involving grain products. They buy large quantities inland, stock them, and then resell them when the market demand is low. This business enables them to take care of their families and to support themselves. 

The head of the group (wearing pants and a shirt at the left in the photo) is a former student who left university after two years to get started in commerce. Thus he has a store selling peanuts, millet, beans, and other farm produce. He also sells peanut plant stalks used as food for sheep and cattle in stables. 

To bolster its business capital, the group is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy grain products.

loans.use: to buy grain products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, whey and shoes.

loans.name: Reyna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reyna es una mujer de 27 años, se encuentra felizmente casada, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos de 7 y 1 años de edad, ella siempre ha sido una persona muy trabajadora, entusiasta y emprendedora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos junto con su esposo para sacara adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo; en sus ratos le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, Reyna arrendo una pequeña parcela donde cultiva pallar, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, donde desde tempranas horas de la mañana ella se dedica a realizar las labores de campo que requiere su cultivo; ella se siente a gusto realizando esta labor ya que desde niña sus padres le ensañaron este tipo de trabajos y ella desea seguir con esta tradición familiar.
Reyna se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de fumigación con pesticidas, herbicidas y los gastos de riego que requiere su cultivo; de esta manera Reyna podrá mantener su cultivo en buenas condiciones y así cuando su cosecha termine podrá obtener buenas ganancias, con las cuales en un futuro no muy lejano espera poder comprar un terreno propio para sus futuros sembríos.
texts.en:
Reyna, 27, is happily married and lives with her husband and their 2 small children, 7 and 1, in Nazca.  She has always been a hard-working, enthusiastic and entrepreneurial woman who puts all her effort together with her husband to get the family ahead.  Sadly, because of the need to work and cover expenses, she couldn’t study to be a professional but she very much would have liked to have done so.  With her free time she likes to read and sometimes prepare a delicious  arroz Chaufa (Peruvian fried rice) to share with her family.

On her own initiative and thanks to the support of her family, Reynda rented a small piece of land where she grows butter beans.  She spends about  10 hours a  day starting very early in the morning with the farm work that needs to be done.  She is happy in this work since her parents taught her from when she was very young and she wants to continue with the family tradition.

Reyna is very grateful for the Kiva loans since thanks to them, she has been helped covering the costs of fumigation and the irrigation expenses that the plants need.  This way Reyna can keep her crop healthy and also when the plants are ready, she can get a good income.  In the near future she would like to buy her own land for future planting.

loans.use: to pay for fumigation and irrigation expenses and herbicides

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr: Madame Salimata habite au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et à sa charge deux enfants dont l’un est âgé de 12 ans et l’autre de 6 ans. Elle est femme de  ménage dans une cité de la place depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle  est membre dans   l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Elle  sollicite un crédit de 75 000 fca  prévu pour le règlement des frais médicaux en vue d’assister sa maman qui est malade. Avec ce nouveau crédit sollicité. Son objectif est de rétablir l’équilibre social à la maison mais son projet futur consiste a devenir dans l’avenir une grande commerçante de produits diversifiés (tissus, chaussures et produits cosmétiques).
texts.en:
Ms. Salimata lives in Senegal. She is married and support two children, of whom one is 12 years old, and the other is 6. She has been a housekeeper in a local housing development for over ten years. 

She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch office and has already repaid a previous loan. She is requesting a loan of 75,000 francs for paying medical bills for the purposes of helping her mother, who is ill. 

With this new loan being requested, her goal is to restore the social balance in her home, and her future plans consist in becoming a major businesswoman of diverse goods (fabrics, shoes, and cosmetics).

loans.use: to pay for her mother's medical expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs and a variety of other merchandise that has been pre-ordered through catalogues.

loans.name: Benoït Coly

texts.fr: Benoït est un homme marié et père de quatre enfants. Il tient un commerce de denrées alimentaires dans une boutique implantée dans son quartier.Il vend en détail du riz, de l'huile, du sucre , du savon et d'autres divers produits de consommation courante.Ce commerce lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille ainsi que ses propres besoins.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter du riz, de l'huile et du sucre.Son ambition est d'ouvrir une seconde boutique.
texts.en:
Benoït is a married man and the father of four children. He has a provisions business in a store set up in his district. He is a retail seller of rice, oil, sugar, soap, and a variety of other common consumer goods. This business brings in the revenues allowing him to take care of his family, as well as himself. 

To bolster his business capital, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy rice, oil, and sugar. His ambition is to open another store.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Main Dans La Main Group

texts.fr: Marié à une revendeuse et père de 05 enfants dont 03 à l’école, Mr Koussadja est le responsable de l’association MAIN DANS LA MAIN. Il est un vaillant homme et est dans le domaine de l’agriculture. Sa spécialité est la culture du mais. Son approvisionnement se fait à SOTOUBOUA et il exerce l’activité dans un quartier de la place en RÉGION CENTRALE. Il veut assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants, acheter une moto pour son propre déplacement et s’auto suffir sur le plan alimentaire. Les autres membres exerce la même activité que le responsable et ils sont constitués d’hommes et de femmes. C’est un groupement qui ont foi à la terre et ne lésine à investir leurs moyens financiers pour avoir un bon rendement.
texts.en:
Married to a retailer, and the father of five children, of whom three are in school, Mr. Koussadja is the official of the association MAIN DANS LA MAIN. He is a valiant man and works in the agricultural sector. His speciality is growing corn. He gets his supplies from SOTOUBOUA, and he operates his business in a local district in RÉGION CENTRALE. He wants to ensure his children are educated, buy a motorbike for his own transportation, and be self-sufficient in food. 

The other members have the same work as the official of the group, which is made up of men and women. This group has faith in the land and does not skimp on investing their funds to obtain a good yield.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Particia

texts.en:
Particia is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past six years, Particia has been working hard to manage her restaurant which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Particia has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more fresh food like matooke (made from bananas) to cook for resale. This will help Particia to generate greater profits and to manage to keep her children at school. Particia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a hotel. 

Particia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Particia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock fresh food like matooke to cook for resale

loans.name: Carlos Gilbel

texts.es:
Carlos, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque iniciara el trabajo agrícola, para esto deberá comprarse los materiales como el abono y los herbicidas, que son muy necesarios para prevenir de las plagas al cultivo de maíz y frijol.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a Carlos a comprarse los materiales para aplicarlos al cultivo, del cual logro tener una buena cosecha, de la que ha logrado tener disponibilidad para vender y para alimento familiar, tambien se compro dos terneros.
texts.en: Carlos is requesting a new loan to begin his agricultural work. He plans to purchase materials like fertilizer and herbicides, which are very necessary to prevent plagues to his corn and bean crops. The previous loan helped him buy materials to apply to his crops, through which he achieved a good harvest that he was able to sell and feed his family, and he also purchased two plots of land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Florece

texts.en:
Florece is 39 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Florece has been working hard to run a nursery school. 

To help expand her business, Florece has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase the size of her school which will help Florece to generate greater profits and create more classrooms. Florece hopes that in the future she will be able to create a bigger school. 

Florece is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florece who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase the size of her school

loans.name: Al-Nagah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Nagah. The group is made up of 4 members: Najah, Hakimh, Sawod and Aml. They have applied for a loan of 190000 YER from AMB. They live in Sana`a, Yemen.

The president of the group, Najah, is 28-years-old and a single woman (she is the woman who holds beige dress). She makes a living by making ladies clothes. She started her business with sewing babies' clothes, then sewing dresses. She intends to expand her business to sew wedding dresses. She applied for a youth loan of 40000 YER from AMB. She is going to use this loan to buy wholesale fabric. Her reason for asking for the loan is that she lacks the cash. She faces challenges in her business. She is going to use the profits to continue buying machinery and materials for her business and thus, be able to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fabric for her business.

loans.name: Hamidah

texts.en:
Hamidah is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale, in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Hamidah has been working hard to manage her clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Hamidah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stock for her shop and will help Hamidah to generate greater profits and to increase daily sales. Hamidah hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open another branch in town. 

Hamidah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hamidah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Posiyano

texts.en:
Posiyano is 26 years old and lives in the town of Kireka, in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, 1 of them currently in school. 

For the past 5 years, Posiyano has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells motor spare parts. To help expand his business, Posiyano has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more motor spare parts for resale, and will help Posiyano to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. Posiyano hopes that, in the future, he will be able to start a large motor spare parts shop  in town. 

Posiyano is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Posiyano who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more motor spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kireka, in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of them currently in school. 

For the past 5 years, Edward has been working hard to manage his stone quarrying, which sells stones that are used for building houses. To help expand his business, Edward has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more materials to be used in the stone quarrying business, and will help Edward to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Edward hopes that, in the future, he will be able to own a hardware shop. 

Edward is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edward who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to be used in the stone quarrying business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts for trade

loans.name: Amooti

texts.en:
Amooti is 56 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 12 years, Amooti has been working hard to manage his small tailoring business. 

To help expand his business, Amooti has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making clothes for resale. This will help Amooti to generate greater profits so he can manage to pay his children's school fees. Amooti hopes that in the future he will be able to build a tailoring training center. 

Amooti is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amooti who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making clothes for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata, aged 28, is married and has two children aged 10 and 6. She has one additional dependant who lives with her as her sales assistant.  In 2001, Fatmata established her business selling limes and yams. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband in taking care of their home. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month. 

Fatmata would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to plough funds into her present business so that she can increase customers and profit. In the future, Fatmata plans for further expansion and to increase her stock, to earn more profits and to send her children to university.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To plough funds into her present business to increase her customers and profit.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kubuli, in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past 4 years, Hellen has been working hard to manage her small restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Hellen has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more fresh food, like matooke, to cook and sell. It will help Hellen to generate greater profits and to pay for her medical expenses. Hellen hopes that, in the future, she will be able to start up another restaurant. 

Hellen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Hellen, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more fresh food, like matooke, to cook and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more rice by the bag for her shop

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 48 years old. He lives in the small village of Terjola District with his family: wife, Julieta, his mother, who is a pensioner and two children (10 and 12 years old). Both of the children study in the village school. 

David and Julieta earn their living through agricultural business. They have 2 milk cows, a calf and a pig. They produce cheese and sell it at the local open market. The family owns a vineyard as well and they have 800 nut trees. Harvested products are sold at the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 550 Laris.

David has requested a loan to purchase a milking cow. He wants to expand his business. With three milk cows, they will be able to produce more cheese and other dairy food. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to reinvest in the family's agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable. Taking into account the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
This is 33 yr old Abibatu. She is married and has 2 children, aged 18 and 16yrs. In 1997, Abibatu established her Local Food Stuff business. She began her business because she wants to develop her family in a responsible manner by assisting her husband to solving some domestic problems. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 600,000 every month from this business. 

Abibatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,0000. Abibatu requires a loan in order to buy more local food stuff for the store so that customers will be attended to when needed. In the future, Abibatu plans to assist her husband to build a house and to give a quality education to her children so that they can take care of her during her old age.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more local food stuff for the store so that customers will be attended to when needed.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of  whom are in school. She is not looking after any additional family members.

Robinah has been selling snacks for the last year from home and sells at retail, working six days a week. She does not have any other source of income.
She has requested a loan of UGX 200,000 from MCDT to enable her to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, wheat, cassava flour and charcoal in bulk. Her major challenges include the high transport costs of goods. She joined MCDT because she wanted more capital for her business. Her dream is to expand her business. She lives in her husband`s house with access to electricity, but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, wheat and cassava flour and charcoal.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli, in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children. For the past 6 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar and salt for resale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Mary hopes that, in the future, she will be able to start up another retail shop. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like sugar and salt to resell.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 39 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala North region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children who are all currently in school. For the past seven years, Mohamed has been working hard to manage his small business which sells electronic items like energy saver bulbs. 

To help expand his business, Mohamed has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more electrical items like bulbs for resale, and will help Mohamed to generate greater profits so he can pay his children's school fees. Mohamed hopes that in the future he will be able to build more rental houses. 

Mohamed is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mohamed who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy electrical items like bulbs for resale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Simon has been working hard to sell livestock including cattle, sheep and goats. 

To help expand his business, Simon has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to to buy more livestock, and will help Simon to generate greater profits and to increase his daily stock. Simon hopes that in the future he will be able to to set up a dairy farm. 

Simon is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Simon who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 50 yr old Kadiatu. She is married, and has 4 children aged 30, 27, 20 and 15yrs. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her as assistant sales men. 

In 1997, Kadiatu established her charcoal and wood business. She began her business because she was not educated so, therefore, she had to find an alternative way to generate income for the home and not to be dependent on her husband. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000  in order to buy 10 piles of wood @ SLL 250,000, 45 bags of charcoal @ SLL10,000 and the balance will be use for transportation. She plans to build her own house and to improve on the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 10 piles of wood @ SLL 250,000, 45 bags of char-coal @ SLL10,000 and the balance will be use for transportation.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en: This is 50 yr old Mabinty. She is a widow and has 2 children, aged 20 and 15 yrs. In 1997, Mabinty established her vegetable business. She began her business because she wanted to sustain the home, since she is now the bread winner. Working 7 days a week and 10 hrs a day, she earns about SLL 900, 000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Mabinty requires a loan to buy more stock. In the future, Mabinty plans to build her own house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Fayia

texts.en: This is 28 year old Fayia. He is married, and has 1 child, aged 3 years. In 2007, Fayia established his cosmetic business. He began his business because he wanted to improve on his life and the lives of his family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 600,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Fayia requires a loan in order to buy the latest items that customers are requesting. In the future, Fayia plans to expand the business by opening an outlet and he also plans to build a house for him and his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy the latest items that customers are requesting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new glass cutter.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.  Moses has been working hard to manage his brick-making business where he makes and sells bricks. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to to buy firewood for burning raw bricks, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and to expand his business. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to own a hardware store. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy firewood for burning raw bricks

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman is 45 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala North region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Herman has been working hard to manage his retail shop which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Herman has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like sugar and salt for resale, and will help Herman to generate greater profits and to pay his children's school fees. Herman hopes that in the future he will be able to build more rental houses. 

Herman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Herman who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy essential commodities like sugar and salt for resale

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Uma is 23 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 6.  In 2000, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  

In the future, Uma plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and their profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods.

loans.name: Yosada

texts.en:
Yosada is 28 years-old. She is married and has one child, aged 6. In 2006, Yosada established her tailoring business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.  

In the future, Yosada plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu
