texts.en: This is 50 year old Kadiatu. She is a widow, and has 6 children aged 28, 25,20,18,16 and 13 years. In 2004, Kadiatu established her plastic rubbers and pan sets business. She began her business because she wanted to support her family. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to stock her shop with different categories of plastic rubbers and pan sets. In the future, Kadiatu plans to become an international business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to stock her shop with different categories of plastic rubbers and set pans.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 33 year old Ibrahim. He is married, and has no children. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him as a sales assistant.  

In 2007, Ibrahim established his soft, alcoholic and energy drinks business. He began his business because he wanted to keep up his family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hrs. a day, he earns about SLL 600,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Ibrahim requires a loan in order to increase his stock and start selling by wholesale. In the future, Ibrahim plans to become a distributor for all the drinks companies in Sierra Leone. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to increase his stock and start selling by wholesale.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is single and has six children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Tina has been working hard to sell bananas. 

To help expand her business, Tina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to to buy more bananas, and will help Tina to generate greater profits which will be used to pay school fees. Tina hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a retail shop. 

Tina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Tina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more bananas

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is 69 years old: she lives in the small village of Terjola District with her husband, Zhironi, and her 20-year-old grandson. Nato and Zhironi are pensioners and earn their living through an agricultural business. Their grandson, Rati, helps them in the agricultural activities. The family owns two milking cows, a bull and a calf.  They produce cheese every day which is sold at the local open market. The family owns a vineyard as well. They pick grapes in late summer and press wine which they sell in nearby villages. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari.

Nato has requested a loan to purchase a milking cow. The family will be able to produce and sell more dairy food: cheese, curds and yogurt. They want to expand their business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, they will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business, as well as spending more on the family's daily needs. As a result of these activities, the family's living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: This is 38 year old Regina.  She is married and has 4 children, aged 21, 14, 13 and 10yrs. In 1995, Regina established her Palm Oil  and Charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant and, moreover, to assist her husband in taking care of the family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil and more bags of coal to satisfiy the customers' requests. In the future, she plans to help her husband to build their own house and improve on the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil and more bags of coal to always satisfy customers' requests.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 37 year old Amiinata. She is married, and has 1 child, aged 10 years. In 2006, Amiinata established her jeans, bedwear, slippers, shopping bags etc. business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in up keep of their family. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hrs a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. Amiinata requires a loan in order to buy fashionable jeans and shopping bags to attract customers. In the future, Aminata plans to educate her son up to university level and to also help her husband to build a house and operate another outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy fashionable jeans and shopping bags to attract customers.

loans.name: Yainkain

texts.en: This is 48 year old Yankain. She is married, and has 1 child, aged 6 months. In 1999, Yankain established her local food stuff and wearing business. She began her business to get income and to support her family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hrs a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Yankain has already received and successfully repaid her first loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock so that she can compete with colleague business partners. In the future, Yankain plans to build her own house and give a quality education to her adopted child. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more stock so that she can compete with colleague business partners.

loans.name: Geghetsik

texts.en:
Geghetsik is from the village of Atskuri, in the Southern part of Georgia. She is 49 years old and lives with her 29 year old son and father in law (85 years old). Geghetsik has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Geghetsik has 2 milk cows. She produces cheese and sells it in the village. She sells the harvest to local dairy products wholesalers. Ther total average monthly income of the family is 350 Laris. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Geghetsik has requested credit for start-up of a new agricultural business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the requested credit, Geghetsik will purchase up to 30 calfs. She will place them in a family-owned cattle-shed and feed them during summer and fall months. In winter, Geghetsik will sell the grown calfs for a higher price and get profit. She will use the received profit for purchasing additional milk cows for the expansion of the family farm. Also, Geghetsik will use the profits for improving the family's living conditions. As a result of the new business initiative implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the family will get more income and will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calfs.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is from village Tkhiltskaro, Southern part of Georgia. She is 32 years old and lives with her husband Gogita and three children: a 5 year old son, and two daughters (1 and 2 years old). Eka and Gogita requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is Gogita’s salary. He works as shepherd in the village and gets 150 Laris per month. It is hardly enough on food for 3 children. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Eka has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of an agricultural business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Eka will place the purchased calves in an old cattle-shed located in the family yard. She will raise them and, after 12 months, will start milking them. Eka will start production of cheese and she will sell it at the open market of the nearby town. As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will increase by 200%. Eka and Gogita will be able to create better living conditions for their children and themselves.

loans.use: to purchase calves for the start-up of a dairy farm.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 40 years old from the village of Lesa, in the district of Lanchkhuti. She is married and lives with her husband, Zurab, their 5-year-old daughter and her mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. Zurab works in construction and earns income for the family. According to the government's estimation, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and they receive monthly social assistance. Ketevan is busy with agricultural activities. She has a milking cow. She produces cheese and sells it with the milk at the local open market. The family owns a plot of land, where maize and nut-trees are grown. Harvested products are sold locally to retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is approximately 400 Lari.

With the requested credit, Ketevan plans to purchase an additional milking cow. She will get more milk and produce more cheese. This will increase sales and accordingly the family's income. With increased income, she will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business in order to expand it and make it more profitable. Taking into account the above mentioned, the family's living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Vision Group

texts.en:
In the hills of San Francisco el Alto, Totonicapán, Guatemala, where many people are engaged in clothing production, animal husbandry, and weaving, lives María and her family. María is a 30-year old married mother of two. Although María was only able to attend school through sixth grade, she now has high hopes for the future of her children. 

For many years María and her husband have run a small business making garments. It was not until three years ago that María realized that, in order for her business to continue to grow, she would need additional funding. As her clients’ demands for her product increased, María knew she would need to buy more raw materials than she could currently afford. As María explains, "we must seize the opportunities presented to us and not ignore them, because they only come once."  It was at this point that María decided to join Friendship Bridge’s Microcredit Plus program. 

María recruited other women in her community to join with her and founded the Vision Trust Bank. María is very happy and proud of herself and her fellow Trust Bank members for having the courage to take out loans and invest in their businesses. María’s loan has ensured that she and her husband always have the necessary materials on hand to produce what their clients order. María's greatest achievement has been to provide employment for three more people (one woman and two men), meaning her microloan not only impacts her and her family but also her community.

With this new loan, María plans to buy different types of fabrics and thread to diversify the products that she can produce. She currently delivers 25-30 orders of garments to her suppliers twice a month. María’s Trust Bank is about to begin its fifth loan cycle, providing nine women with funds that will help them develop their businesses. In addition to receiving loans, these women meet once a month to receive training from Friendship Bridge and to discuss topics such as business management, budgeting, self-esteem and health. These lessons not only provide the women with valuable information regarding their businesses and their family’s health, but also foster a community of support among the women.

loans.use: to buy different fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Chucuxcabel Group

texts.en:
In the community of Patachaj, San Cristóbal Totonicapán, Guatemala, in December of 2011, a group of 13 entrepreneurial women decided to form the Chucuxcabel Trust Bank, which is now about to begin its second loan cycle. Most of the women in the Chucuxabel Trust Bank are engaged in animal husbandry, weaving, embroidery and garment making, among other activities.

One of the 13 women in this Trust Bank is Santos, a 33-year old mother of three (two boys and one girl). While Santos herself was never able to attend school, she is happy to share that two of her children are already in primary school, which makes her very proud. In addition to running a small weaving business, Santos is currently engaged in animal husbandry. 

With her first loan from Friendship Bridge, Santos began raising pigs. She started small, with only one pig, which she eventually sold for money that she put towards her children's education. Thanks to this first loan, Santos was also able to save some money, which she plans to combine with her second loan from Friendship Bridge to buy three more pigs, as well as thread for her weaving. Before Friendship Bridge, Santos had been unable to receive loans from formal banks, due to of her lack of education. This severely limited her ability to run a successful business. Now, thanks to Friendship Bridge, Santos has access to working capital and is thankful for the opportunity to overcome her difficult situation. 

Santos's dream is to see her business grow and provide more money for her family. She wants to, one day, have a bigger farm and build her own home (as she is currently renting). Santos meets with her Trust Bank once a month for training, where they participate in educational lessons on business, money management, self-esteem, women’s rights, health and how to support their children’s education. These lessons, combined with their loans, help them to provide a better life for themselves and their families. The women of Chucuxcabel are grateful for the people who trust in them, enabling them to obtain loans for their businesses and overcome the poverty that surrounds them.

loans.use: to buy 3 pigs, and thread for weaving.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
58 year old Leonora is a resident of Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has six grown children. Leonora operates a sari-sari where she sell basic household needs like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasoning, toiletries and rice. In addition to this, she is also a vegetable vendor. In her stall, she sells taro, bottle gourds, potatoes and green leafy vegetables. 

Leonora is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables and different merchandise for her store. Leonora hopes that with additional capital, she can continue to make better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and different merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ma. Ailyn

texts.en:
Ma. Ailyn is a food vendor from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She sells snack foods like banana cue (deep fried banana) and home cooked dishes for meals for an income.  Her husband helps to support the family through fishing. She is 35 years old and has four children. Her eldest is 7 years old and the youngest is 10 months. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like rice, meat and seasoning for her food business. She would like to continue improving her business so that she can give her family a comfortable life and her children can always go to school.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like rice, meat and seasoning for her food business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 42 years old from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children of ages 5, 8, 10, 12 and 16. She and her family are engaged in the fishing business for an income.  Her business has been in existence for 15 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like gasoline and crab traps. She is determined to make sure that her children has a good education with her income. She would like to continue her business so she can provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like gasoline and crab traps

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old, married and has 4 children. Esterlita owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns 20,000 PHP a month from it. In 2007, Esterlita joined GDMPC. Esterlita is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda is 48 years old. She is from the village of Orgora and lives there with her family: her husband, Arsen, and three daughters (aged 14, 20 and 21). The youngest is a schoolgirl and studies at the village school, the 20-year-old daughter is a university entrant and the eldest is a student. Izolda and Arsen run an agricultural business. 

The only source of income for the family is a small dairy farm with two milking cows. They produce dairy products: cheese, curds and yogurt. Part of the dairy food is used by the family and the rest is sold at the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari. They don’t have enough income to save enough to finance the studies of their three children. Their income is hardly enough to provide food for a five-member family. 

With the requested credit, Izolda will buy calves and raise them. She plans to sell them after a year for a higher price. She hopes to receive a good profit. This will positively influence the family's income. Izolda will be able to finance her children's education and make them happy.

Izolda and Arsen hope for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is widowed and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past four years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her retail business selling charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to to buy more charcoal, and will help Joyce to generate greater profits which will be used to pay school fees. Joyce hopes that in the future she will be able to to open a bar. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Goderdzi

texts.en:
Goderdzi is 46 years old. He lives in a small village in Zestaponi District with his family: his wife, Lela, and two children (aged 14 and 15). Both of their children go to the local school. 

Goderdzi and Lela earn their living through an agricultural business. In particular, they have livestock with four cows, a calf, two bulls and two pigs. They are very hard-working people who take good care of their livestock. They milk their cows twice a day and produce dairy food: cheese, curds and yogurt. They sell the dairy foods that they produce in nearby villages. The family also owns 0.9 hectare of land, where nut-trees are grown. They sell the nuts in the Zestaponi market. In addition to his agricultural business, Goderdzi works in construction and earns additional income for the family. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Lari.  

Goderdzi has requested a loan to purchase a milking cow so he can expand his dairy farm. With five milking cows, Goderdzi and Lela will be able to get more milk and produce more dairy foods. This will increase the sales from their business. With increased profits, they will be able to reinvest in the family's agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Josejhane

texts.en: Josejhane is 30 years old from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with one child, a son who is 5 years old. She is currently engaged in food vending and tricycle transportation services. This business has been in operation for 4 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy tools and tires and to pay for vulcanization. She is motivated to work hard and earn more so she can provide for her child and support his education.

loans.use: to buy tools and tires and to pay for vulcanization

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en: Juditha is from Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 68 years old, widowed and has five children. To make a living, Juditha owns and operates a business retail store. Juditha has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2003, Juditha joined GDMPC. Juditha is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is 27 years old from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with 2 children, ages 3 and 4. Marjorie finds her livelihood through fishing with her husband and buying and selling sea cucumbers. She is asking for a loan to buy more sea cucumbers from other fishermen that she can resell for a profit. Her income will then be used to provide her children with a healthy diet and to further reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more sea cucumbers

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 56 years old. He is from the Terjola District, is married and lives with his wife, Lia, and their 24-year-old son, Gogi. Gogi is a probationer at the aviation institute. Guram and Lia run an agricultural business. They have a vineyard with 1000 grapevines. They also are busy with cattle breeding: they have five milking cows, a calf and a pig. Gogi and Lia milk the cows twice a day and produce cheese. They sell harvested grapes and produce cheese for the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari. 

Guram has requested a loan to purchase a milking cow as he wants to expand his dairy farm. Guram and Lia will be able to sell on average 100 kg of cheese per month at the local open market. This will increase the family's income. With increased profits, they will be able to reinvest in the family agricultural business to expand it and make it more profitable. Also, the family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Hanifa has been working hard to manage her business selling tomatoes and Irish potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Hanifa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to to buy more Irish potatoes, and will help Hanifa to generate greater profits which will be used to pay school fees. Hanifa hopes that in the future she will be able to to own a grocery. 

Hanifa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hanifa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn is married with two children. Rosalyn is 25 years old and resides in Montol, Ozamis City, Philippines. Rosalyn owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting root crops for sale to earn a living, and she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 3,500 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2010, Rosalyn joined GDMPC. Rosalyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is from Silanga, Tangub City. She is 44 years old. Helen is married and has three children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the service sector operating transportation. Helen been in her business for twelve years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Helen joined GDMPC. Helen is requesting a loan of 5,200 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: 43-year-old Merlinda lives in Talibon with her family. She is married with four children, two of them still dependents. She has a thriving hog-raising business which helps her raise her family. This business started ten years ago. Merlinda is asking for a loan to buy feed and pay for her children's tuition fees. She plans to continue investing in hog-raising and make the business even bigger to better her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feed and pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama “Las Amigas”  ya que todas  dependen unas de otra para que su comité salga adelante y las integrantes están para ayudarse y seguir progresando en sus actividades.
Margarita es la presidenta del grupo, y ella misma se define como una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy emprendedora.  Comenta que se dedica a la venta de librería desde hace un tiempo, por lo que tiene ya una buena clientela que siempre acude a comprar de ella los útiles que vende.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de cuadernos, libros, lápices, borradores, pinceles y demás insumos para poder seguir surtiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en: The group is called "Las Amigas" because all of the members depend on each other to make headway, and the members are doing that by helping one another and making progress with their activities. Margarita is the group's president, and she defines herself as a very hard worker and above all a very enterprising woman. She has made a living running a bookstore for some time, and she has a good customer base that is always coming by to purchase the items she sells. She is requesting the loan to purchase notebooks, books, pencils, erasers, brushes and other supplies to keep her business stocked for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, books, pencils, erasers, brushes and other items.

loans.name: Melati Group

texts.en:
Pictured is the Melati group, neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali (three members of the group are not in the photo because of a religious ceremony they were attending at the temple). The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement family income, and out of their interest in education on the best practices for pig raising. 

The group has requested a new loan of 19,500,000 IDR, its fourth from MUK. Each member will receive 1,300,000 IDR which will be used to buy two quality piglets plus pig feed. While the price of feed and piglets is expensive, members of the group are already feeling the benefits from their first loan through their ability to meet the needs of their families. 

Group member Ni Ketut will use her portion of the loan to buy a pig to breed. She has seen the possibilities in selling piglets. To reduce costs, she gave the mixture feed (feed mixture is a mixture of good quality feed which's purchase at store that is mixed with various types of leaves, such as banana leaves, taro leaves and other leaf types are useful for the growth of pigs). She hopes her pig venture will succeed and bring prosperity to the whole family.

loans.use: to buy a pig to breed.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past four years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells sugar, soap and salt. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy essential commodities like sugar and salt for resale, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and pay her child's school fees. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to open a boutique business. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sylvia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy essential commodities like sugar and salt for resale

loans.name: Rolina

texts.en: Rolina is 32 years old from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with six children. Her eldest is thirteen years old and her youngest is two years old. Rolina’s desire is to help her husband in their fishing business. She is asking for a loan to buy flashlights, batteries and gasoline for their boat. Rolina would like to make sure that she can make her business more profitable. Her income will assure her that her children are kept in school and her family is well-nourished.

loans.use: to buy flashlights, batteries and gasoline

loans.name: Herberth Mauricio

texts.es:
Herbert, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para mejorar el negocio, siguiendo la inversión anterior, se comprara el juego de las cuatro llantas, para el taxi, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones del vehículo y seguir brindando un servicio más seguro a los clientes.  
Con el préstamo anterior pudo reparar el vehículo con la compra de repuestos, hasta el momento no ha tenido inconvenientes,  solo espera que este préstamo tambien le ayude a realizar una buena inversión y seguir trabajando para su familia.
texts.en: Herbert is requesting a new loan in order to improve his business following his previous investment. He plans to purchase a set of four tires for his taxi. This loan will help improve his vehicle's conditions and provide a safer service for his customers. With the previous loan he was able to repair the vehicle by purchasing replacement parts, and he hasn't had any inconveniences up to the moment. He hopes that this loan will also help him make a good investment so he can keep working for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a set of four tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Nelson Cesar

texts.es:
Nelson es un joven de 23 años de edad, muy trabajador y entusiasta vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica Perú, el cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, así como también se desarrolla la agricultura en especial los cultivos de esparrago, uva, algodón, entre otros, podemos encontrar en este distrito el bosque de piedras el cual se caracteriza por tener formaciones rocosas en forma de animales, personas, entre otros.  A Nelson le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos de su barrio y también le gusta degustar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual son los riquísimos “Tallarines Rojos”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de administración.

Día a día Nelson trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, ya que con  este trabajo el puede apoyar en su casa con los gastos,   el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes diariamente, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable cuando conduce y sobre todo porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Nelson está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al gran apoyo que le han brindado el podrá reparar su vehículo de trabajo ya que consume mucha gasolina y aceite, realizara una bajada de motor y un mantenimiento general, con ello el tendrá un vehículo en buen estado y podrá trabajar mejor cada día y podrá seguir apoyando a su hogar en los gastos y seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y tener una gran negocio”.
texts.en:
Nelson is 23 years old and is very hardworking and enthusiastic.  He lives in Parcona district in the province of Ica, Peru.  The district is known for its warm and welcoming climate as well as for the crops that are grown there, most notably asparagus, grapes, and cotton.  The district is also known for being the location of the ‘bosque de piedras’ [‘stone forest’], which contains rock formations that are shaped like animals, people, and other forms.  Nelson enjoys playing football with his friends from his neighborhood, and also likes sampling one of his favorite dishes, “Tallarines Rojos” [“red noodles”].  Nelson was only able to study up through his fifth year of secondary school due to his parents’ limited economic resources, but he would have liked to have pursued a career in administration.  

Nelson makes a living as a motorcycle taxi driver, which enables him to help his family with the household expenses.  He typically works about 10 hours a day, and can provide his services to as many as 30 customers in a day.  He believes that his business is going well because he drives very responsibly, and most importantly, because he is very pleasant to his customers.  

Nelson is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since their support will make it possible for him to repair his work vehicle.  His motorcycle taxi consumes a lot of gasoline and oil, and so he is going to tune up the engine and also do general maintenance work.  These repairs will ensure that Nelson has a vehicle that is in good condition and works better, and that he can continue helping his family with the household expenses and keep working toward achieving his greatest dream: to have his own house and own a large business.

loans.use: to do general maintenance work on his motorcycle taxi and get an engine tune-up.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past eight years, Martin has been working hard to manage his small business which sells sand that is used for building houses. 

To help expand his business, Martin has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sand to sell for building, and will help Martin to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Martin hopes that in the future he will be able to own a hardware shop. 

Martin is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Martin who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more sand to sell for building.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianéla, necesita invertir en el negocio, ya que con el préstamo anterior logro mejorar las ganancias manteniéndose hasta el momento con lo necesario para continuar vendiendo, ella comprara pepinos, rábanos, tomates, cebolla, güisquiles, aguacates, y frutas frescas, esto le ayudara a seguir creciendo y ofrecer productos frescos.
Ella nos comenta que en su núcleo familiar ha nacido un nuevo miembro, el cual le llena de alegría, tambien manifiesta que ha tenido la aceptación de mas y nuevos clientes que le ayudan hasta el momento a mejorar las ganancias familiares.
texts.en:
Marianéla needs to invest in her business, as with the previous loan she managed to improve her earnings, supporting herself up to now, and having what she needs to continue selling. 

She will buy cucumbers, radishes, tomatoes, onions, pear squash, avocados and fresh fruit. This will help her to continue growing and offering fresh produce.

She tells us that a new member has been born into into her immediate family, which fills her with joy. She also states she is popular with new and more  customers, which up to now has helped her to improve the family earnings.

loans.use: To buy cucumbers, radishes, tomatoes, onions, pear squash, avocados and fresh fruit.

loans.name: Theodora

texts.en:
Theodora is 24 years old. She is the first born in a family of seven. She lives in a small town called Petauke, located in the eastern part of Zambia. She runs her mobile money transfers business and she struggles to do her daily transactions because of low working capital. 

She says she loves her business because it gives her an opportunity to interact with different people and she gets to teach them new things about her business that they might not know. She believes her community benefits from her business because they are able to send and receive money in an environment that is not intimidating. 

Currently Theodora's working capital is not enough to serve customers who want to send larger amounts of money and so she has no choice but to send them away. It is for this reason that she needs the Kiva loan. 

Theodora is convinced that the loan will not only change her business but her personal life as well. This is because she will be able to serve more customers and therefore make more profits. The profits she says will help her to sponsor her younger siblings with their education and improve her standard of living. 

In her video, a representative from mobile transactions is interviewing Theodora.

loans.use: To add to her small working capital so that she can serve customers who want to send larger amounts of money

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is 35 years old. She has three children aged between seven and fifteen. All of the children attend school. The loan requested will be used to buy sugar, and soap to sell. She plans to use the profits for savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 33 years old and married with three children. He sells various goods, such as lotions, soap, buns, water, sugar, etc. James has four years of experience in this work and he currently employs two people to help him.  The hours of his business are from 5 a.m to 10 p.m every day. 

James has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods, such as lotions, soap, buns, water, sugar, etc., for resale.  With any profits, he will be able to save money for his future, pay school fees for his children, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various goods, such as lotions, soap, buns, water, sugar, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is from Lam-an, Ozamiz City. He is 43 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Joel owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. Joel has been engaged in his business for five years and earns 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2007, Joel joined GDMPC. Joel is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is married with four children. She is 43 years old and lives in Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Judith owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 4,200 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Judith has been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Judith's plan is to save her returns in order to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 46 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha y se encuentra felizmente casada, ella tiene 4 hijos quienes 2 de ellos ya son mayores y los otros 2 aun se encuentran bajo su cuidado; María siempre ha sido una persona muy trabajadora y entusiasta, que ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos junto con su esposo para sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver noticieros y programas educativos en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
 Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, desde hace unos meses María puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella realiza sus ventas de manera ambulatoria ofreciendo sus productos por las calles y mercados de su ciudad, así también parte sus ventas lo realiza en su hogar; María trabaja un aproximado de 6 horas diarias, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a su carisma y buena atención.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: pantalones, polos largos, buzos, chompas, entre otras prendas; de esta manera María tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, con los cuales desea poder ahorrar el dinero suficiente para que juntamente con su esposo puedan comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
María, 46, lives in the city of Chincha and is happily married and has four children, two of which are adults while the other two are still in her care.  María has always been a hard-working, enthusiastic person who has dedicated all her hard work, together with her husband, to provide for her family.  Unfortunately, because of the need to work to cover expenses, she was not able to get a college education.  She would have liked to very much and in her free time watches the news and educational programs on TV.  Sometimes she makes delicious "Carapulcra" and "Sopa Seca" (spicy stew and pasta) to share with her family.

On her own initiative and thanks to support from her family, a few months ago María set up a small business selling clothing.  She works as a street vendor offering her products throughout the city streets and markets.  She also sells from home.  Her work-day is approximately six hours long.  She believes business is going well because of her charisma and customer service.

María is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to buy merchandise such as pants, long-sleeved t-shirts, overalls, sweaters and other items of apparel.  This will make María's business better stocked ao she can increase sales and income; and she will be able to save enough money so that she and her husband can buy their own house.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as pants, long-sleeved t-shirts, overalls, sweaters, etc.

loans.name: Ana Carmela

texts.es: Ana de 49 años de edad tiene un negocio mediante el cual vende ranchos, víveres, abarrotes, refrescos, bebidas, carnes, lácteos y todos los artículos de consumo de la canasta familiar. En su tienda vende diariamente  de contado y compra también de contado, semanalmente, quincenalmente y mensualmente,  de acuerdo a la rotación de cada uno de sus productos. En los alrededores de su negocio,  todos coinciden en ir a comprar en la tienda de Ana, porque es un lugar ameno y agradable, pues se sienten muy bien atendidos y esta percepción se extiende cada vez mas entre su clientela. Por eso en la mediada en que su negocio crece,  comprar de contado y en mayor volumen se vuelve cada vez mas, un desafío. Esta es la razón por la cual   Ana Ha recurrido a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para acceder a un credikiva, mediante el cual surtirá su negocio de artículos que mas rotan diariamente, porque necesita tener un buen inventario para responder de inmediato a su clientela, que son las madres de familia que compran para preparar los alimentos de su familia. Su credikiva lo invertirá en comprar refrescos, bebidas, lácteos, enlatados, embutidos, aceite, arroz, legumbres y café. Su credikiva planea ser exitoso, porque lo hace en base a la demanda de su mercado y porque comprando en mayor volumen y de contado, ganará descuentos, que proporcionan sus proveedores, por este estilo de compra y esto es muy bueno para los ingresos de Ana.
texts.en:
Ana, 49, has a store where she sells groceries, beverages, meats, dairy products and all kinds of goods for the family shopping basket.  Every day she sells on a cash basis and also buys her products in cash, weekly, biweekly and monthly, depending on product turnover.  Everyone living nearby coincides at Ana's store because it is a nice, friendly place and they feel well cared for, which is a growing sentiment among her clientele.  Therefore, as her business grows, buying more volume in cash becomes increasingly difficult.

This is why Ana has turned to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation for a CrediKiva loan.  This will allow her to keep a stock of the daily consumption products, since she has to have enough inventory to respond immediately to her customers, who are mothers who must prepare food for their families.  She will use her loan to buy soft-drinks, beverages, dairy products, canned goods, sausage, oil, rice, legumes and coffee.  Her loan is sure to be successful because she is basing her request on market demand, and her suppliers will give her discounts for buying more volume and paying in cash.  This will be beneficial to Ana's income.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, beverages, dairy products, canned goods, sausage, oil, rice, legumes and coffee.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda hails from Talibon, Bohol. She is 49 years old and married with four children. While her husband is in the fishing business, Yolanda is into selling basic household needs through her small sari-sari store. She is also a vegetable vendor. In her store she sells cooking oil, salt, pepper, soy sauce, tomatoes, garlic, onions, spring onions and other vegetables. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables, seasoning, cooking oil, soy sauce and spices that she can resell. The additional stock would ensure that Yolanda has enough to sell to her customers. This will result in a better income for her family. She will also be able to provide nutritious food for her family. In the future, she plans another business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, seasoning, cooking oil, soy sauce and spices.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza con su credikiva anterior se sintió muy satisfecha, porque compró carnes, refrescos, cereales en mayor cantidad y sus inventarios rotaron rápidamente, porque su negocio está mucho mas surtido y esto agrada a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva nuevamente, mediante el cual comprará productos de dulcería, carnes y víveres en general, porque quiere aumentar aun mas su capital de trabajo y esto lo logrará con un nuevo aporte de capital a él. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias a ustedes logré surtir mejor mi negocio e incrementar mis ventas espero continúen apoyándome para poder crecer. “
texts.en: Maritza was very satisfied with her previous CrediKiva loan since she bought meat, soft-drinks, and cereal in greater quantities; and her inventory had a quick turnover because there was more variety which customers like.  She is applying for a new loan to buy bakery products, meat and groceries in general, as she wants to increase her working capital.  Her message to Kiva lenders is the following:  "Thanks to you I was able to improve my business and increase sales.  I hope you will continue supporting me so I can grow."

loans.use: To buy bakery products, meat and groceries in general.

loans.name: Samuel Luis

texts.es:
Samuel tiene 40 años, pero tiene un espíritu y una alegría de un joven de 15 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima caluroso y es una ciudad en la cual se pueden visitar muchos atractivos turísticos como las Líneas de Nazca, las pirámides de Cahuachi, el cementerio de Chauchilla, los acueductos de Cantalloc, entre otros, en los cuales podemos admirar lo grandioso de la cultura Nazca y en los que podemos despejarnos. Samuel en sus tiempos libres gusta de escuchar música y también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Escabeche”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres Samuel solo pudo estudiar hasta el tercer grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado terminar la escuela.

Día con día Samuel trabaja en su negocio de venta de pan y biscochos, el trabaja alrededor de 12 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes al día ya que recorre las calles de su ciudad para ofrecer sus productos el trabaja con mucho gusto en su negocio y por ello el cree que le va bien porque trabaja con ganas y sobre todo con mucha amabilidad para la atención a los clientes.

Samuel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá acondicionar  y mejorar su triciclo para vender sus productos, así como también poder comprar ingredientes para la preparación de sus panes como harina, levadura, sal, entre otros, así de esta manera tendrá una mejor herramienta para poder recorrer las calles y tener los insumos necesarios para producir sus productos, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando con gusto para cada día ir en busca de cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener una panadería propia ya que actualmente elabora sus productos en la panadería de un familiar “.
texts.en:
Samuel, 40, has the spirit and cheerfulness of a 15-year-old.  He lives in the city of Nazca which is known for its warm climate and tourist attractions such as the Lines of Nazca, the pyramids of Cahuachi, the cemetary of Chauchilla, and the aqueducts of Cantalloc, among others, which allow us to admire the splendor of the Nazca culture.  In his free time, Samuel enjoys listening to music and eating one of his favorite dishes, the delicious "Escabeche" (chicken made with onion and vinegar).  Because of Samuel's parents' lack of resources he was unable to finish his seconday education, but he would have liked to.

Every day Samuel goes out to sell bread and cakes.  He works around 12 hours a day and attends to an average 15 customers as he goes through the city streets peddling his products.  He enjoys his work very much and believes business is going well because he works hard, being especially kind and providing good service to his customers.

Samuel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he is able to upgrade the 3-wheel vehicle he uses to sell his products.  He can also buy ingredients to make bread such as flour, yeast, salt, etc., so this will give him the best tool he needs for his work and the ingredients necessary to make his products.  He will be able to increase his income and continue working hard to meet his goal, which is: "To have my own bakery because the products I sell are made at a relative's bakery".

loans.use: To upgrade his vehicle and buy supplies (flour, yeast, salt, etc.).

loans.name: 13 Campanas Group

texts.es:
El comité “13  Campanas” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní.  Son 13 las mujeres que se unen en este comité para poder luchar juntas y trabajar unidas.
María es miembro de este grupo, ella tiene una despensa con la cual surte a sus vecinos, y a las otras personas que acuden a su negocio. La meta de María es poder seguir creciendo y agradando su local.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, gaseosas, enlatados, productos a granel y demás. Agradece por ola ayuda que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "13 Campanas" was formed by several neighbors in the city of Santaní.  There are 13 women who joined the group to struggle and work together.

María is a member of the group and she runs a store where she sells to neighbors and other people who stop by.  Her goal is to continue growing and expanding her shop.

She is requesting a loan to buy meats, sodas, canned goods, bulk products, etc.  She is grateful for the assistance she is receiving.

loans.use: To buy meat, sodas, canned goods, bulk products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy roof tiles, plastered clay bricks, cement, lime powder, bricks.

loans.name: Las Perlas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación está integrado por 16 mujeres, todas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas trabajan con la fundación desde el año 2009,  se encuentran  en el 10º ciclo, donde todas ellas trabajan dentro de un ambiente de cooperación y respeto mutuo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Francisca ella se dedica  a la  venta de verduras en general y también a la venta de arvejas, porotos, huevos caseros y  gallina casera. Cuenta la Sra. Francisca  que el crédito que solicita de la fundación lo utilizará para la compra de verduras de todo tipo, para que de esa forma siga dándoles una buena variedad a sus clientes. Ella esta agradecida por el apoyo que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group comes from the town of Encarnación and it is composed of 16 women, who are all friends and live in the same neighborhood. They have been working with Fundación Praguaya since 2009, and they are currently in their 10th cycle, working all together with cooperation and mutual respect.
Francisca is a member of this group. She sells vegetables, as well as homegrown peas and beans and home raised chicken and their eggs. Francisca told us that the loan she is requesting to Fundación Parguaya will be used to buy different kinds of vegetables, in order to continue offering good quality products to her customers. She is grateful for the support she is receiving because it will be of great help for her.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina, 30, is married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Segundina runs a traveling business selling household products in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, Segundina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza, 27, is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Eliza runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell. She has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Eliza aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Virgen De Itati Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación,  trabajan juntas desde el año 2010,  se encuentran  en el 8º ciclo, y gracias a su trabajo en conjunto han logrado salir adelante y ayudarse todas, las unas a las otras.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Edith, ella se dedica  a la  venta de harina de maíz en su casa, cuenta que ella misma procesa el maíz, de lo que obtiene la harina fresca, la cual ofrece a sus clientes. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado formarse una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella su producto.
Cuenta la Sra. Edith   que el crédito que solicita a la fundación lo utilizará para la compra de maíz para procesarlo y así tener a la venta siempre su producto. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group was born thanks to one of its members who contacted Fundación Paraguaya. They have been working together since 2010, they are currently in their 8th cycle and thanks to their joint commitment they have succeeded in progressing in life and in helping each other out.
Edith is a member of this group and she sells cornmeal. She says she herself mills the corn to obtain the fresh cornmeal she then sells to her customers. Thanks to the good quality of her products she has succeeded in gaining established customers who always buy from her.
Edith says that the loan she is requesting to Fundación Paraguaya will be used to buy corn to mill, in order to always have cornmeal to sell. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva for the opportunity she is being granted.

loans.use: To buy corn to mill it into cornmeal.

loans.name: Helaria

texts.en: Helaria is a married woman with seven children. She is 46 years old and resides in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Helaria used her last loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Her business has grown and become successful. Now she is taking a new loan to pay labor costs for farm maintenance. She has positive hopes to be able to grow her business further.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in farm maintenance.

loans.name: Franteza

texts.en:
Franteza, 38, is married with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, running a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Franteza has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Lenisa

texts.en:
Lenisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell in her business.

Lenisa has been in this business for three years and she earns further income from a general store.

Lenisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
Cecilio tiene 65 años de edad, está casado con Dominga   de 60 años, vive en casa propia, es macatero hace más de diez años, además de eso  su esposa es artesana (fábrica de sobrecamas artesanales), tienen nueve hijos todos mayores que ya están independientes a ellos.
Cecilio es muy sacrificado debido a que tiene muchos hijos, y gracias a su esfuerzo todos son profesionales. Cuenta que su venta lo realiza casa por casa, recorriendo a pie los distintos lugares de su zona, le ayuda su esposa en la fabricación de la artesanía. Hoy en día cuenta con clientela formada por su buena atención y por la buena calidad de sus productos, necesita el crédito para la compra de un terreno que está pegado a su propiedad, en el cual desea tener algún día para su propio local.
Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Cecilio is 65 years old, he is married with Dominga, who is 60, and they live in their own house. He has nine adult children who are economically independent. He has been a “macatero” (street vendor) for more than ten years, while his wife is a craftswoman (she weaves artisan bedspreads).
Cecilio has had to make many sacrifices since he has many children, and thanks to his commitment they are all professionals. He says that he sells his products door to door, walking to the different areas of his town, and he helps his wife creating handicrafts. Nowadays he can count on established customers he has gained thanks to his good service and to the good quality of his products. He is requesting a loan to buy some land close to his property to install there his own shop one day.
He is grateful for the support he is receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy some land.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos, está solicitando un préstamo con la idea de invertir en el negocio, comprándose prendas de vestir nuevas, con estilos diferentes, blusas, camisas, pantalones, con lo que espera mantener un buen nivel de mercadería.
Él tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, el cual le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas e incrementar el inventario, esto le ha ayudado a mejorar tambien su situación económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is requesting a loan with the intention of investing in his business. He will buy new garments in different styles such as blouses, shirts, and trousers. Carlos hopes to maintain a decent level of merchandise.

He experienced positive effects with his previous loan, which helped to improve his sales and increase his inventory. This also improved the financial situation for his family.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, and trousers.

loans.name: Sérigne Ousmane

texts.fr: Sérigne ousmane gère depuis maintenant six ans une alimentation dans sa localité.Il vend des denrées alimentaires et des produits de consommation courante.Il est marié et père de trois enfants. Son commerce lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants lui permettant de subvenir à ses besoins et aux dépenses d'entretien de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500000 f pour acheter des sacs de riz, de l'huile et des denrées de première nécessité. Il ambitionne d'ouvrir une seconde boutique.
texts.en:
Sérigne Ousmane has been running a grocery store in his neighborhood for the past six years. He sells foodstuffs and staples. He is married with three children. His business brings in substantial income that allows him to support himself and his family. 

To strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 500,000F to buy bags of rice, some oil, and other household staples. His goal is to open a second location.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, some oil, and household staples.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 65 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lilia has a business selling rice grains in the Philippines. Lilia has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Sanny

texts.en:
Ma. Sanny is 49 years old and married with eight children.

Ma. Sanny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Ma. Sanny has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Sanny aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Melaluna

texts.en:
Melaluna, age 24, is married with one child who goes to school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Melaluna has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. Melaluna has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her ice cream vending business.

Melaluna has been in this business for five years. In the future, Melaluna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her ice cream vending business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Victoria has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business.

Victoria has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Victoria would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Victoriana works hard to support her family.

Victoriana has a business selling rice in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Victoriana is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Victoriana has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

loans.name: Baye Niasse

texts.fr: Baye Niasse est un jeune marié, père de deux enfants.Il exerce un commerce de cartes prépayées de téléphone des quatre opérateurs de téléphonie mobile du Sénégal.Il parcours les lieux publics comme les gares routières, les marchés pour proposer ses services.Ce travail, très difficile, lui permet quand même de générer des revenus assez importants.Il parvient ainsi à subvenir aux besoins d'entretien de sa famille et à ses propres besoins.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des cartes de crédit orange, tigo et expresso.Il ambitionne d'implanter un kiosque fixe et de recruter des vendeurs ambulants.
texts.en:
Baye Niasse is a young married man and father of two children. He sells prepaid cards from all four mobile phone companies in Senegal. He goes around public places such as bus stations and markets to offer his merchandise. This difficult work brings in substantial income that allows him to support himself and his family. 

To strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 500,000F to buy Orange, Tigo and Expresso cards. His goal is to open a fixed booth and hire street vendors.

loans.use: to buy Orange, Tigo and Expresso cards.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (general store) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to buy items like snack foods, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari.

NWTF is relisting Florentina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like snack foods, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Wilda

texts.en:
Wilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional bananas to sell for her business.

Wilda has been in this business for six years. Wilda earns additional income from a general store.

Wilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional banana to sell.

loans.name: Lesya

texts.ru: Зимой было трудное время для Леси в плане торговли. Было очень холодно и торговля была вялой. Весной дела улучшились, а к лету дело пошло очень хорошо. Поэтому нужно дополнительное вливание капитала, чтобы увеличить оборот и не упустить своего покупателя. Небольшой кредит (на этот раз Леся просит 10,000 гривен) поможет докупить необходимый товар – летние шорты и тапочки. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и продолжить благоустраивать квартиру для сына.
texts.en: Winter was a hard time for Lesya's business. It was very cold and few people came to the market. Spring saw an improvement and in summer things went back to normal. Since winter resulted in weak sales, Lesya's business requires an injection of capital so that her inventory contains items which the customers want to buy. This small loan (currently Lesya is requesting 10,000 griven) will help her purchase the necessary items - summer shorts and shoes. She hopes to be able to earn additional profits from this venture which she wants to use to help repair her son's apartment.

loans.use: to purchase summer shorts and shoes

loans.name: Jennievie

texts.en:
Jennievie is 36 years old, married, and has eight children, five in school. Jennievie works very hard to provide for her family.

Jennievie runs a sari-sari (general store) in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jennievie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Jennievie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Merlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines and earns additional income as a motorcycle operator. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell,

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 42 years old, married, and has five children.

Nancy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to buy additional grocery stock to sell.

Nancy has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns income by making nipa "woven palm mats." 

Nancy aspires to save enough money to expand her business..

loans.use: to buy additional grocery stock to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 62 years old, married, and has seven children.

She earns a living by selling rice seed in the Philippines. Anita is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional rice seed for her business.

Anita has been selling seeds for 10 years and also earns income by raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice seed for her business

loans.name: Gomersenda

texts.en:
Gomersenda is 52 years old and married with five children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Gomersenda has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail for 12 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport services.

Gomersenda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 24 years old. She is widowed with one child. She operates a beauty salon and also sells cosmetics. She has been in the business for the past three years. She gets a monthly income of KES 15,000 from the business.

This is her first term loan with KADET LTD. She was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase stock of hair weaves, oils, hair sprays and hair relaxers for her business.

She hopes to purchase a plot of land where she can build a home.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Goumbo

texts.fr: Goumbo est un agent de sécurité publique qui sert depuis plusieurs années dans l'administration.Il est marié et père de six enfants.Depuis des années, il est avec sa famille , en location et paie chaque mois une bonne partie de ses revenus à son locataire.C'est pourquoi, il a démarré la construction de sa propre maison.Il sollicite ainsi un pret de 500000f pour acheter du ciment, du fer, du sable et du béton pour terminer les travaux de la maison. Son ambition est de déménager le plus tôt possible dans son nouveau domicile.
texts.en:
Goumbo is a public safety officer who has been a civil servant for several years. He is married with six children. He and his family have been living in a rented dwelling for years, and he pays a substantial portion of his income to his landlord every month. This is what has prompted him to start building his own house. 

He is seeking a loan of 500,000F to buy cement, steel, sand and concrete to finish work on the house. His goal is to move into the family’s new home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, steel, sand and concrete.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce works hard to support her family. Joyce is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.  Joyce has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Joyce would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Air Force veteran John, 49, is a single father who decided to open his Kyle, Texas, business, Big Jon Plumbing Services, after working with major plumbing companies. John first entered the plumbing business at the age of 16 when looking for a summer job. Thereafter, he joined the Air Force where he attended plumbing classes to learn more. Upon leaving the Air Force, John received his plumbing license. He also helped build an Arizona start-up business to an established cooperation, but he was fired shortly after. That company later went out of business. After being fired from that job, John realized he could work for himself. 

John has now been in business for two years. For the time being, he works in conjunction with a helper. Passionate about work ethic, John would like to hire another person but won’t until he finds the right one. He says it’s easy to find a licensed plumber but it’s a challenge to find a licensed plumber who wants to do the job right. According to John, all his employees should properly execute a job, clean up after themselves and be honest with customers. 

To help with his expectations, John purchased a jetter with the funds he received on approval from Accion Texas Inc. He used the rest of the money to market his company. A jetter works similar to the water hoses at car wash stations but is much smaller as it is designed for pipes and drains. Other companies may bring a cable to expand a pipe’s passage after buildup gained from years of usage; however, that only treats the symptom for possibly half a year. The jetter John purchased sprays 3,000 pounds of water to clean pipe walls, which should keep pipes clean for two to three years.

The Accion loan allows for an opportunity to build credit for his business; without it, John says he would have to wait another two to three months to earn enough money to purchase the jetter, which  would put a stop to the quality he can provide his customers. For more information on his business and services, visit his company website at: www.bigjonplumbingservices.com.

loans.use: to purchase a power washer and market his business.

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Named after the Egyptian bird, which has a symbolic meaning of rising in brilliance, Benu Construction is operated in Fort Worth, Texas by 37-year-old Israel. Specializing in concrete, Israel works only on outdoor projects, such as foundation work, patios and outdoor kitchens. Benu Construction also creates concrete stamps to add décor to residential and commercial buildings.

Originally from Mexico, Israel struggled with English when he moved to Texas - which hindered his job search. Since he was unsuccessful in finding a job, Israel said he had to create a job for himself, which led to the creation of his construction company.

Depending on the size of the project, Israel employs from one to ten people. He employs two full-time and ten part-time workers. Israel works with the client instead of a general contractor because he does not have enough capital to do that. However, working this way allows for more one-on-one communication between him and his client and brings better results.

A returning client, Israel first found out about Accion Texas Inc. four years ago through the Fort Worth Chamber of Commerce, but he didn’t apply for his first loan until he moved to Houston.  This is Israel’s third loan. He plans to use it mainly to purchase cedar wood and concrete, but also to obtain concrete dyes and a concrete sealer.

The loan will give him job security, Israel said, as he will earn enough capital after his current project to go straight into work on another job. 

Israel, who is the sole provider for his wife and child, also has a website for his company. Visit it here:  benuinc.com or at http://www.concretenetwork.com/contractor/benu-construction-inc-fort-worth-tx_100513.

loans.use: to purchase materials for upcoming projects.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito is 59 years old,  married and the mother of three children. For the last 12 years, she has earned a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She also earns money on the side by selling herbal medicines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to secure the financial stability of her family by building and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Slavica

texts.en:
Slavica is a hair dresser. She is living in Kosovo in a Serbian community. Slavica is married and has two children. Slavica started to work as a hair dresser 13 years ago from her home. Slavica is requesting a loan from KosInvest to buy new hair dressing tools such as a new chair and hair creams. 

This will develop her business and increase the numbers of her clients. She uses her income to support her family. She notes that this loan will improve her business and allow her to attract more clients. In the future, she plans to develop her business more.

loans.use: To buy new hair dressing tools such as a new chair and hair creams.

loans.name: Nebojsa

texts.en:
Nebojsa is living in Kosovo in a Serbian community. He is married and has two children. The oldest is ten years old and the youngest seven years old. To support his family, he works hard with his agricultural machine on agricultural land belonging to other people in his area.
