Zonia es una mujer de 53 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus 3 hijos, lamentablemente por diversas circunstancias decidió separarse de su pareja desde hace varios años, desde entonces ella ha sido el principal soporte de su hogar, Zonia siempre ha sido una persona muy alegre, entusiasta y trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzo para sacar adelante a su familia; debido a la necesidad de trabajar y solventar los gastos de su hogar, Sonia no pudo cursar una carrera profesional pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de confección textil; en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina, el cual es el plato preferido por sus hijos.  
Por iniciativa propia y gracias al apoyo de su familia, desde hace 4 años Esther puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de confección de prendas de vestir, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias, donde puede atender hasta 10 clientes, Zonia realiza labores de reparación, compostura, corte y confección de diversas prendas, ella cree que su negocio marcha bien debido a sus buenos trabajos, así como por su trato amable y respetuoso.
Zonia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un mostrador y diversos tipos de telas; de esta manera Zonia podrá tener sus prendas de vestir exhibidas a la vista del cliente y también podrá contar con los materiales necesarios para realizar su trabajo, así ella espera poder incrementar sus ventas e ingresos económicos, para con ellos poco a poco poder realizar la construcción y acabados de su vivienda, asegurando la seguridad y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Zonia, 53, lives in the city of Pisco with her three children.  Unfortunately, due to various circumstances she decided to separate from her spouse several years ago.  Since then, she’s been the sole support for her home.  Zonia has always been a very cheerful, enthusiastic, hardworking person who focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward.  Because of the need to work and cover household expenses, Zonia was unable to study a professional career but she would have liked to have studied textile making.  In her free time she enjoys cooking and sometimes cooks the very delicious “Ají de Gallina” which is her children’s favorite dish.

Through her own initiative and with help from her family, Esther started her own clothes-making business four years ago.  She spends about 12 hours daily at work and can tend to up to 10 customers.  Zonia does repairs and designs and sews various articles of clothing.  She believes that her business is doing well because of her good work as well as the kind, respectful way she treats customers.

Zonia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy a counter and various types of fabric so that Zonia will have her articles of clothing on display in sight of her customers; she will also have on hand necessary supplies to do her work.  She hopes thus to increase her sales and income to gradually build and finish her house insuring her family’s wellbeing and safety.

loans.use: to buy a counter and fabric.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is married and has 3 kids. She is 59-years-old and lives in the Philippines. Lourdes is a farmer and she operates a vegetables production to earn her living. She has been doing this for 6 years and every month she earn 3,000.00 from this work. 

Lourdes has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is 35 years old and married. She has 3 children who are in school. Analisa works very hard to provide for her children.

Analisa is a Avon dealer in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to to purchase solar lamp. She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Analisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Norady

texts.en:
Norady is 56 years old and has 4 children. She is married and one of her children is in school. Norady is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Norady has been raising pigs for 20 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Norady would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is married and has 11 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cherry is 47 years old and has 7 children who are in school.

Cherry has a rice retail business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. Cherry has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tools used in repairing shoes.

loans.name: Waly

texts.fr: Waly est un homme marié et père de quatre enfants.Il exerce un commerce de sel dans sa localité.Il s'approvisionne chez les collecteurs de sel au niveau des grandes lagunes de la région et revend le produit en gros à des commerçants détaillants. Cette activité lui rapporte des bénéfices substantiels qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins d'entretien de sa famille et à ses propres besoins. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter 300 sacs de sel. Son ambition est de constituer une entreprise de collecte, de traitement et de commercialisation du sel.
texts.en:
Waly is a married father of four children, and works selling salt in his town. He gets his supplies from the salt collectors around the region’s large lakes, and resells his product in bulk to retail sellers. This business gives him substantial income, which allows him to provide for his family and meet his own needs. 

In order to increase his working capital, Waly has requested a loan of 300,000 francs to buy 300 bags of salt. His ambition is to create a business to collect, process and sell salt.

loans.use: To buy 300 bags of salt.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de quatre enfants dont les trois vont à l'école.Depuis maintenant sept ans, Awa exerce un commerce de tissus.Elle tient au grand marché de sa localité un magasin de vente de tissus modernes et traditionnels.Ce commerce lui rapporte des revenus consistants , surtout en période de fête.Ces revenus lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins et d'entretenir sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 400 000f pour acheter des tissus.
texts.en:
Awa is a married woman and mother of four children, three of whom go to school. For seven year she has worked selling fabrics, and has a store in her town’s large market where she sells modern and traditional fabrics. This business provides her with consistent income, particularly during holiday time.

With her income Awa can provide for her family and meet her own needs. To increase her working capital, she has requested a loan of 400,000 francs to buy fabrics.

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: Chokola Group

texts.fr: Madame Nshobole est une cliente dynamique d’une association d’affaire Chokola. Elle est âgée de 33ans, mariée à un déclarant en douane; est  mère de 7 enfants tous scolarisés.  Elle est vendeuse des  pagnes  depuis  2007 et  est  au 2ème cycle de crédit chez Hekima.  Le crédit sollicité va lui servir à l’approvisionnement  de 10pièces de pagnes.  La cliente souhaite voir ses enfants finir leurs études et devenir grossistes. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima et prie Dieu de le bénir.
texts.en:
Nshobole is a dynamic client of the Chokola business association. She is 33 years of age and is married to a customs broker. She has seven children, all of whom are at school.

Nshobole has worked selling traditional wrap-around cloth (known as “pagnes”) since 2007, and this is her second loan with Hekima. She plans to use her loan to purchase supplies, specifically 10 lengths of traditional wrap-around cloths. She wants to see her children finish their studies, and also wants to become a wholesaler. She also thanks Hekima and asks for God’s blessings.

loans.use: To buy 10 lengths of traditional wrap-around cloth.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Shukrani Group

texts.fr: La cliente Byabagula est une femme ambitieuse d’un groupe de crédit Shukrani. Âgée de 52ans est mariée à un chômeur  et mère des  12 enfants tous scolarisés.  Elle est vendeuse des  souliers usagés depuis 2006  et  est  au 13ème cycle de crédit chez Hekima.  Le crédit sollicité lui servira d'acheter 3 ballons des souliers usagés.  La cliente souhaite construire une maison d'habitation familiale dans l’avenir.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima.
texts.en:
Byabagula is an ambitious woman who forms part of the Shukrani borrowing group. Aged 52, she is married to a man who is unemployed, and is mother to 12 children who are all at school. She has sold used shoes since 2006, and this is her 13th loan cycle with Hekima. 

Byabagula plans to use her loan to buy used shoes. She wants to build a family home in the future, and gives her thanks to Hekima.

loans.use: To buy three bales of used shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza  fue formado en la de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, es integrado por 19 señoras emprendedoras, las mismas son mujeres humildes y trabajadoras que buscan un mejor porvenir para ellas y sus familias.
Margarita es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, como ser jeans, remeras, pantalones, abrigos y demás. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela ya que sus productos siempre son de muy buena calidad y a buen precio.
Solicita el crédito para surtir su local con prendas, ya que quiere surtirse, pues tiene pedidos con los cuales quiere poder cumplir.
texts.en:
La Esperanza Community Bank, formed in the city of Caaguazú, is made up of 19 enterprising, modest, and hardworking women who are looking for a better future for themselves and their children.

Margarita is one of the members.  She sells clothing, such as jeans, t-shirts, pants, coats, and other garments.  She says she has very good customers because her products are always high quality and well priced.

She is requesting the loan to supply her store with clothing because she wants to stock up, to be able to fill her requests.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 34 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham province. With his common-law wife, also his business partner, he is supporting three school-aged children. Sok and his wife work together cultivating rice for their livelihoods. Rice agriculture is the sole income source for Sok’s family.

In the previous month, Sok bought a threshing machine on credit from his supplier in order to improve his business activities. With this machine Sok can provide threshing services to local villagers for additional income. And now, he would like a loan from HKL and Kiva in the amount of KHR 2,000,000 to pay his outstanding balance to his supplier. He is very grateful for the financial support given to him to further develop his business and help his family.

loans.use: to pay his outstanding balance to his supplier.

loans.name: Evgenia

texts.ru:
Евгения замужем. У нее две дочки. Евгения имеет собственный бизнес.

Евгения имеет свою торговую точку  на центральном рынке города. Она продает женскую одежду: тенниски,футболки, юбки и брюки. Опыт работы Евгении 12 лет. Она трудолюбивая и ответственная.  

Евгения просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 6000 гривен на закупку сезонного товара - одежды и обуви . Кредит поможет ей увеличить прибыль и тем самым улучшить быт семьи.
texts.en:
Evgenia is married and has two daughters. She operates her own business: at a retail spot located within the city's central market, she sells women's clothing - shirts, T-shirts, skirts and trousers. Evgenia has 12 years of experience in this area. She is a hard-working and responsible person.

Evgenia is requesting a loan of 6000 hryvnia to purchase seasonal merchandise, such as clothing and footwear. This loan will help Evgenia increase her profits and thereby improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing and footwear

loans.name: Luisa Del Rosario

texts.es:
Luisa del Rosario tiene 43 años de edad es cadada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto las Blancas, Perteneciente al Cantón ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica  a labores pecuarias y agrícolas

Luisa del Rosario se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, semillas, insecticidas, líquido para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para poder seguir trabajando en la agricultura.

El sueño es pode darle los estudios a los hijos para que sean profesionales.

En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar a los hijos.
texts.en:
Luisa del Rosario, 43, is married and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children in Ventanas, in the province of Bolívar.  She is a member of 26 de Noviembre Communal Bank, located in the district of Blancas, in Ventanas Canton.  This bank is dedicated to ranching and agricultural jobs.

Luisa del Rosario works growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  She is requesting the loan to buy urea, seeds, insecticide, and weed killer.  With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs to continue working in agriculture.

Her dream is to be able to give her children an education so they can be professionals.  In her free time she likes to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, insecticide, and weed killer.

loans.name: Union De Cabecera Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Unión de Cabecera” está conformado por 10 mujeres que son muy trabajadoras y responsables; viven en un pueblito muy pequeño que lleva por nombre Cabecera, lugar donde las personas son muy humildes y sencillas. El nombre lo eligieron los integrantes ya que se consideran un grupo unido y también por el lugar en donde viven. 

María Josefa o Doña Jose, como le dicen de cariño, es integrante del grupo; tiene 37 años de edad y está casada desde hace 13 años con el señor Fernando quien trabaja de mecánico. Juntos han formado una familia con dos niños los cuales estudian. Doña Jose platica que ya había estado en el grupo aunque salió por un tiempo, pero nuevamente vuelve a integrarse él. Esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar 2 cerdos y comenta que si le sobra un poco de dinero comprará block y lámina para hacer un corral ya que por el momento no tiene un lugar destinado para los animalitos. Cuenta que aunque es la primera vez que criará cerdos, está muy contenta de iniciar con la actividad ya que desea ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su única dificultad es que por el momento no tiene un chiquero para instalar a los puercos pero espera que con el crédito pueda construirlo. Para Doña Jose, una de sus metas es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar para que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida; le gustaría que sus hijos terminaran de estudiar una carrera. Sus ganancias le ayudarán significativamente ya que podrá ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, la educación de sus hijos, entre otras cosas. 

El grupo "Unión de Cabecera" está conformado por: Silvia, María Imelda y Ángela quienes invertirán en sus tiendas de abarrotes; Flora comprara pollos y guajolotes (palabra más usada para referirse a los pavos) para cría y venta; Juan comprara borregos también para cría y venta; Victoria invertirá en papelería y Ma Concepción y Sandra invertirán en pollos para cría y venta. Finalmente, Doña Manuela comprará puerquitos y elotes preparados para venta. Todos los integrantes están muy agradecidas con Vision Fund (FRAC) y KIVA por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
The group “Unión de Cabecera” consists of 10 hardworking and responsible members. They live in a very small town called Cabecera, a place where the people are humble and modest. The name was chosen by the members because they consider themselves to be a unified group and they also included the place where they live.

María Josefa, or Doña Jose as she is affectionately called, is a member of this group. She is 37 years old and has been married for 13 years to Sr. Fernando, who works as a mechanic. They formed a family that includes two children who are in school. Doña Jose explains that she was with the group, left for a while, and then returned and rejoined the group. This time she is requesting a loan in order to buy two pigs. She says that if she had a little extra money, she would buy blocks and sheets of lumber for building a pen since has no place to keep the animals at the moment. Doña Jose says that this is the first time she will be raising pigs, so she is very pleased to be starting this activity because she wants to help her husband with the household expenses. Her only difficulty at the moment is that she does not have a pen to hold the pigs, but she hopes to get a loan in order to build one. For Doña Jose, one of her goals is to see her children finish their studies so that they can have better opportunities in life. She would like to see them study for a degree. Her earnings will be a significant help with the household expenses, her children's education, and other things.

The group “Unión de Cabecera” also includes the following members: • Silvia, María Imelda, and Ángela will invest in their grocery stores. • Flora will buy chickens and turkeys to raise and sell. • Juan will buy sheep to raise and sell. • Victoria will invest in stationery. • Ma Concepción and Sandra will invest in chickens to raise and sell. • Doña Manuela will buy pork cutlets and corn on the cob to prepare and sell. All of the members are extremely grateful to Vision Fund (FRAC) and to Kiva for providing this loan.

loans.use: to buy two pigs.

loans.name: Las Martínez Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Martínez y está conformado por cuatro mujeres con deseos de superación.

Una de las integrantes es la señorita Nathaly Soledad, mejor conocida como Nathaly, de 19 años de edad quien se dedica a la serigrafía (estampados  para playeras). Nathaly dice que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es hacer los diseños de los estampados, ya que pone en práctica lo que más le gusta que es la creatividad. Afortunadamente, realiza su trabajo desde casa, aunque uno de sus sueños es tener un local y darse a conocer por su trabajo y empeño en sus estampados. Nathaly menciona que las características que debe tener una persona  para hacer el trabajo que ella desempeña es saber rotular, tener creatividad y ser amable con los clientes para que ellos mismos la recomienden. Además, Nathaly se considera una persona especial por su empaño para que los proyectos tengan la mejor calidad y sobre todo por que tiene la ilusión de superarse y mejorar su negocio. Nathaly pidió un crédito para comprar más pinturas para rotular, máquinas para coser y una computadora para hacer sus diseños.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son:

Cecilia Nohemi - se dedica a la venta de manualidades.
Yaneth Lourdes - se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo.
Merab Aide - se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo.

Le dan las gracias Vision Found por ayudar a los jóvenes que desean tener su negocio y con el tiempo engrandecerlo.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Martinez," and it is made up of 4 women who have a desire to succeed.  

One of the members is Nathaly Soledad, better known as Nathaly.  She is 19 years old and has a silk-screen business (putting designs on T-shirts).  Nathaly says that what she likes about her job is making the designs for the prints, because it allows her to put her creativity into practice, which she enjoys.  Fortunately, she is able to do her work from her house, although one of her dreams is to have her own store and become well-known for her work and the care she puts into her prints.  Nathaly mentions that the characteristics that a person needs to do this type of job include: knowing how to letter, having creativity, and being friendly to the customers so that they will also recommend your business to others.  Also, Nathaly is considered to be a special person for the effort she puts into her projects so that they will be of the best quality, and most of all for her hopes of improving and excelling with her business.  Nathaly asked for a loan to buy more paints for lettering, sewing machines and a computer to make her designs.  The other members of the group are: Cecelia Nohemi, who sells hand-made items, Yaneth Lourdes, who sells shoes through a catalog, and Merab Aide, who also sells shoes through a catalog.  They thank the Vision Foundation for helping the young people who want to have their own businesses and expand them over time.

loans.use: to buy silk-screen printing supplies

loans.name: Vandy's Group

texts.en: Vandy, 44, is a mother of eight children and lives in a rural area of Thmor Koul district, Battambang Province. To earn a living for her big family, she and her husband have been farming on four hectares of farmland for 12 years. However, the lack of working capital to plow the farmland and buy fertilizer remain the main challenges for her family. Vandy has been with VisionFund since 2011 and successfully repaid a previous loan. The loan has enabled her to improve her living standard and to buy a mini tractor for plowing her rice farm. She now is applying for new loan with VisionFund with her group member who has been with VisionFund for four cycles. As the group leader, she is requesting a new loan in the amount of KHR 1,400,000 and she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer (KHR 600,000) and hire a laborer to to plow her farmland (KHR 800,000). She hopes to receive a high crop yield and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire a laborer for plowing the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, detergents and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more hot dogs to sell.

loans.name: Kenjekul

texts.ru:
Кенжекул – участник группы «Актан», ей 33 года, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. Кенжекул в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи 13 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний  день  хозяйство Кенжекул приносит около 12,000 сом в месяц. Также, Кенжекул занимается выращиванием и перепродажей груш и яблок.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кенжекул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Кенжекул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Kenjekul is member of the Aktan group. She is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children. 13 years ago, Kenjekul started raising livestock and growing crops, thereby providing the main source of income for her family. After launching her business with a 20,000 som (KGS) investment, Kenjekul presently earns roughly 12,000 som per month. She also grows and sells pears and apples.

In order to continue developing her business, Kenjekul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase young livestock. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Fredesvinda Elisa

texts.es:
Fedesvinda vive en la calurosa ciudad e Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima caluroso y es una ciudad en la cual se pueden visitar muchos atractivos turísticos como las Líneas de Nazca, las pirámides de Cahuachi, el cementerio de Chauchilla, los acueductos de Cantalloc, entre otros, en los cuales podemos admirar lo grandioso de la cultura Nazca y en los que podemos despejarnos. Fredesvinda es madre de 5 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 37, 33, 33 (gemelos),24 y 15.  Fredesvinda ha sabido sacar adelante a sus hijos sola ya que el padre de sus hijos la abandono y desde ese momento se convirtió en madre para sus hijos y por los cuales ella ha trabajo y sigue trabajando en especial por su menor hijo para darle una vida digna y que sea una persona de bien ya que los mayores ya están encaminados. Cuando Fredesvinda tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Seco de Res” y en ocasiones le gusta leer en especial los periódicos para poder saber lo que pasa en su ciudad. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo estudio hasta el primer grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado terminar la escuela.

Día a día a Fredesvinda trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras en el campo ferial de su ciudad, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender diariamente alrededor de 15 clientes; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque  es muy amable con los clientes y ofrece  productos de calidad y precios cómodos.

Fredesvindad está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comparar mercadería para su negocio como zapallo al por mayor, tuna, papa, cebolla, camote, queso, entre otros; así de esta manera ella podrá tener  mayor variedad de productos y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir creciendo y luchar cada da para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Sembrar en la pequeña parcela que posee y y ser una comerciante mayorista”.
texts.en:
Fedesvinda lives in the warm city of Nazca.  The city is known for having a warm climate, and it is a city where you can visit lots of tourist attractions like the Nazca Lines [extensive hieroglyphics that according to some studies were used by the ancient Nazca culture as an astronomical calendar], the Cahuachi Pyramids, the Chauchilla Cemetary, and the Cantalloc Aquaducts.  These attractions, among others, allow us to admire and enjoy the magnificent Nazca culture.

Fredesvina has five children, ages 37, 33, 33, (twins), 24, and 15.  Fredesvina has known how to get her children ahead by herself.  This is because the father of her children abandoned her.  From that moment on she was mother and father to her children.  It is for them that she has worked and continues working.  She does this especially for her youngest child in order to give him a decent life and so that he becomes a good person.  The older children have already started their own lives.

When Fredesvinda has free time she really likes to eat one of her favorite dishes “Seco de Res” [beef stew], which is delicious.  Sometimes she likes to read, especially the newpapers in order to be able to know what is happening in her city.  Due to her parents’ small amount of financial resources, she only went to school until the first year of high school.  However, she would have liked to finish school.

From day to day Fredesvinda works in her business selling vegetables at the fair grounds in her city.  She works around ten hours a day in her business, and she is able to tend to around 15 customers.  She believes that it is going well for her in her business because she is very kind to the customers, she offers quality products, and she has affordable prices.

Fredesvindad is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy merchandise for her business.  She will buy things like wholesale pumpkin, prickly pears, potatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, and cheese, among others.

This way she will be able to have a greater variety of products and improve her income.  This will allow her to continue growing and laboring every day to be able to make her biggest dream come true:  “To plant on the small parcel that she has and to be a wholesale merchant.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise like wholesale pumpkin, prickly pears, potatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, and cheese, among others

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon is from the Prey Chor district of Kompong, Cham province. She is 57 years old, widowed, and has a married child. Chuon lives with her daughter and her son-in-law in a house since her husband passed away. She is hard-working woman who pays full attention to her rice farming business to earn income. She also buys and collects palm leaves for a weaving business and transports her finished products to the marketplace. 

Due to the lack of the family-owned vehicle, Chuon has encountered difficulties in transporting her products. She is asking for a loan of KHR 500,000 to purchase a used motorcycle to support her business as well as for personal use. She hopes to receive this loan as her fifth cycle loan. She is an honest client of HKL and she already paid off her previous loans successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle to support her business as well as for personal use.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замира – участник группы «Актан», ей 39 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Замира в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи 15 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 50,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний  день  хозяйство Замиры приносит около 12,000 сом в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Замира  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Zamira is a member of the Aktan group. She is 39 years old, married, and is raising 3 children. 15 years ago, Zamira began raising livestock and growing crops as the main source of income for her family. After launching her business with an investment of 50,000 som (KGS), she presently earns around 12,000 som per month from sales of milk and dairy products.

In order to continue developing her business, Zamira has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to purchase young livestock. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
This is Solidad, 60, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.   
                          
Solidad operates a cellphone accessories retail business. What she basically does is buy accessory items from wholesalers and sells them per piece/pack with a profit. Products are cell phone accessories like head phones, cell phone holders and other such products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling price and the many options she offers. She also offers perfumes and wallets in her store.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of cellphone accessory products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Solidad dreams of having her own permanent place where she can put up her store. She hopes to expand her business soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of cellphone accessories and products needed in her business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 40 years old and is married. She takes good care of her seven school-aged children. 

Judith owns a multi-cab to transport passengers. The multi-cab has the capacity to carry 12-14 persons to certain destinations. Over three years, Judith's  good management has made her stand out. At the end of the month, she gets PHP 2,000 which she uses for day-to-day expenditures and other wants as well.

 Judith joined GDMPC to have use of financial services. She has applied for PHP 4,800 to purchase multi-cab accessories to improve the service's appearance. Keeping the Multi-cab in good running condition brings in good income for the family. Judith hopes to get adequate income from this investment so she can buy another mutli-cab to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase multi-cab accessories to improve the service's appearance

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married, 31 years of age, and cares for her two school-aged children. In her married life, Jovencia has allowed herself to discover her capability to engage into business activities, particularly raising bananas - making it a central source of income for the family. Every month, she makes about PHP 7000.

 Earlier this year, she joined GDMPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 10,500 from the cooperative to purchase fertilizer for the nourishment and fast growth of her bananas. Jovencia  hopes for prosperous years of business undertakings. She plans to buy more piglets to raise and eventually sell to make good cash inflow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the nourishment and fast growth of her bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, detergents and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, detergent, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks, and beverages
